Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: a7correll
Reviews.Content: We loved the beautiful room and the service was outstanding and not stuffy! A hard balance for many hotels of this caliber. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect SPA Experience with terrible Concierge Desk finish”
Reviews.Author: Yamina2011
Reviews.Content: Last weekend me and my boyfriend went to the Four Seasons to treat ourselves in the SPA. Unfortunately the rooms were all booked so that we couldn't stay there. We had a superb experience in the SPA. Very expensive but definately worth every EURO. Thanks for this wonderful experience. After that we went upstairs to the concierge desk to ask for a personal shopper. The concierge kindly let us know because we weren't guests of the hotel he couldn't help us with the request. He recommended us to go to our own hotel's concierge desk. (If the 4 seasons staff want to follow up with their employee, please talk to the South American colleague with black glasses frame) I mean after spending nearly 2K at the SPA I was very disappointed to get this kind of answer. Especially after having this wonderful experience there. All in all SPA was perfect, Concierge Desk a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nefeli f
Reviews.Content: We have been 5 times to George V and we really love this hotel!!!! I think it is the best city hotel in Europe!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in World”
Reviews.Author: Cooper l
Reviews.Content: Just finished a week at The George V. It is head and shoiulders above the other high end hotels in Paris as they have perfect environment with the perfect staff. Genuine warmth and authenticity are so rare and they have it. This Hotel is a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: edinchattanooga
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff were wondeful and very helpful. The floral displays were like nothing I have ever seen Orchids were Hanging from wire in the Courtyard as if the were floating

Reviews.Title: “Not the real Paris i know”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything bad about the hotel besides that it luck something. It took me a while to reallise what. It lucks the true authentic spirit of Paris. It is cosmopolitan Luxury Hotel that when u r in it u tend to forget at which part of the world u r actually in..

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: MarcDW
Reviews.Content: The very best city hotel in Europe. And maybe even in the world. Some city hotels in Asia might be as good, but none other in Europe. Extremely attentive and friendly service. The staff is really very well trained. They recognize you from stay to stay, and even if they don't and it just appears on their screen (at checkin for instance) they are really good at making you feel welcome again. They go the extra mile to please you with unexpected service, surpassing you expectations regularly. Rooms, public areas and amenities are top level. The restaurants are excellent too, but very (read this as very very) expensive. Top location. Who wouldn't want to live there permanently?

Reviews.Title: “March trip”
Reviews.Author: kenneth186338
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was good as all other reviews state, good shower/bath area. Breakfast was not good. I cannot believe an hotel of this quality has such poor quality coffee, can't they buy decent beans and use a mocka maker to get good coffee, it was worse than american filter coffee you get in new york. I drank half a cup and left it. AWFUL. And the coffee was only luke warm. This shouldnt be happening. Huge disappointment. Had mixed bread basket, also a disappointment, crossiant should be light and fluffy, these were greasy, doughy inside and just poor. Who is supplying these? supermarket does bettter. I would have expected much better. This is Paris how is it possible to get such poor croissiants, again I left most, not appetising Thankfully the room has Nespresso for coffee, they should use these for breakfast. Breakfast was not good, I've had miles better in Scandinavian hotels and other I have stayed in in the far east. I should have stayed at the Bristol Couldnt get into the bar, much too small for a hotel of this size. Many of the tables "reserved" at it was 11.45pm. Very dated piano music, is this what people want? It's a dated idea of background entertainment/almost bordering on muzak This is a great looking hotel, but I think its trading on what it was not want it can be. A case of from over substance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Timothy M
Reviews.Content: George V is quite simply the best hotel in Paris and the Four Seasons flagship hotel. The rooms, service, location are all absolutely amazing. There is no reason to stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel On The Planet”
Reviews.Author: George817
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Georges V for years. We travel very frequently to international destinations, and have our favorites country-by-country, and overall. Very, very few hotels even approach the standards of this one. I do not have enough superlatives in my vocabulary to do it justice. The price is steep, but the value is incredible. On any level someone might want to compare--food and drink, service, room quality, attention to minute detail--this hotel has no peer. Their Ambassador employees are incredible (just think about something and they will provide it). I'm convinced that their Concierges can arrange anything. For me, the George V sets the bar for luxury hotels. You'll never regret staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Grandiose ,lacking soul.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1953
Reviews.Content: Grand opulenence ,exquisite decor and furnishings ,expensive,splendid,etc etc . We stayed over Christmas and enjoyed our executive room even if it was a little dated and the bathroom floor unheated.But ,for us ,it was all a bit soulless and lacked warmth and friendliness found in other Four Seasons.I wouldn't want to make a big issue of it but on two occasions there was nobody on the door to get us a cab or welcome us back.We were left with the impression that if you flout your wealth,dress expensively,then you will get their attention.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced and slow service”
Reviews.Author: kjell magne n
Reviews.Content: For this pricelevel you would expeckt top service and at least free internet. We struggled for two days to get propper internet and that is hard when you are in a hotel working. Service was slow, 30 min just to pay your bar bill. I will chose another hotel next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Paris Property”
Reviews.Author: RCarrollLA
Reviews.Content: Experiencing the George V Paris is like that of an elite palace. The service and staff are five-star, and you pay for this special treatment, but the hotel is what travel memories are made of. RCarroll California

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedBusTrav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! It is immaculate and so beautifully furnished. The service is outstanding but very comfortable and sincere. The Le Cinq restaurant is a must - elegant and gorgeous food and service. Although this hotel costs more than what most people, including me, would typically spend, it is worth it at least one time and then if possible on special occasions. Oh, and almost forgot, the spa is stunning - beautiful to look at and has everything you could want to relax and indulge. If you cannot afford to stay in the hotel, I recommend Le Cinq for dinner and the spa for a day!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this wonderul Paris hotel! Excellent service, wonderful rooms, great food, A !”
Reviews.Author: jackdella
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in Paris! We loved every minute of our stay at this luxurious hotel. So romantic, elegant and beautiful with top-notch service.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: vayoona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights , our room was a bit small but very elegant , clean and comfortable . We were there last November so the hotel from inside and outside was shining with Christmas lighting which was done so beautifully . Also the location was excellent just few steps form the brand names boutiques .

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In the World”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Hotels are usually the best you can find but George V is the crown jewel. Within minutes any employee seems to know your name. Service is incredible. The room decor of course is without fault. The concierges are wthout peer. To stay anywhere else in Paris would be an error in judgement.

Reviews.Title: “Got to be up there as one of the best”
Reviews.Author: mronion
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad here, well apart from the price....luxury isn't cheap....from the flowers in the lobby to the staff, the rooms and the fab restaurant this place has it all.....took our 2 year old in le cinq and staff were superb, taking photos of her in chefs hat etc.....classy yet relaxed...can't recommend enough

Reviews.Title: “Perspective....”
Reviews.Author: jezwilliman
Reviews.Content: Ok I think some of the reviews need to be written by people that stay in these kinds of hotels as a matter of course , not for a honeymoon or special anniversary! Most folks then say these hotels are amazing etc etc!! Not that this hotel is bad, or is in a bad location. Neither is true! Certainly the spa is well equipped and the staff generally are helpful and polite. But amazing or outstanding? Words I wouldn't use. The bar is often full and unable to serve guests because it is too small. The same true of the restaurant if there is a special occasion such as valentines etc. Other than that it's not a bad place to base yourself if you are in town for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “The Definition of World Class”
Reviews.Author: TravelLarry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is magical perfection. The service is beyond. The rooms are luxe. The location is ideal for business or leisure. I am so glad I had a chance to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: esraparin_12
Reviews.Content: Superb experience in all senses from location to the rooms, fantastic flowers

Reviews.Title: “Life in the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: SilvernomadSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a fabulous suite on the fourth floor -- stunningly appointed -- and had a tough time pulling ourselves outside to see Paris!! The bathroom, by the way, is the best we've ever had in France and we've travelled to the country extensively. The hotel's spa is like something from a dream. Food is also divine. One of the two greatest club sandwiches I've ever had was in the Bar. The fine dining gave portions which actually defeated us -- a chicken dish where the chicken is served multiple ways over a couple of courses. We actually had to turn the last course away as we had NO room left and took our dessert souffle to the room to enjoy later. MMmmm.

Reviews.Title: “This is a top class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboyclash
Reviews.Content: This is a top class hotel & all the time we were made to feel extremely comfortable & very welcome - one of the best we've stayed in. In our opinion up there with Sandy Lane, Brown's in London & the Mardeval

Reviews.Title: “Sheer indulgence!”
Reviews.Author: Meloie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in a deluxe room for approx 800euro/n. It was a nice,long and quite spacious room overlooking Avenue George V. It wasn't over-the-top/gaudy unlike some of the more expensive suites shown on the website. The welcome drink was a great little desert wine and not the traditional champagne. The quality of the room service food wasn't disappointing for once. Indulged in a 20euro milkshake in the bar. Yeah, it was pretty extravagant with all the bells and whistles one could imagine for a milkshake. Staff were all polite and helpful. There were however too many 'oil-oligarchs' but too be expected from a hotel of this opulence and location I suppose (1 block away from Rue Montaigne).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to live!!!”
Reviews.Author: PiguetLoic
Reviews.Content: The first impression was amazing! Everything is on the high level!!! From myself a 5 Stars rating confirmed. Room quality is awesome, the design and the comfort refers to the FOUR SEASONS standards! Very peaceful and the sleep quality is perfect. You can finally rest after a hard working day. Rooms are very clean and fully equipped. The service and a F&B is and was amazing! All the dishes that we've tried were cooked perfectly and served with high quality! If you are searching for a good place where to stay, I strongly suggest you Four Seasons Hotel George V Paris! :)

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite restoration and spectacular service”
Reviews.Author: Travelotely
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons George V is magnificent. Every attention to all details. If you would like the ultimate in luxury, this is the place to stay. My first stay here was just prior to the opening of the hotel to the general public. It was Christmas / New Year's Eve of 1999 and a magical experience. The most recent time was 2011 and the hotel is even better than I remember. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable and no request goes unfulfilled. I love this property.

Reviews.Title: “CHARM.”
Reviews.Author: sarahshaqra
Reviews.Content: legendary service at this charming hotel... when you go george V in paris u can NEVER go back... it has a charm to it and always interesting flower arrangements... rooms have a palace feel to them i love the silk material they use with furniture and curtains.... the french toast is soo delicious, i order it extra crispy but not burned.. somtimes the edges are burned. I stayed in deluxe room, junior suit, executive suit.... i would not change the delux room cuz suits are too expensive not worth the money they r small and nothing special really...

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: luxurytravelguru
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful property and ties for first place in my book with the Florence and Hong Kong properties. The meet and greet at the airport is a nice extravagance, being met plane side and also at the hotel door with check-in formalities taking place in the guest room, is delightful. However, I would not recommend the return service as it provides little over and above a regular taxi service. If I'm to otherwise nit pick - the doormen are occasionally surly, the concierge a little off hand and housekeeping ignore the "do not disturb sign" call management, who wake you up to see when you want your room serviced - although they cannot get to your room before 4pm and so call when leaving in the morning if you want to return to a freshly made bed in the afternoon- otherwise PERFECTION.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: morgan m
Reviews.Content: Local Travel agency that i have been booking with for years GlobalFares.com has booked both a flight and hotel for me for half the price . Upon our arrival at the Hotel it was obvious this is going to be a great trip , we asked to be upgraded to a suite , the suite was absolutely amazing , the piano bar in the hotel is great ,the restaurant is a 5* experience , and the service is on the whole other level AMAZING!!!! Thank you Global Fares and Thank you Four Season for this great experience

Reviews.Title: “The 8th Wonder of the World!!”
Reviews.Author: HotelTaxMan
Reviews.Content: This has to be by far and away the most opulent hotel experience we have had the pleasure of. The Spa was surreal- a slice of paradise in the middle of Paris! Even if you do not manage to stay at the hotel it would be a crime to not go there for the afternoon tea experience which was incredible! Our trip to Paris will be unforgettable courtesy of George V!!;-)

Reviews.Title: “Go! Its the best in Paris and amongst the very best in the world...”
Reviews.Author: Goodmorning2U_11
Reviews.Content: We have been very fortunate to stay several times at the Four Seasons and are so glad to return when we are in Paris. My most recent stay, was no different, only better! I don't know how the team at the George V manages to improve the guest experience every time, but they do. Much has been said about the amazing service, rooms, spa, and food so I will try to report on only those parts of my experience which are not so often commented upon. Public Decor for the Holidays: The first thing I noticed when I walked into the lobby was the warm light from Christmas trees made out of light. This is simply magical and very appropriate for Paris, the City of Lights! When I walked out to the courtyard I saw a forest of perfect evergreens with another tree of light glowing in the middle. I'm not one to be effusive about flower arrangements but this is really special. We didn't stay during Christmas or New Years this year but will now look forward to planning a stay there during this time in the future. Service: I arrived very early in the morning but Celine at the front desk was very gracious about welcoming me and was very sincere in her efforts/hope that my room would be ready as soon as possible. I headed straight for my favorite place to have breakfast, Le V. Food: Amongst the very best breakfasts in the world. If you enjoy breakfast you absolutely must leave the wonderful comfort of your room and dine in the Le V. They offer an amuse bouche of creme brulee in the mornings, and fresh brewed as well as Nespresso to get the day started right. If you enjoy eggs benedict this is the place to enjoy it. I'm a bit of a connoisseur and have tried them at the Crillon, Mandarin Oriental, Ritz, Lauderee...and Le V is the best! Don't miss out on their hot chocolate with natural vanilla or cinnamon options. For dinner I didn't feel like dressing up so enjoyed the V menu in my room. I highly recommend this option (and the lunch menu is great value/delicious). Spa: I had four massages and a facial. Frankly, I'm not the same person I was before the treatments. I still feel fantastic and its been two weeks since I've been back to the States. Unfortunately, I do not remember the name of the young woman who gave me the men's facial but she was superb. It was my first facial but not my last. Tip: all of the massage therapists are best in class. Some places I worry that I'm not going to get a good therapists, not here. I don't know if they all went to the same school but they use a similarly peerless technique. The manager of the spa deserves every accolade. And, if she isn't in charge of a region for the Four Seasons spas (of if they don't do this yet) they should promote her. The gym is also very well attended and equipped. If you have time definitely relax in the sauna, steam room, and relaxation room. Rooms: The hotel is currently going through a soft renovation. The style is still very classic but is updated. I will miss the damask and the gilt bronze door pulls but the added technology, new mirrors, tvs, are a big improvement. They are doing a fantastic job with the renovation but I wouldn't worry about getting a renovated room (there isn't a big difference). Tips: make reservations in the evening if you would like to eat at the Galleria or the Bar, they will do their best to welcome you but they are often to capacity. It is worth flying to Paris from around the world if but only to enjoy the chocolate souffle with cassis. If you are going to Paris this is the best option, by a wide margin. For a quick comparison-I had breakfast and toured the rooms and spa of the Mandarin Oriental and I feel sorry for the owners of this property. It just doesn't compare to the George V and charges similar prices. I also toured Le Meurice which is a lovely hotel but again felt that it doesn't compare to the Four Seasons (i.e. I stood waiting at the front desk for more than a few minutes before anyone asked me if I had been helped and the spa is a disaster). If you are going to Paris, stay at the George V, you are sure to have a magical stay in the City of Lights.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best!”
Reviews.Author: JanValasek
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris, first time away from the kids with my wife and we could not stay in a better hotel. From the arrival time to the departure time I can not point out anything negative! Staff is attentive to any of your needs, flower arrangements around the building is speechless, hotel room is just what would you expect from 5* hotel. Top rated experience from our stay? Eggs Benedicts at the Le Cinq restaurant. Eggs are poached to the perfection, nicely round and after cutting thru this small beauty the egg yolk just runs out! Still wondering how do they prepare them to this perfect shape? Love this property and we will be definitely back but next time with our kids - before heading off to the Disney destination!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out about noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mykosher
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel Yes there is wonderful service, food, atmosphere, clean, rooms, location...yes its a palace But building (Hotel Prince de Galles) on the north side of the hotel is closde for heavy renovation. There is noise and vibration all day long. So ask absolutly a room on corner Georges 5 av. and Pierre 1er av. or wait the end of renovation on the side before your next booking.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame, who should have stayed independent”
Reviews.Author: OomSchalck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exquisite. One of the very best in the world. I am maybe spoilt, because I knew it in the old days, before it became part of the Four Seasons. Things change, as they will, and must and maybe I am looking at the past with nostalgic eyes. In any case if you did not know it then you cannot travel back in time. Let me not deter you. You will find it sumptuous and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Haut-Brion
Reviews.Content: A superb Christmas day lunch was complemented by a wonderful room and exceptional standards of service - with prices accordingly. But there was never any question of our not receiving value for money, as this hotel was excellent in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby and staff”
Reviews.Author: sherrie l
Reviews.Content: The rooms are of a great size with a two person tub. The romantic décor is to my taste food id the hotel was average.The staff seemed to have some trouble with my accent which I found really strange. Overall great for a weekend stay as the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: TravlerWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Before spending a few nights at the George V in October, I thought—really, secretly hoped—that I would be among those who would shower effusive praise on the hotel. I wanted to fall in love with this storied hotel as so many other reviewers seemingly have. Unfortunately, my experience left a lot to be desired. The George V has built a reputation on providing its guests with unparalleled service, but it is precisely in this area that it failed me most stunningly. I found the concierge to be particularly unhelpful and frustrating. They were dismissive and I often felt like I was being shooed away. On our first night in Paris, they booked a reservation for us on the Yacht de Paris. I approached the concierge desk a couple of times before leaving for our dinner cruise and each time I was told to come back later. I finally called from our room and a woman told me to stop by a few minutes before we were heading out to pick up a card with the information on the reservation. I did just that and noticed that there wasn’t a complete street address noted on the card. I mentioned this to the concierge and he shooed me away and told me I’d be fine—that any taxi driver would be able to find it. Unfortunately, this wasn’t the case and our driver struggled to find the location. Additionally, we didn’t know what to expect from the menu at the Yacht de Paris. We learned at dinner that the only entrée offered that evening was lamb. Neither I nor my traveling companion care for lamb so we made due with bread, but it would have been nice to know such information beforehand. We would have maybe eaten a little something in advance or found an alternative to the Yacht de Paris. The next evening, we tried to make reservations at Le Cinq located inside the hotel and we were told the restaurant was booked for the next week. We called the concierge and asked for alternatives. I specifically asked for a few options. It was a special evening and I didn’t want to take any chances on dinner so I wanted this to be a more collaborative effort. I never heard back from the concierge. Instead, an hour or so later, a messenger deliverd a card to our room with our reservation for the evening. When I called to inquire about what had happened (i.e., what happened to providing us with some options) I was met with indignation. The last straw was when I asked for a recommendation for a nearby coffee/pastry shop. The concierge recommended Laduree. When I asked where it was, he scribbled something on a map and told me it was easy to find. At that point, I’d had enough. I never asked the concierge for anything else. Instead, we contacted the concierge at the Ritz London (we were there the week prior and returning for a few more days after Paris) who recommended a great tour company in Paris. We leaned heavily on our tour guide for places to visit and where to eat and shop, etc. We also had a disappointing breakfast at La Gallerie on our second morning. The staff was scrambling to remember our orders. It was a disaster (runny and undercooked eggs; lumpy crème; they forgot to bring orange juice; they forgot to bring toast for the eggs; they forgot to bring a clean cup for tea, etc.). It was a shame because breakfast the day before was impeccable. Unfortunately, the second morning’s experience left such a bad impression on us that we skipped breakfast altogether the next day. Finally, on our second night at George V, we had to phone the night manager twice because we were kept awake by very loud techno music from the room next to us. She didn’t do anything the first time so we recorded the noise on our I-phone and she eventually sent someone up and it stopped at around 2:30 am. The next day there was no acknowledgement of the inconvenience—not a call or a note. Certainly, nothing I’ve described is the end of the world. However, for a hotel that touts its service above all else, the George V failed us terribly. I sincerely hope that our experience is an anomaly--that other guests are welcomed warmly and treated with more respect than we were afforded.

Reviews.Title: “up to 4 seasons high standards”
Reviews.Author: PRESItaly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a suite for 3 nights, and everything was perfect. The staff even managed to exceed our expectations, with those nice little touches that made our stay special. We really liked the new bed, especially made for 4S by a renowed English brand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rktripp
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel , perfect location in Paris , excellent service and staff attitude . Only glitch no one hour pressing available (pressing facilities being redone ?) which is a shame for that category of hotel . Very nice large room with very good comfortable kingsize bed . Nicce large bathroom with bath and walk in shower. Very serviceable staff , very efficient and quick room service Otherwise perfect stay with perfect staff attitude !

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel, with excellent service without being obsequious. A friend asked me "what's so good about 4 Seasons?". My answer is check out the pool, gym & sauna. Any decent club has nice fluffy towels, but George V has a spin drier to dry out your swimming costume. They have thought of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sharon W
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that i had the best time in my life at George V! Amazing hotel!Very elegant! Amazing service,beautiful large rooms! Perfect location! George V is my hotel of choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hats off for George V in Paris (Four Seasons)”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninEurope10
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons George V deserves its kudos. Located in the swanky and historic District 8, and surrounded by first class shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing, you couldn't ask for a better location. I experienced a very gracious check-in process even though I arrived early. They were very accommodating and as soon as housekeeping finished the room I was whisked upstairs to my room by one of their brilliant staff members. The room was spotless, nicely furnished, good sized, elegant and comfortable. The hotel lobby and environs were decorated and lighted for Christmas, as was all of Paris, and the effect was delightful. My wife joined me, and with the George V as our sanctuary, we toured, ate and drank our way through Paris for two lovely days. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: macguire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant and the staff are wonderful. The rooms are comfortable with big bathrooms and great quality bath products in nice sizes. Room service is just perfect. They have a small business center upstairs, with helpful staff, and on a negative note, the fact that they actually charge for high speed internet is just a bit too much, considering the price of the rooms! The breakfast area downstairs is nice, and they do have a good choice of foods. We also had lunch there and found it to be extremely disappointing, the food was just not that great, definitely expected more. The spa downstairs is gorgeous! The hotel is in a great location, within easy walk of some very good restaurants. They have a great luggage service too, and your bag is in your room when you walk in, except upon checkout, it didn't work well because they couldn't find our bags and it took forever for them to arrive, making us leave for the airport, 20mins after our initial departure time. That said, this is a wonderful place stay, what a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel worldwide , 5 stars , 5 diamonds”
Reviews.Author: Ayman M
Reviews.Content: Service is a passion in George V Big thank you to all wonderfull staff Smile , guest recognition , name usage , very sincere , always asked to help and assist , anticipating guest needs I was wowed and has been beyond my expectation All my family felt that we were treated as royal family.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in the world, but this time some little disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Schdero
Reviews.Content: Before anything else: We have visited many excellent hotels all over the world, but the George V still is our hotel of choice. Be it for the magnificent building, the exquisite rooms and designs or the uttermost friendly staff, miraculously being able to adress you with your real name wherever you go – this hotel fulfills even the highest standarts. And what is especially astounding is that this hotel manages to offer pure abundance without the decadence you might feel, say, in the Burj al Arab. However, there wer two little disappointments this time. First of all, the wifi is a mere catastrophe. The "normal" wifi package offers very slow wifi only and is already expensive. The expensive package offers ok-speed wifi but is ridiculously expensive. Besides the fact that it seems very avaricious of a hotel in which the cheapest room lies around 1200$ to charge for wifi in the first place, it simply is a cumbersome system. For the second disappointment it is to be said that we have visited the George V very many times. Although it is clear that we cannot expect an upgrade it was a bit disappointing that we didnt get one this year, although we have gotten one each and every other time. Also we usually found a small handwritten welcome card in our room welcoming us back to the GV which this year was replaced by a standart printed "with our compliments" card. It is not of great importance, but sometimes it is the small things leaving a big impression. Although these two disappointments I want to end this review with the biggest plus of the hotel, namely the staff. In the George V you usually dont fell as a paying guest, but rather as a normal guest. The staff really seems to find some fun i offering great service beyond the pure do-ut-des relation, it just seems to like working there. This is the reason why you always feel at home in the George V - thank you for that.

Reviews.Title: “Damage control amid jackhammers and drills”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights for a special occassion trip. Upon arrival we found out there was a construction site on the property next to the hotel. As it turned out the room we were given was in the wing adjoining the site. Ostensibly the activity was only taking place between 9 and 16 hours, however that was not a consolation to someone who was in need of a 1-2 hour nap subsequent to an overnight flight from North America. The concierge offered to call the site which may have resulted in the noise level decreasing from unbearable to merely annoying. Apparently there were no other rooms available that day. A half hearted offer was made to move us for the remaining two days which was never followed up. Ultimately a free bottle of champagne was delieverd to the room and we got a 50% discount off the price for the first night. That notwithstanding we would have never booked this hotel in the first place had we been aware of the situation. Mandarin Oriental sounds like a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “C'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: danieldenoto
Reviews.Content: I spent few days for business in Paris and George V was absolutely perfect in all. The room was quiet large and comfortable, mini bar well furnished, bathroom very large with high quality bath products. The location is perfect as for business as for shopping as it's located few meters form the Champs Elysées. It has a very good and not too expensive restaurant called Le Cinq. I will come back either if I come for business either if I come with family.

Reviews.Title: “A Gorgeous room by any standard”
Reviews.Author: Barnsey_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the George V and the rooms are just lovely. We had a quiet room at the end of the hall. The room was appointed with a Bose stereo for an ipod, DVD player and JCL speakers, our own espresso machine, and a gorgeous bath with separate shower, tub, and enclosed WC. The location is excellent in terms of access to the Metro Line 1 (the Louvre, Le Marais, St. Germain des Pres). The only negative would be that the cost of room service and breakfast is incredibly expensive and there are no little convenience stores or bakeries really close by. Otherwise, it was a nice 'haven' amongst the hustle and bustle of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant, luxurious...all you could imagine!”
Reviews.Author: Dainty S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the week of Bastille Day holiday and it was as wonderful as I imagined it would be. The flowers in the lobby are breathtakingly beautiful. The staff was super attentive and tended to our every need. From our room I could see the Eiffel Tower and the fireworks during the celebration. We went to the Ritz for lunch one day and other than the great location, were not impressed. Would pick Four Seasons over the Ritz any day. I love how the staff at Four Seasons gave me a little footstool for my purse so it wouldn't touch the floor. So cute! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: am S
Reviews.Content: Our weekend in George V was the most magical imaginable. From the moment our car arrived, we were greeted warmly and the attention to detail was impeccable. The rooms was incredible and luxurious, all the staff were very helpful, friendly and made our trip unforgettable. We dined at the fabulous restaurant on site and were blown away by the food, the professionalism of the staff and the ambiance. I also had a spa treatment which was outstanding and highly rated. I was lucky enough to be proposed to there as well which made it all the more special and I will never forget it! We will definitely be going back

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nic563
Reviews.Content: Having organised this one night stay as something of a treat ...I was not impressed at all.... from an obvious ,but unfortunate mistake at check in, to a room that certainly looked rather out of date (4th floor) including a TV cabinet whose door was about to fall off, but certainly was not going to open properly , and certainly not of the standard to be expected of The George V But the best was yet to come...as we were in Paris for one night only we had invited a long lost relative to join us for cocktails at the hotel prior to going onto dinner....but alas on arriving downstairs at 6pm we were informed in a very "Stepford Wives" fashion that the bar was full, and that there would be no seating available for the forseeable future..I had certainly never experienced such a situation before, and certainly not in a hotel of this so called standard.... badly dealt with, and just bad period..we took our leave(and had delightful drinks on the terrace of Fouquet instead) Returning to the Hotel at approx 11.30 we thought we might try for a nightcap in the bar ..how silly of us..whilst several people were actually in the bar drinking we were informed this time that it was closed..!! Sadly service at breakfast the next morning also suffered from the "Stepford" approach, and just finished off a rather expensive and unfortunate experience, which is a shame as we stay in other Four Seasons properties around the world and enjoy those visits..but they seem to have lost the plot slightly with this great old Dame of Paris.....will not be staying again.....

Reviews.Title: “Service close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: HighHurdle
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably good even in the context of other very high end five star hotels. Service was exceptional - the attention to detail excellent. When booking I mentioned in passing that my wife was pregnant to make sure we did not get a smoking room - when we arrived they had a special pregnancy pillow and foot massager. Really nice touch. All the small touches you would expect were there but felt like the staff really meant it which isn't always the case. One of the best hotels we have stayed at, definitely the best in Europe.. Only 4/5 stars for value as its $1000/night + but did regret paying up for quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful to look at, horrible to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Djordaan
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. We stayed in on of the renovated rooms on the 7th floor. The service was below average. Check your food bills carefully before you sign. They add things that you didn't have. Some of the other reviews also mention this. One morning I was in the bath when one of the staff entered the room, despite the fact that the do not disturb sign was on the door. Do you expect that from a hotel that claims to be the best? I will not stay at the George V again? I have stayed at the Le Maurice before and will rather stay there. Le Maurice is sheer luxury and they treat you like royalty. The George V is beautiful but does not offer much else.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to propose in Paris this is THE place”
Reviews.Author: Stevetri
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at George V. I took my girlfriend there to propose. It was beyond words how special we were made to feel and how attentive and detail orientated the staff were. We also ate there and it was by a mile the most outstanding meal we have ever had (and we have had some great meals!) Even though there were a couple of issues they were handled really well. We will never forget teh wine cellar and the rose petals and the table! If you can afford it it is a MUST

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, aside from AM pounding”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: Best urban hotel in the world, perhaps BUT on our honeymoon room renovation work woke us at 8 AM on my birthday, and was apparent on our other two mornings. That aside, it is beautiful, wonderful, occasionally indescribable. Worth the sick prices. A really amazing experience. N.B. spa is heavenly and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “luxury personified”
Reviews.Author: clive_holly1
Reviews.Content: everything you could hope from a first class hotel in one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. not only was the service friendly and first rate, but as guests we were treated to happy smiling faces from the staff. For us it was a special treat, and whilst it is expensive relatively, I believe you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “First class luxury, and welcoming to children”
Reviews.Author: SaskiaSarratt
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel, not only does it offer first class service in opulent surroundings but the staff were very welcoming and friendly too. We stayed with our 5 year old daughter who was whisked off on arrival to a Halloween party that was taking place in the basement. We then arrived to the room and there was a 'Welcome message" in the bathroom for her, written in wooden letters together with a Halloween themed structure that was made completely out of chocolate! We didn't find the hotel stuffy in any way and even if, for whatever reason, you decide not to stay here, just check out the wonderful flower displays in the reception, for that alone it's worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: xcelr8
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. The service standards are extremely high and all staff were very accommodating. Breakfasts were what you would expect of a hotel of this caliber - excellent. Great location. Stayed in a Suite that had great bathrooms and for the light sleeper the room was very quite. Sure its expensive - but I think worth it !

Reviews.Title: “fab place, top shelf experience.”
Reviews.Author: Tristram_11
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in the George V and it was even better than before, the staff friendly and accommodating as you would expect, but the little touches such as the concierge service for booking restaurants and making recommendations was exactly what we were looking for. They listened and booked some of the best and most reasonably priced places in Paris. Do visit the spa; again the staff went out of their way to show us the equipment and ensured we got the most from the experience. Thank you I will be returning

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jeachi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with excellent service. It is an especially so for business travelers. The business centre is 24hrs (hotel staff will only be there during stipulated times) and is extremely well equipped, e.g individual 'cabanas' each with a computer and color printer, stationary etc. Includes Internet access. For hotel rooms, Internet access is chargeable. Highly recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Four Seasons in the World...”
Reviews.Author: Cmolvheartnnyc
Reviews.Content: This was my 8th stay here and I must say every time we pull up a d are greeted warmly (and then, by name) and are swept into the gorgeous flower filled lobby I'm transported into another world. I've stayed in more than a dozen 4S Hotels "The 4" as we like to call them and come to expect: the most comfortable beds, friendly, personalized service and "nothing is impossible" requests granted. Breakfast in room is delightful and always as desired and concierge can pull off a whimsy request at will. The special attention to my preferences is appreciated: extra toilletries & towels already await without request and they are always aware that I like a massage within 12 hours of my overseas flight. It seems we are always upgraded and look forward to what we consider the best hotel in o e of the world's most beautiful cities. Growing up my family were devotees of Plaza Athenee, but nothing compares and I always look forward to a luxurious stay in the city of lights.

Reviews.Title: “Impresive service!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos G
Reviews.Content: While for business or please George V is an outstanding hotel. Every detail has been consider and most important the hotel personel make u feel like home...or better. Even if u are not staying at the hotel I would recomend to have a coffee or The in the "La Galerie". Hope you enjoy it as I did

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: rmendell7244
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The service is what you pay for. Wonderful sweet staff, rooms are large and beautiful! Lots of great stuff to walk to from the hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: LAguy99
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in many five star hotels and resorts around the world, but we have never experienced anything quite like the Four Seasons George V. From the doormen to the receptionists to the dining staff and to every staff member we ever encountered (must be over 40 in five days) – there was not one individual who was not gracious and friendly. The service surpassed what we have previously experienced in many five star hotels and even on numerous five star cruises. During our stay in early October, we were given room 225, which is a very quiet Superior room overlooking the beautiful marble courtyard. The room was absolutely immaculate with a chandelier and a stunning blue granite bathroom. The hotel is meticulously maintained with nary a sign of wear. The gorgeous lobby with fresh flowers changed almost daily is a site to behold. While meals and drinks were quite expensive (as are most things in Paris) by American standards, the service we received made everything seem reasonable. The prix fixe lunch at Le Cinq (85 euros/per person) was a good deal and the food was superb – especially the desserts. For comparison, appetizers and main courses on the ala carte menu were 70 to 140 euros, so a three course meal would cost about 250-300 euros per person, not including alcohol. The George V is in a great location – a hundred yards from the Champs-Elysees and within what is called the “Golden Triangle,” which is an upscale area filled with designer boutiques. The hotel is also adjacent to a Metro stop making it extremely convenient for access to all of Paris. All in all, we tremendously enjoyed the Parisians and by making a little effort with the French language, found them to be very warm and friendly. I think those who criticize the French for being rude are usually those who expect to be treated in France exactly the same as they are in the United States. A few words of French, such as “bonjour” and “merci” go a long way to help create a pleasant experience for all. While we have found the Australians to be the world’s friendliest people, this visit proved to us that the French are not far behind when treated with understanding and respect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MrsNP712
Reviews.Content: We went there for a birthday celebration and had a wonderful time. Nothing was too much trouble, even having our suite changed (an upgrade) after the first night owing to construction noise from next door. The staff, without exception, were friendly and helpful and looked after us very well. Despite not mentioning the reason for our visit, a bottle of champagne and a birthday cake appeared in our room on the night in question. Unfortunately, as we had just enjoyed a fabulous meal at Le Cinq, we had no room left for the treats provided and had to leave them. The suite was beautiful and the bed very comfy. One night we were dining at Lasserre restaurant (2* Michelin) and asked for a taxi to take us there but the hotel provided their own limo for us, with the restaurant providing one for our return journey! We were treated like royalty and I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best FS hotel we´ve stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fabizuk
Reviews.Content: Just Perfect! We had a very nice time in FS Paris since we arrived until we left the hotel. The room was very nice, the spa was wonderful, the staff amazing and etc. Of course it´s not cheap, but this is obviously when you make your reservation.But, It worths every euro you spent.

Reviews.Title: “Three days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mikezgall
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the door until the day we left our visit was perfect. We were welcomed immediately by the hotel ambassador who showed us to our room which was decorated with flowers and a few welcome goodies. Throughout our stay the hotel staff welcomed us each time we returned into what we began to call home. Pricey yes, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is one of the best in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidman
Reviews.Content: Expensive, sure, but it returns value at every moment of your stay there. ideally located, elegant and sublime. The level of service here would be difficult to match.

Reviews.Title: “The World's Best”
Reviews.Author: TomK543
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and spent a substantial portion of my professional life rating hotels. The George V still rates as the best "city" hotel experience in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Of all the luxury hotels I have stayed in, this is the best.”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlinwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a comfortable mix of gracious and comfortable. I have stayed here 3 years running, and feel it is better every year. The staff is welcoming and remembers our names. Room service arrives hot. The food is excellent in Le Gallerie and Le V. The staff in Le Bar is friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel is perfect for the travel I do. Convenient for walking around the city and close to many of the best restaurants in the world. The spa is beautiful and the services are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jmb560
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews about this hotel on Tripadvisor, I was not getting my hopes up too high. My mother and I travelled to France for her birthday and I decided to spend three nights at the FourSeasons. I did book an executive suite, but still did not really know what to expect since I had never stayed at a FourSeasons. We arrived early so our room was not ready. We checked in and the staff was unbelievably sweet and pleasant. I have been to Paris many times and have spent time in hotels of similar quality and those that are quaint, but I have never been to a hotel where every single person was so helpful and cheerful. We went shopping until our room was ready. They called when it was ready and to our delight, they informed us that they were able to give us three upgrades. I love to stay at really nice hotels, but I have never seen anything like this room! It was beautiful and the service was amazing. We had wine, sweets, water, ice...Everthing was catered to us. It was truly a dream vacation in a beautiful city. Plus, which made it so much nicer, the staff was so wonderful. Personally the only drawback for me is that the location was not in a spot that I was used to. It ended up being fine because we took taxis to most of the places, but I usually prefer to walk and it was far for my mother to walk to some of the museums. Of course, part of the problem with staying at this hotel is that you never want to leave it!!

Reviews.Title: “We expected more from here!”
Reviews.Author: ash_and_jai
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my wife with a trip to Paris for her birthday, and I instantly though of the Four Seasons George V. For a price of 950 euros per night, I was expecting big things from this hotel but in the end I was left deeply disappointed and rather short changed. From the moment we had arrived, I had a feeling of being misplaced, to the extent that I was too scared to touch or feel anything in case it brought attention to us. We certainly did not feel at home here.The only other time that this feeling occurred was when we both went to the Burj Al Arab in Dubai. The staff at the George V were okay but not overly friendly or (I personnally felt) would not go that extra mile. It was like they knew we were not Billionaires and perhaps felt that they needed to treated us differently. The rooms were nothing special. We stayed in a King Size deluxe room and it looked like it was in need of a refurbishment. Hidden inside the TV cabinet lurks a monster (cathode-ray tube) TV. I was surprised as I thought that given the amount of guests that stay here and the prestige of this hotel, a flat screen TV would be expected. As usual with Four Seasons there are no freebies except that our room rate was bed and breakfast and came with two bottles of water at turn down. The cost of the laundry for two ladies trousers, a pair of undergarments and blouse was a mere 120 euros. Don't get me wrong, this hotel is truly beautiful and the location is perfect for sightseeing and shopping. Other than that this hotel is nothing special and for the money spent, I would certainly be looking at cheaper high end alternative hotel for our next Paris Trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: deepakQatar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons in June this year for one week. When we arrived we were greeted at reception by the friendly staff who made sure we had everything we needed for our stay. The rooms were spacious, clean and well maintained, we also had a flat screen tv to watch before we went out each evening. We spent quite a bit of time around the pool which was great, pool bar handily located, staff regularly walking around with complimentary cold face towels and fruit. One of the best experiences was the Brazilian barbecue cooked by the hotel chefs around the pool, food was top notch. Similarly the night after was an Italian theme with all the usual favorite dishes. My wife booked a massage in the hotel spa which she loved. All through our stay the staff made us feel looked after and were very welcoming so would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out a perfect stay. Great staff, great food (Le Cinq is wonderful) perfect housekeeping. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Jesse H
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon and we got nothing but excellent services. The staffs were exceptional. Went to the spa for massage and it was great as well. Breakfast was fantastic. Overall very great stay. It is very expensive but toatlly worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: lor13149
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is always consistent with top notch customer service. The George V is no exception. I was pick pocketed in the metro and when I finally made it back to the hotel they went above and beyond to help me. The room had plenty of space unlike a lot of European hotel rooms. The spa was great. The location is just off the Champs Élysées. It was well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position near champs élysées with perfect decoration !!”
Reviews.Author: azafiris
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience staying in this hotel. Perfect breakfast and rooms but it is expensive. What you pay is what you get...

Reviews.Title: “Go for nothing but the best, and it was”
Reviews.Author: Dellmar0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights, celebrating our 40th anniversary. Their "meet and greet service" had a representative meet us in the jet-way! He helped carry our hand luggage, and escorted right through a special short line at customs, helped pick up luggage and had a driver immediately waiting outside the door. At the hotel we were met at their door and welcomed by name. This was typical of our experience for the 5 days. They have wonderful service, beautiful rooms and the staff is kind and friendly without any pretensions. A wonderful experience...just do it.

Reviews.Title: “High Tea at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: johnandwendyt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Paris for her birthday. We booked High Tea Francias at the Four Seasons. From the moment we arrived the service was superb, the manager of Le gallerie bar personally came over to welcome us(I booked through him online) and wished my wife a happy birthday. The food was superb, perfectly presented and the serviced was highly polished, attentive and professional without being intrusive. I would recommend visiting and I wish we had booked dinner at Le Cinq.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this amazing hotel and it was worth every single penny. There is nothing bad to say! The staff are very polite and friendly, my room was fantastic and as a huge fan of high quality food i was very pleased with George V. Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinRye
Reviews.Content: Most I've ever paid for a hotel and did I feel ripped off? No. The effort and detail that they put into service is truly overwhelming. Little bit too overwhelming at times: you felt if any member of staff produced a bad 'service encounter' they'd be taken out the back and shot. Staff seemed to have been chosen for looks, language skills and ability to smile. Room was smaller than I expected and not my taste of decoration, but this was more than made up with a wonderful bed and bathroom. Spa was wonderfully restful until a couple of american families (servants in tow) decided to converse across it. Food was outstanding. Even those breakfast scrambled eggs tasted better than normal - perhaps that was the beautiful room effect. Cocktails too, were wonderful. Special mention must go to those air orchids. They must cost a fortune, but they're worth it. Would I go back? No, neither of us would. Can't really explain why. It's not the price, more the feeling that you're staying in a well oiled machine.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Welcome ever”
Reviews.Author: guy b
Reviews.Content: This morning I landed from Thailand at Roissy CDG , Paris . The flight was earlier than scehduled , 5h30am instead of 6h00. consequently I was able to get the Four Seasons George V very early at 6h30. And what a surprise to discover a fantastic welcome , my suite was already available and a marvellous breakfast was waiting for me with fresh warm croissants , coffe and fresh orange juice. Every detail was perfect : the breakfast, the amazing flowers, the fresh fruits and some deliciuos French " patisseries " with " noisettes " and white chocolate ! What else can you wish when you just have been travelling for 13 hours !!

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: chrispres
Reviews.Content: For those of us who are sadly unable to stay at this magnificent hotel - why not treat yourself to afternoon tea. We did and it was one of the highlights of our 4 day trip to Paris. Sumptuous surroundings, piano played beautifully in the background and exquisite pastries tea and champagne. Not to be missed. Was a 50th birthday treat for my friend and I - maybe we will get to really indulge and stay at the hotel for our 60th.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: biowoman
Reviews.Content: We visited four seasons last Christmas there. It is not a typical Four Seasons since it has the personal touch of an historical hotel at that is what we really liked. Overall we had a great experience with very nice rooms, restaurants, staff and service. We are definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous 4 Seasons Experience”
Reviews.Author: ccharie
Reviews.Content: Again, I cannot say enough about this magnificent hotel. It's sublime, expensive, and worth EVERY PENNY. It's stunning, the Spa is also beautiful, and the staff is exceptional. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say”
Reviews.Author: ssn12
Reviews.Content: As is the usual standard with four season hotels, there is nothing bad to say. But this particular hotel goes above. Outstanding service and attention to detail. At the time I was pregnant, and when I mentioned the room smelled slightly of smoke, we were instantly upgraded to a suite and a pregnancy pillow was provided for me. We had twin girls aged eight, and when we asked for fun activities for them to do we were instantly given pages and pages of detailed printed out information. Planning our family outings was made so easy and enjoyable. In particular our visit to the drive through zoo Thoiry. Renting a car was also made easy by the helpful concierge. From what type of car, how many people should it seat, would we like a driver? And then the car was simply dropped and picked up from the hotel. Same goes for babysitting services. Rooms were very clean. Breakfast downstairs was great. The only negative comment is we ordered fish from room service and it was not good at all. But that was just the one order. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SENSATIONAL FIRST CLASS EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Jewelchic
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at George V. it was not our first time and we were made to feel very welcome like family returning home. Presentaion of the hotel is exquisite under the brilliant direction of artistic director and florist Jeff Leatham. Concierge extremely helpful and well informed and breakfast is AMAZING in the beautiful dining room. Nothing is too much trouble and they catered to my gluten allergy without a hitch. One of the BEST hotels in the world and we travel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Augustus B
Reviews.Content: George V in Paris is in a great location - very central to everything. The staff are friendly, helpful, and take pride in what they do. Everything in this hotel is like out of a movie. I'm working as a retailer in the fashion industry and I've noticed the quality and the creativity of staff's uniforms. The manager personally enquired if I had enjoyed my stay as I was leaving If you are looking for an unforgettable hotel in Paris, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: nomad07
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels across the world and more recently Europe, I would say that George V are working off the Four Seasons brand and are definitely lacking in many ways for the price. If the pricing was half then I would say it was outstanding. Overall, rooms are a little tired, they are very large, bathroom etc is very generous, bed is great, however there is little standouts when you arrive to the room. The introduction was very warm and friendly with a short tour. Reception is very impressive, flower arrangement impressive, nice cars out the front. The martini bar is also worth a drink. We went to the spa resort which people were saying was one if the best. It is good, but certainly far from the best. I have been to ones in Asia that are far better and far cheaper. The pricing is seriously overpriced. Our comparison is fair and is based on another top brand hotel we stayed in a far more exclusive area of Paris which was half the price and outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great staff. Only downside with children is the location.”
Reviews.Author: ewrpex87
Reviews.Content: We spent two of our 7 nights in Paris at the George V. The other 5 were at The Ritz. This is a fantastic hotel with a young and vibrant staff. Our junior suite had ample room for two adults and two young children. The walk-in closet was the size of some smaller Paris hotel rooms I had in my younger days. The bathroom was really well done and the animal soaps for our children were very much appreciated. (As were the snacks and cakes both afternoons.) We enjoyed their pool area, though were a bit disappointed that it was closed on one of our two days because of some problem with the filtration. On a comparison between the George V swimming pool and the Ritz pool we prefer the latter, though the George V pool isn't that far behind. We just preferred the size and brightness of the room at the Ritz. We would have no qualms about staying here again. However, if given a choice between The Ritz and the George V we would opt for the Ritz, again. The deciding factor for us is the location. We enjoy walking over to St. Germain and The Latin Quarter and from the George V that is impractical. With two children in tow at the George V we felt we needed to take a taxi to go everywhere but the Champs Elysee. With the Ritz we were content to walk to the area sites and museums. There were a few mistakes on our bill due to errors at the Salon that we were able to rectify on later calls to the hotel. Mistakes happen and we were happy to see they were prompt in correcting them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and amazing.”
Reviews.Author: EiffelGirlHouston
Reviews.Content: After being treated like garbage at The Ritz, we went to the George V. The staff was friendly, kind and went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, and not to be missed if you go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: NYCanuck12
Reviews.Content: During our stay my wife's glasses came apart (screw holding arm to frame fell out). Since she only needs them for driving and TV there was no immediate need to repair and left them on the table. Upon arriving back from a day out, the glasses were in the same place she left them, however, there was a note from the cleaning staff saying "I noticed these needed repair and took care of it." No name was attached, just a person that wanted to look after a guest.

Reviews.Title: “A palace that is truly a league on its own!”
Reviews.Author: L A
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the George V in Paris again. Every time that i return to this beautiful hotel, it feels coming back home, just better! The welcoming smile and the generosity, humility & kindness of the staffs warm my heart. The attention paid to details of the entire hotel, the rooms are absolutely top notch and immaculate. The rooms are all different and beautifully warm, cleverly and seductively designed. I am convinced that a lot of thought process had gone into every single decision for this perfection of this hotel. The classy and elegant uniforms that flows from the Le Cinq ,Le Bar to the smart yet chic uniforms of the staff at the gallery and terrace flows beautifully. The George V service standards take you beyond the norm of expectation n blow your mind. Thanks you George V for being a great host of your palace and truly a league on your own!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlina34
Reviews.Content: Girls trip to Paris in April and the Four Seasons was perfect in every way. Beautiful suite and spa. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: magicHK
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, the service was friendly and the food was fantastic! We especially loved breakfast at Le Cinq, and the flower arrangements were wonderful. If we ever go back to Paris, we would choose this hotel hands down!

Reviews.Title: “No doubt, best hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: BobG87
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in all top hotels in Paris, George V is still the best in Paris and Europe. This is based on location, rooms/suites , service, and atmosphere. The marble courtyard, flowers, and staff make this hotel very special. Mr. Santiago Rocchietti, Front Office Manager helped make our experience very special. Future trips to Paris will always incude the Four Seasons George V.

Reviews.Title: “It is a beautiful palce to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: sffn99
Reviews.Content: Marvelous court-yard that you can have a nice drink.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to love this hotel but too many issues...”
Reviews.Author: susanPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay here and had high expectations to match the dollars we were spending. We booked our travel through Centurion and decided to book the deluxe rooms for a total of 10 nights. An upgrade is given on check in if available this was not available at check in so I was pleased we had splurged on the higher level room. How wrong I was! The rooms we were taken to after our long flight from Australia were dreadful. They were at the back end of the hotel and overlooked a 1970's office building eyesore. The rooms were small and well worn and smelled bad - assistant manager agreed with all our comments. We were appalled and were assured these rooms were 'deluxe' rooms even though they looked nothing like the deluxe rooms on the website. We were told no upgrade was possible even if we wanted to pay for an upgrade as the hotel was very busy. We were then told there was another two 'deluxe' rooms at a different part of the hotel would be available late in the afternoon - this was after haggling for an hour and deciding we would not be staying 10 nights in the room they allocated to us - effectively putting them on notice we would be checking out. The next 'deluxe' rooms were so very different it dismayed us further as we felt the hotel had put us in a basic room at the beginning and was still wanting to charge us for a deluxe room. Beware as the rooms in this hotel are so very different even if you assured by the staff of the room catagory. Trust is important and they lost it with us here. There are major issues with soundproofing in this hotel. We heard every word of the conversations of our neighbours and heard the people above us tapdancing and doors slaming constantly. The building work next door had drilling and hammering going on day and night. Thank goodness we were not planning on spending much time in the room. For those that like to relax back on holiday and have in days this hotel won't suit you. Room service was a joke. The poor delivery people would be missing things on every delivery. We ordered room service daily because we have young kids so got to know the wait staff. They were embarressed to say the least and complained that the kitchen is so busy the left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing. The quality and service here was so poor the F&B manager ought to be ashamed. We were sent meals missing sauces, Meat that was overcooked, condiments that had been opened and used by other guests. Butter but no bread. Cheese missing from Pasta. Pots of coffee where we only ordered a cup (charged for a pot of course!). This became a bit of a running joke with us and simply should not be the case in an establishment like this. When one of the delivery people moved a chair out of our room to the kids room for their breakfast tray the wait person smashed the chair into the chandelier that shattered glass all over us and our breakfast. No offer to replace our breakfast covered in glass, thank goodness we were nearly done anyway. I sent my daughter and her little friend for a pedi at the spa - bit of 8 and 9 year old pampering. They charged adult prices and the job was appalling. Polish was slapped on so badly I thought the girls had done their own toes. I really wish I could have written a nice review here but left Paris feeling let down by this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: DianaB15
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years 2009 week here and it was the most incredible stay. Our suite was beautiful; the service was impeccable and the restaurants had excellent breakfasts and service. They put on a fabulous New Years Eve party with a great band, superb over the top service and an excellent dinner. They made everyone feel so so special. Great location. Beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Europe: AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: KatSchulz
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Four Seasons/George V and it was as AMAZING, as we remembered! Knowing that you are paying top dollar for the BEST helps. My husband and son made it to the pool/spa area and loved it. (I was disappointed not to have enough time this trip, as it is so serene/clean and appointed with snacks and beverages, along with attendants that are incredibly service oriented. I did visit the pool and exercise room the last two visits.) What I love most about the service throughout the hotel (from housekeeping to the restaurants) is the employees listen, take to heart your request, and provide whatever you want as promptly as possible. If it takes a bit for them to figure it out, they are very good to let you know they are working on it. I think the only time I noticed an issue with service was the difference between Le Cinq & Le Galerie. There are either more servers in Le Cinq or the servers are given fewer tables to attend, as each time our Le Cinq visits have been incredible. We have eaten breakfast in the restaurants about 6X, mostly in Le Cinq. I do love the central location of the hotel, as I love to walk, but taxis seem readily available. Our favorite referral from the hotel is the upscale Italian restaurant: Mori Venice Bar, which we have been twice (once July 2011, and in July 2009), which does require a taxi to/from the restaurant. My daughter ordered a flambe' dessert, which was fun! We look forward to visiting Paris again and staying at the George V!!!

Reviews.Title: “High class quality and service you expect from top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark-walker38
Reviews.Content: Wonderful attention to detail which made our stay very enjoyable and memorable

Reviews.Title: “There may be newer/more modern hotels, but staff, service, and style are unbeatable.”
Reviews.Author: JinaChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: The furnishings and infrastructure may be a bit dated, but you would I love staying at this hotel. Is it expensive? Oh yes. But when I'm on vacation, I want to be pampered where I'm staying and enjoy class, style and luxury. I like seeing the staff pressed and perfect. This adds greatly to my overall enjoyment of the trip. If all you need is a comfortable bed and want to get the biggest bang for the buck, look elsewhere. My only substantial complaint is the draperies on the windows don't do as good a job blocking out the light as they could. I'm just someone who wants to be able to make the room completely dark regardless of the sunlight outside (when I go on vacation, I catch up on sleep).

Reviews.Title: “first class trip”
Reviews.Author: mstravelgoddess
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time staying here and I decided to write a review . They will greet you with the most pleasant and well trained staff of any hotel chain. We stay at four seasons through out the world and there staff is always the best anywhere. They remember your name and will greet you as such every time they see you. Small but charming rooms, well appointed , charming courtyard that is a garners delight, beautiful spa, and amazing food. I look forward to staying here every time we come. I have gone to some of the older hotels in the area that have five stars and this is the only one we will stay in. The others smell like cigarettes and moldy. Four seasons if clean and fresh always. Very expensive but if you can afford it then splurge here!

Reviews.Title: “Truly beautiful hotel that made our stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: yellowrosetexas3
Reviews.Content: You always hear about how rude the French are, apparently someone forgot to tell them here! The staff was unbelievable in their helpfulness, kindness & ready smiles. Turndown service each evening was an extra luxury. The property was beautiful with purple flowers of all kinds in the lobby, restaurants and room. Our room was standard but was large along with the bathroom. Money seems to have no beginning or end here as you become numb to $50.00 club sandwiches and $15.00 ice tea. Our friends who stayed "elsewhere" ran into the "real" French apparently along the way so I say staying here is a much better experience. Hotel is conveniently located between Arc De Triumph & Eiffel Tower and shopping, all within easy walking distance. Dinner at Le Cinq here was also a highlight. I won't go back to Paris but I know I made the right choice in staying here to make my time in Paris top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the wait and the splurge!”
Reviews.Author: 5trans
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my second visit to Paris but this time we took our 3 daughters, 12 and twin 10yr olds. We have traveled around the world and stayed at as many Four Seasons properties as we can afford and promised ourselves the next time we go to Paris, we HAVE to stay at George V. The longing that we had after reading every "world's best" lists and seeing the George V usually at the top made us want to make that dream a reality this time around in Paris. We were crossing our fingers it wouldn't be overrated and worth our money. I'll tell you why we weren't disappointed and went beyond expectations. You don't need to hear about the gorgeous and spacious rooms--it looks just like the website. Or the insanely beautiful flower arrangements, the elegant lobby, the incredibly fresh French pastries at breakfast, the designer bath products (Bulgari), you get the idea...But at this level of a hotel, what we've come to realize is that what you are paying for is the service. That's exactly why my husband and I keep coming back to the Four Seasons. Never mind that everyone greets you as Mr. or Mrs. so-and-so. If you go to enough Four Seasons to know, that's included. What you do need to hear about is the fact that when my husband went to the concierge and showed them some postcards the girls wanted to send, before he could finish "would you...." they finished his sentence and said, "we'll be happy to send those for you." The postcards didn't have stamps yet and he was about to mention it but they also noticed and said "we'll take care of that for you as well." Never saw a charge for stamps either. Or when we were leaving one day after breakfast, our waiter asked us if he could pack us some chocolate croissants for our day out--we didn't refuse and no extra charge as well, just a dash of excellent service. How about when one of the waitstaff overheard one of my girls describing to her sister the tool they used to break a soft-poached egg since she saw someone using it and thought it was the coolest thing and the other girl had no idea what she was talking about, he brought it over to our table and showed the girls how it was used. I don't know how they do it but the attention they give their guests make people talk about it over and over or feel compelled to write about it on Tripadvisor! This Four Seasons also certainly exceeds others we've been to, although the property at Jimbaran Bay in Bali and Hualalai, Hawaii are close seconds. The location is perfect--close to the Champs-Elysee and noise but not on it and in the middle of 2 metro stations. The metro in Paris is one of the easiest in the world to use--no joking, and you don't have to speak a lick of French. Very economical as well and can take you all over Paris--at least to most if not all of the places that toursists come to Paris to see. Over 12 days in France and England and 4 different hotels, with the first being the Four Seasons GV, and one of them an ancient chateau, my husband and I and our 3 girls, went to bed every night dreaming we were still at the Four Seasons. If you can afford it, it isn't overrated and well worth it!
