Reviews.Title: “Prime location, exeptional service, gorgeous decor, and delectable breakfast. Highly recommend if you can afford it.”
Reviews.Author: SASSSAJTA
Reviews.Content: Enjoy breakfast in the lounge area. You will be treated like royalty. This hotel is very pricey but if you can afford it, do it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb !”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireShelly
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, great location, wonderful staff but donot stay there if you are on a budget as very expensive, but overall worth it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - so friendly and efficient”
Reviews.Author: BraddyNrFrome
Reviews.Content: Have to say that this is our favourite hotel worldwide - we went back this weekend after a gap of 10 years and it is as good as ever - a little expensive but the service, food and flowers are to die for. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as always”
Reviews.Author: tbm56
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay at the hotel. Over the five or so years, I have been coming to the G V, I have stayed at many other top hotels in other cities. The G V separates itself in my view from all of them. I can't say enough about the lobby with the incredible flowers. At night when the lobby is candlelit, it is spectacular. The rooms are very nice: spacious, high ceilings and excellent natural light. The bathrooms have a wonderful walk-in shower (note how the shower door opens in, so you can dry off in the shower. One of the many little details that the hotel gets right.) I have stayed in suites and they are nice but the deluxe and premier rooms are so nice and spacious that there is really is no need to spend the money on a higher category. The service is terrific. Everyone is friendly and everyone says hello -- from the doorman to the maids, every time they see you. You are truly a guest of each and every hotel employee. One special note for the latest trip. We had purchased some wines that we wanted try before we came home to the US. Paris is not a great BYOB town but the hotel accomodated us and handled the wines beautifully. The net result was problem solved and a memorable 3+ hour lunch ensued. I just can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We just had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Four Seasons in Paris, and the rooms and staff were great!”
Reviews.Author: JWReno
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel in the Presidential suite and our friends stayed in the Royal suite. The rooms were absolutely fantastic, the staff and service were wonderful. The hotel is pricey, but it is worth it in my opinion--you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: FMP
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and Im sad to say we wont be going back. Location, staff, rooms, pool etc all great however...the drinking/dining spaces were a huge shock. There is only one restaurant - the highly celebrated le cinq. If you dont want to eat there every day & night - or indeed at all - you are left with the option of eating your dinner on a sofa in a hallway. We were unable to get a table in the cinq restaurant 2/3 mornings so had to sit side by side on a sofa whilst the staff tried to cram our breaksfast order onto a tiny coffee table. Not only do i not want to eat my food of a low table - there were several older guests who needed to be assisted out of the ridiculous seating. It probably didnt help that the terrace was shut and the bar - was completely full every night. But its just way too big and too expensive to have so little drinking/dining space. If you are planning on having breaksfast here - make sure you are up early to secure a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LBurston
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this busy, central hotel whilst in Paris for business. It's a beautiful hotel and the lobby and reception were adorned with flowers really pretty. Room service was fab. Reception and consierge very helpful too. Lovely spacious rooms which house keeping kept clean and tidy. Laundry service excellent. Location of this hotel is perfect for sight seeing and shopping. The rooms are also very quiet. I had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew we were in one of the best hotels in the world. Everything is perfect here. Our room was amazing with a wraparound terrace providing virtually a 360 degree view of Paris. Dinner at Cinc the hotel's signature restaurant was incredible. This is an extraordinary Hotel experience and worth a splurge. It is insanely expensive but if you are traveling to Paris to celebrate a special occasion you are guaranteed a first rate experience here.

Reviews.Title: “George V Lunch at the La Galerie”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelernow
Reviews.Content: My friend and I dined at the La Galerie for lunch in February of this year and it was acceptable but really nothing more. I must admit though that I was quite disappointed when we reviewed our bill and found there was a charge of eight euros for tap water. The waitress, of course, corrected this but we felt this "mistake" was intentional.. I order tap water all over Paris and it is very accepatable to do so. I have eaten at The Meurice Hotel and they are absolutely delightful about serving tap water to diners. For this reason, I would hesitate to eat here again especially since there are so many lovely restaurants in Paris in which to choose. An experience such as this leaves a bad taste in one's mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything about it”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier80
Reviews.Content: From the aroma of fresh flowers in the lobby to the beds, to the spa to the brilliant service we received from the fantastic staff....amazing, amazing hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed excellence”
Reviews.Author: Spasmitis
Reviews.Content: My stay at George V to propose to my girlfriend was beyond my expectations. The service was impeccable - especially given the hotel was full due to Rolland Garros. Every staff member from bellboy to security to conceirge to gym staff seemed genuinely interested in anticipating your needs and making your stay enjoyable. The organisation of my proposal was nothing short of amazing - dinner at le cinq where they made some special additions for my girlfriend at my request, drinks at the bar then a well timed security escort to a location overlooking the Eiffel tower where they had set up candles, flowers and macaroons for a proposal just as the tower sparkled at 11pm. The experience came at a cost but it was worth it and we shall return. Great gym & spa, beautiful flowers everywhere you look and excellent decor throughout the hotel. A genuine 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Four Seasons Hotel Ever.”
Reviews.Author: dp7net
Reviews.Content: As you arrive to the hotel, the doormen are waiting for you with a smile and pretty much already know your names... the staff learns about your preferences very quickly, I don't know how they do it... as if they were all secret service agents trying to figure out your next move and get there before you do. Very impressive. The hotel's location is right off of the Champs-Elysée... and not far from the Crazy Horse Cabaret (walking distance) for a great night of entertainment... shops... tourism, business or just pure relaxation in the spa... it's all there at your fingertips. But all this comes with a price... but some things are priceless...

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon to remember (and repeat!)”
Reviews.Author: 2PhDs
Reviews.Content: [This review is from a stay before the date choices given; I thought we had entered a review at the time, but our TripAdvisor profile shows only 1 review from us (??)] From start to (delayed!) departure, this was the magical trip we had hoped it would be. We planned to stay 5 nights, and ended up leaving, with great regret, after 10 days in the most beautiful hotel in the most beautiful city! This was an especially precious trip, as a medical emergency almost derailed our wedding. (Indeed, we needed to postpone our wedding - at a different Four Seasons - and were actually married in a hospital, "just in case". Fortunately, the originally planned arrangements were simply rescheduled just as planned, but a few months later. Our Honeymoon was similarly delayed by more than a year. Given this background, and the fact that this was a marriage later in life, we decided to splurge, realizing that we almost missed it all entirely...) The planning was easy, with direct contact with the Concierge, who returned all calls to the States at times requested. We gladly accepted the suggestion to be met at the Airport and assisted through to a car service, and this was a *great* decision. We were met immediately, helped with our luggage retrieval, and then escorted immediately through customs/immigration, bypassing all of the lines. (a very welcome relief after a less than stellar flight on American Airlines, where our first class seats were downgraded to business class (refund REFUSED!?) AND one of the seats didn't recline at all, and there was a note attached so American obviously knew about the problem.) We arrived early at the George V (and our ONLY disappointment during the entire stay was that we were NOT offered refreshments, nor offered a chance to use the Spa and pool, or a massage, while we sat for a few HOURS with merely some coffee). ALL disappoinment vanished when we were taken to an upgraded room with a *full* view of the Eiffel Tower! We were greeted by name every time we walked through the fabulous lobby (how *do* they remember names!?), and the Concierge helped with every request and reservation, large or small. One VERY special treat was to book a "couples massage" in the private spa room, and we booked an additional two hours there afterwards, and rose petals and champagne awaited us next to the included private spa (large hot tub), along with other refreshments waiting. We could have spent the entire day,,. The wall murals at the pool were just as charming as pictured, but the pool was much smaller than it had appeared. No problem, as that was not why we were there! Housekeeping was immaculate and discreet, and scheduled at our request. We had planned to visit surrounding areas after 5 days in Paris, but everything was so perfect, that we were delighted to find that we could extend our stay. (We had inadvertantly arrived just as the French Open was about to start, so having availability was no small feat!) We stopped by the other top hotels, either to browse, for a drink, or a meal, and all we can say is that EVERYTHING written about the rudeness elsewhere was true, and there wasn't even a hint of it at the Georges V! (The "best" experience elsewhere was late cocktails at the Plaza Athenee where we were served and then generally ignored - so we didn't bother with a second drink after waiting too long for anyone to appear to ask - but at least the service wasn't outright rude.) The concierge's suggestions were all excellent, from the transportation to Giverny, to small restaurants and cafes. We had a real treat at Versailles, because our room service waiter at breakfast that morning (we usually ate in the cafe, at the same table each morning) suggested we rent "golf carts". Golf carts at Versailles? Yes - and so after the inside tour, we found the little rental kiosk, waited a brief time for one to be returned, and spent the rest of the day scooting around the grounds, seeing so much more than we ever could have on foot! As others have commented (before our stay and after), there was a little "problem" with the bill: There were charges that we simply had not made. Given the total of our bill, it wasn't a lot extra, but we objected, in principle, to what is clearly a general practice: Either they hope one will not scrutinize the bill carefully, or that one will feel too awkward to protest. We noticed, and we definitely protested, although it took a very long time and a seemingly endless number of people who needed to get involved. THIS WAS *NOT* A WAY TO TREAT DEPARTING GUESTS; it definitely left a bad taste as the "most recent experience" of what otherwise had been everything that we had hoped for, and more... We have stayed at other 5-star properties in the USA and Europe (including three favorites, Surich's Dolder Grand, Vienna's Bristol, and our other real favorite, Claridges in London); unfortunately nothing in the USA truly compares with these, in atmosphere or service. [One of the newer Four Season's, in Seattle, is one of the least appealing "luxury" hotels ever! Its location is offputting, in what remains of the "seamy" underside of the city, and we decided to leave before we even checked in. (Whoever chose that site for a "Four Seasons" is presumably working elsewhere now!) The "name" alone does *not* guarantee anything! We returned immediately to the *former* "Four Seasons" hotel in Seattle, the Olympic - now a Fairmont. In addition to the better location, it has the "Old World Elegance" of the grand European hotels, although some rooms could benefit from some updating. Indeed, this was where we had our delayed wedding earlier, and we stayed in the grand suite that we were told - much to our surprise and dismay - was recently showcased on "The Bachelor"...] We've also stayed in several smaller and/or lesser rated hotels, where truly superb service was also present... and in far too many where it was not. TripAdvisor has been a real help; sorting through occasional cranky reviews, it's the "general/overall" reviews that have been truly helpful, with both occasional unexpected "finds", and avoiding places we might otherwise have headed... The George V

Reviews.Title: “OMG - The Best in the World is a deserved title”
Reviews.Author: GourmetGirl42
Reviews.Content: We visited Le Cinq their 2 Michelin starred restaurant for my special birthday. We were welcomed like Royalty and everything flowed in that vein. Great attention to the tinest detail. Whole experience beyond compare - even better than our previous best - Cipriani in Venice! Bear in mind that because of it's status one pays accordingly!! Definitely for that VERY special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: BushFreak
Reviews.Content: The service blew us away. Nothing was too much trouble. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Used the airport transfer that removed so much hassle through immigration etc.... Will definitely return. Already missing the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay, beautifull luxury hotel, perfect service !”
Reviews.Author: The_Attorney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the most beautifull and confortable i have stayed in !! The check in was fast and efficient, and so was the check out ! The staff are very professional and polite. The rooms are very confortable, the room service delicious, and the SPA amazing !! BRAVO !

Reviews.Title: “Heaven In Paris”
Reviews.Author: drandmrsd
Reviews.Content: The George V definitely lives up to its stellar reputation. From the glorious floral arrangements, to the exquisite service from the staff (especially their top-notch Concierge team) they provided us with a truly memorable Paris experience. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Service like no other.”
Reviews.Author: Denisetx
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights at this wonderful hotel. Hotel was fabulous. Our room was huge and immaculate, we faced the Eiffel tower as well. Service was 5 star, we did not have one issue with anyone at this hotel as we normally do. All very polite. 3 times a day maid service as well, my room has never been so clean on a vacation. Great location. The only thing you need to be aware of:: prices on hotel services. I guess since we are paying 800-1000 a night for a standard room they figure the higher charges on things such as Internet, mini bar, regular bar and room service should not be a big deal. Bring some cash, lots of it! Spa is terrific and after your treatment head to the relaxation room.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated,overdecorated,overnaffed”
Reviews.Author: farmergirlyorkshire
Reviews.Content: Wedding anniversary. Luckily I love my husband but he does have dodgy taste in hotels. I blame his pretensious childhood,aspirational middle class Surrey who confused hard graft with handouts from parents. This hotel is on their must see list. Explains why we disagree.Everyone wanted to be seen there and probably should wonder around gay paris wearing a chic jacket saying I pity you proles,I can afford the Cinq and want you to know it. Never again..

Reviews.Title: “Cheers!!! To the finer things in life :)”
Reviews.Author: travelbee38
Reviews.Content: If you are familiar with The Four Seasons hotels then this one is no different. It is in a great location walks away from Avenue Montaigne and Avenue des Champs-Elysées, where you can do some great high end shopping. If your in the mood to splurge or treat yourself like a celebrity I recommend this hotel. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Beware -- Soooo not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday. I had heard good things about the George V from several friends who had stayed there in the past, so agreed to pay 850E/night for a basic double room. The good news is that we booked a regular room online and were kindly offered an “upgrade” to a larger room because of the special occasion. Upon my request, we were also given a birthday cake and a bottle of champagne at arrival. I appreciated the complimentary boot shine. The hotel itself is beautiful and the spa/fitness area is wonderful. Everything is very clean and very tastefully done. The staff (lots of them) are all very polite -- I didn't perceive them as insincere but some might. Otherwise, I’m giving the hotel possibly my worst review ever on trip advisor. I wrote a complaint letter to the president of the company and have cut and pasted it into this review for your benefit. I'd never before felt the need to write a complaint letter about a hotel. We had to call housekeeping twice to get an ironing board brought into the room. I woke up ill, having forgotten to request only synthetic pillows and bed linens due to a down allergy. As we headed out around 10 a.m. on a Saturday, I asked a woman at the front desk to have all of the down pillows and comforter removed from the room. She politely said she would have it taken care of immediately and even picked up the phone as we were walking away. We returned to the room around 2 so that I could take a nap, still suffering from an allergic reaction to the down. I was too tired to look closely to ensure the change had been made – but feeling even worse after a 2 hour nap, I realized that housekeeping failed to change the pillows and comforter as promised. I called housekeeping and they called back right away at least 2 times and sent someone to make the change. The hotel didn’t have a synthetic comforter in the appropriate size – so I was given a king/queen synthetic comforter on my twin bed. The maid was delightful and very apologetic and calling other staff members frantically using a mobile phone while in our room in a valiant effort to correct the situation. I told her it wasn’t a big deal because she was so kind and trying so hard – and indeed it wasn’t a big deal to sleep with an oversized comforter that dragged on the floor – it just wasn’t the type of service I expected at 1200 USD/night. I requested a morning FT using the form provided – it never showed up – even though someone took the form off the doorknob. We were woken up every morning by the construction going on next-door. They clearly try to minimize the noise -- but a hammer is still a hammer at 8 a.m. In the mornings, I went to the lovely spa/fitness area for coffee and to read the FT that I knew would be there. I was looking forward to coffee and the FT in the room – but didn’t want to risk room service forgetting the paper and/or waiting for forever for room service to even show up. The spa attendants were generally very polite, one even gave us a very nice tour of the facilities. However, one of the spa attendants on the day I left was dreadful. As I sat there drinking coffee from the free coffee/tea/water bar area and quietly reading the paper – entirely alone in the area – I sensed her displeasure with my presence. I did a quick workout and took a cup of coffee from the bar up to the room. She looked at me as if I had taken a painting off the wall. I apologize for my stereotypical “ugly American” behavior of drinking coffee from a to-go cup – but at 1200 USD/night, *nothing* should have led that spa attendant to look at me in such a way. I was dressed in a t-shirt and shorts, just like all of the other folks going to and from the gym. And I was told specifically that the coffee was free – it wasn’t an area only for patrons awaiting treatments. The worst thing that happened of all – a woman, seemed to be a maid, came into my room quietly – without knocking – at 8:30 on Monday morning!!! I have NEVER had this happen, ANYWHERE. My friend had left for London about 1 hour before, so perhaps someone was sent to check on the room – but not phoning first or knocking on the door is simply unacceptable under any circumstances. Fortunately, I was putting my shoes on and saw her just as she put her first step into the room. I don’t know if she was sneaking in to see what she could take – or what – but she quickly apologized and left. At checkout, I was made to wait for 15-20 minutes until a “cashier” who could handle the payment transaction for my room was available. The 2 polite women at the front desk each said that they were only in training and couldn’t process payment. I had a nice conversation with a polite Swedish clerk – but I still sat there waiting for a really, really long time. She asked about my stay and indeed I told her about a few of my complaints that she wrote down -- but I didn't want to create a ruckus in such a quiet, lovely lobby with so many folks coming/going. I assume that because I carried my 2 small bags downstairs myself, they sent someone upstairs to check the room before letting me leave. This is understandable, of course, but it was very awkward to have to wait for so long. Maybe they were telling me the truth and they couldn’t in fact run my credit card for the room – but to make a guest wait for 15-20 minutes at 11 a.m. on a Monday to check out is ridiculous. If I was going to be made to wait for so long, they should have offered to have me wait in the bar area and given me a cup of coffee or water. No one else was waiting to check out – I was standing alone w/the clerks at the registration desk. Finally, a “cashier” showed up who showed me the bill. Someone had charged 18E for 2 coffees over the weekend onto the room that my friend and I did not have. I told the “cashier” that these were not my coffees and asked to see the signed receipt for them. He got a rather disgusted look on his face and said, “I’ll just take them off.” He clearly thought I was lying, and it was somewhat embarrassing. I meekly responded, “I am paying 18E for a local phone call to make lunch plans” to indicate that I wasn’t trying to argue with the prices for things I had used. (As you can imagine, the prices there are ridiculous -- so I can't really complain but you should be aware -- I paid 18E for a brief local call and 10E for a coke from the minibar. 25E for a cocktail. 40 - 50E for a cheeseburger. I didn't pay the 22E/day for internet access.) My friend and I are not regular guests at Four Seasons and I we checked in using tourist passports. Perhaps we were considered “low rent” guests, and thought we could be ignored as such. In any case, it wasn’t what I expected for the price – I would have been disappointed for half the price. Even in Paris you can do just fine at 425 E/night MANY places. If this is your first trip to Paris and you don't have a full-time hired car, you may not like the location. You might try the Meurice or Crillon -- each of which has a much better location for a first-time visitor to Paris. I can't say this experience ruined the trip -- but it certainly would have if we hadn't tried not to think of it, especially considering the price. Neither one of us would ever stay there again – nor would we recommend it to anyone for anything other than afternoon tea or one cocktail (make a reservation to ensure a table) before the bar gets too crowded with exceedingly flashy nouveau riche types and the band in the very beautiful lounge starts playing "Kalinka" and other Russian hymns.

Reviews.Title: “Unquestionably superb”
Reviews.Author: NW8Roamer
Reviews.Content: Two nights spent at the George V to celebrate my girlfriend's 30th birthday have left me speechless. This was, by some measure, the best experience that I have ever had in any hotel and I write as someone who has been fortunate to spend some 7 years travelling extensively in Europe, Asia and the US for business and leisure. I was concerned, given the history of the George V, that the experience might be somewhat stuffy for a relatively young couple (we are 31 and 30) but the service is so warm and considerate (throughout, even at the 2* Michelin restaurant, Le Cinq - again brilliant) that I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends of the same age in London. It is not cheap, but nor should it be for a hotel of this quality. They do what they do superbly, as one has come to expect of the Four Seasons - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Service is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rmendell7244
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large rooms! The best service ever! What a beautiful time!

Reviews.Title: “Parisians love their dogs”
Reviews.Author: homebody12
Reviews.Content: If you take your dog to the bar at the George V, they will bring you a silver water bowl for your pooch. Unbelievable place!

Reviews.Title: “Dream wedding”
Reviews.Author: css29
Reviews.Content: I recently held my wedding at the George V. Words can't capture the wonderful care that Christophe Rouen and his team took of us. At every turn, they were upbeat, informed, gracious, generous, and invariably anticipated my every question and need. We were a party of 11, plus a 3-month old. They took exceptional measures to make each of us, including the baby, feel comfortable and at home. Christophe seemed to feel as invested in the success and joy of the wedding as I was! We were treated like royalty. The rooms are impeccable - full of light and luxury. The beds are also fabulous. Wonderful place for a memorable and meaningful couple of days. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “George V Welcomes Dogs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Baglady_NJ
Reviews.Content: My name is Bella and I am a very cute Maltese that loves to travel so I am picky about where i lay my head. There is no better place in Paris for doggies then the George V. When I arrived at the hotel i was greeted by name and welcomed with a hand penned letter wishing me a lovely stay. Upon entering the room, I found a beautiful bed just waiting for me to snuggle. It came complete with homemade biscuits and fresh water supplied multiple times daily. The hotel ensured that my needs were met in everyway including dinner reservations wih my master at dog friendly two and three stars, the best table scraps ever!!! And, if i was left home alone, a sitter was supplied so I could play and feel entertained. A doggie never had it so good! I love the George V and am so happy my owners have booked for next year. It is in this dog's opinion the top hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but has a few issues”
Reviews.Author: LikeToTravel1963
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. However, I can't give it the same ranking I gave the Four Seasons London Park Lane. Or any other Four Seasons for that matter. There are a few issues that need to be resolved. I'll start with the bar. When I pay $1,500 a night for a room, I expect to be able to stop in for a drink at my hotel bar. Not here. I was turned away and told to go to my room and they would call when there is availability. That's a first for me at any hotel, and especially at a Four Seasons. I complained to the manager but he just said, "sorry". That's a major problem and it wasn't just one night. 2 of the 3 nights we walked down the street to have a drink. That really bothered me! The other night we went early enough to beat the crowd. I really wanted to see what was so great about this bar. It was a typical hotel bar. Nice, pricey, but nothing terribly special. The other issue is the renovation taking place on the upper floors. One morning it started at 8:00 and woke us up. I guess they had numerous complaints because the next morning it started much later. Do they really need to be told that 8:00 it too early for a jack hammer and drilling? The biggest issue that I had with the hotel is that it's very stuffy. I'm not sure it that was this hotel or just typical nice Paris hotels. Some of the people were great. As a matter of fact, most of the servers were great! The hotel just has a stuffy feel especially after coming from the Four Seasons in London where the hotel had a cool, fun feel. Next time I'm in Paris I will have to seriously evaluate the other options. I'm not saying I wouldn't stay here again, but for the price there might be better options.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Levon75
Reviews.Content: Very lavish hotel, never seen such opulence in my life. Service was friendly and very intuitive, which i like. best-paris-hotels.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “The George V was perfection”
Reviews.Author: LizandAl
Reviews.Content: The George V location is really convenient. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the staff are warm, friendly, attentive and professional. Nothing is too much trouble. Our room (209) was absolutely delightful - large, tastefully decorated with a large, full length window overlooking the beautiful courtyard. We were hoping the George V would meet our high expectations, and it did, but the warmth and friendliness of the staff surpassed it.

Reviews.Title: “In one word”
Reviews.Author: TiteCampanella
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. The best service ever. Well located, the hotel team call you by name even when you ask for a simple information. Expensive, very expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST HOTEL IN PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: ilovenudism
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Paris and we would visit the Georges V to get our supply of the BEST Parfums Paris offers. My mothers favorite ( and Jackie Kennedy's also) was Bal a Versailles( the most EXPENSIVE parfum in the world at the time (60's). Don't even miss all the celebrities who come through the front door ( they all come here!). Just remember, all filthy rich aren't exactly the most well maanered people in the world ( Americans usually talk down to the help as if they were animals (very uncool - Texans are my favorite example of people with NO CLASS!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lolmarlor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary so booked a deluxe suite and airport transfer. It was worth every penny. We were met by the hotel representative on the leaving the plane, whisked through customs and straight to the waiting car & check in to the hotel was done in our suite. Every request we made was accommodated with some beautiful extra touches, the service was simply superb. The location is fantastic for exploring Paris on foot and the Cinq restaurant in the hotel is definitely worth a visit. Be very hard to go back to Paris and stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: SGEverettWA
Reviews.Content: What can I say, Paris, the George V - WOW. This hotel really is all it claims to be. I was very a little anxious because I was afraid it might not live up to my expectations and it's reputation. Well it did. If this is heaven.. it is everything you would expect from this luxurious hotel. Staff is incredibly attentive and courteous. We had the Bed & Breakfast option and the breakfast is probably the best I have had anywhere in the world. Our room was extremely nice with a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were large and extremely clean and well stocked. The hotel knew we were celebrating our 35th Wedding Anniversary and had a chilled bottle of Champagne and a lovely chocolate cake from Laruree in our room on arrival. Just once in your life you must stay at the George V in Paris, you will never forget it. It truly is the experience of a lifetime. It doesn't come cheap - our room, which was considered a superior room - with the breakfast option was around $1,200 per night. But we planned for it and budgeted in our trip and don't regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: CrissCross
Reviews.Content: I just love this place. Period. Oh, and spectacular breakfast. 2 Tips : Be prepared, expensive If you don't like your room, move.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: CharleyToronto
Reviews.Content: I could literally go on and on about this fantastic place so I will keep it short. Excellent everything; service, rooms, ambiance, restaurants (my favorite La Galerie), etc. etc. I will be returning for as long as my wallets allows! Yes, it is pricey, but in my opinion it takes the Paris experience to a whole other level. A ten on my website! www.mybeautifulparis.com.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best Christmas..... Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: loveaholiday101
Reviews.Content: We booked two adjoing suites for the Christmas holidays...Having had our wedding reception the prior year. From the greetings to the room service to the restaurants, to the Father Xmas, to teh Swarovski Crysal Xmas trees and then back to the Xmas Lunch and service - a very big thank you from a very pleased family...

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluewater81
Reviews.Content: On any basis this is a top rate, luxury hotel in a class of it's own. The reception area, bar, dining area (where breakfast is served) are beautiful. My suite was extremely comfortable if perhaps not particularly individual. The service is faultless if slightly impersonal. All this comes at a price of course, and being on a large scale the hotel slightly lacks intimacy. But it's hard to find fault with this Four Seasons flagship.

Reviews.Title: “A Splurge but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWanderlust
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in Paris. Even though we've been to Paris many times and have stayed in little boutique hotels that we've found on TripAdvisor, we decided to splurge for a Four Seasons experience. I was a little reluctant to spend the extra money for the room, but we were not disappointed. The service was excellent--what you would expect from the Four Seasons. We arrived early, around 10:30 am and asked if we could have our room when it was available (check in is at 3:30pm). The woman at the front desk was gracious and told us it would be ready at noon. After a leisurely breakfast in the lobby, we were able to get our room early. We travel often and my husband said that the bed at the George V was the most comfortable bed that he's ever slept on. I spent time in the spa one day. I don't think the deluxe pedicure is worth the price, but the atmosphere was wonderful. Definitely would return to George V!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Michael1265
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife are constant travelers and this Hotel is just PERFECT for a luxury stay! Elegant and spacious rooms, classy, quiet, with attentive and gentle service, the crew was just amazing! If you can afford it's really worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Fun”
Reviews.Author: maruskaiv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently enjoyed a few weeks in Paris and this visit we stayed at the George V. Usually we prefer boutique hotels but decided to try this particular Four Seasons as we have loved their other hotels throughout the world. We were not disappointed as the room was gorgeous, large, and the amenities in the bathroom exquisite. Room service breakfast was sumptuous. We have already reserved for next Spring!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaLeander
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are pretty fussy about hotels and our stay at the Four Seasons George V was perfect. The only thing I would rethink was getting a couple of shirts pressed at 25 Euros each! Tru its not for the budget traveler but if you have the budget its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel702
Reviews.Content: Obviously the Four Seasons Paris is gorgeous. The flower arrangements were stunning, the rooms were huge and beautiful (only 1 sink in the bathroom was odd for a FS). The spa area and pool were also beautiful. However, I did not like the neighborhood. I think the area is good for shopping but it is not charming and you really feel like a tourist. The lady at check in was friendly but I think she was the only staff member I encountered who was nice. The staff were courteous, but not warm and welcoming. I felt uncomfortable in the lobby and common areas and it always seamed like a huge inconvenience to ask anyone a question. Also, I wish there was somewhere from the hotel to view the Tour Eiffel- you are so close, yet cannot see it except from certain rooms. It was fun to stay here because it is such a legendary hotel, however I did not leave wanting to return next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris”
Reviews.Author: wsofrin
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons was fantastic, though very American. No detail was missed, and the staff was amazing. I really enjoyed the location and the bar. The pool and spa was amazing, and I am looking forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly hotel in world's most romantic city”
Reviews.Author: travelaussiefamily
Reviews.Content: An awesome hotel, right from the minute you walk in the front door. Extravagant floral displays, people dressed to the nines. We stayed for 10 days in a suite, which was a wonderful indulgence. Breakfast in the restaurant, Cinq, is an experience worth having, with a small pedestal for handbags provided. The hot chocolate is to die for and al the food is exquisite. Rooms are beautiful. Service at a great standard. A memorable and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should experience this hotel at least once!”
Reviews.Author: Starlight36
Reviews.Content: The George V is outstanding: the personnel, the service, the cuisine, the friendly, welcoming staff, the fresh, unique flower arrangements, everything from the moment you enter this beautiful hotel. You would love the lobby lounge (Galiera) with its live piano music. The dining room, Cinq, is exquisite; everyone should experience it at least once....lunch menu is more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, did not want to leave !!”
Reviews.Author: Rugbyplayer25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days on a business trip Perfect location great for Champs-Élysées and most of the main attractions The services was pretty dam good. Heba the Manageress was very helpful with every request. Christophe at the concierge was on top form booking the best restaurants. Gabriele Z one of the downstairs managers was excellent Its not a cheap place, so try not to look at the bill till you get home! I would love to stay here again I ate at Annapurna (indian) which was nice also at RATN (amazing)

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Beauty and Perfection”
Reviews.Author: femalenomadtraveler
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in the World. Would not even hesitate to go again. Perfect experience in every possible way. Worth every penny without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & Best Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: wildcat8387
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 50th Birthday. Wanted to get a dinner reservation for Le Jules Verne but no matter how hard I tried could not due to it being a national holiday in France. I reported this to the concierge and 'voila', I had a dinner reservation right at 7 pm as I wished! They staff was also incredibly attentive, the grounds immaculate and the location perfect. Pricey but you get what you pay for here. Rooms could have been a little bigger but this is an older hotel. Overall, a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hpmarge
Reviews.Content: the service at Four Seasons George Paris is unsurpassed. we've stayed at many 5 star hotels all over Europe and this hotel has the best service (and they give the same great service to everyone irregardless of your celebrity status or lack thereof). Four Seasons Hotels are cosistent with it's quality from property to property.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable, but not entirely perfect.”
Reviews.Author: DiorDarling
Reviews.Content: Our accommodation of choice in Paris is a perfect little 18th Century apartment in the Marais. Charlotte, the apartment maid for the past 7 years, is what brings us back to this apartment year after year. Alas, our 'home' wasn't available for the first few nights of our stay in Paris and so we decided to book the George V for our first 2 nights in Paris. The experience was exceptional. The hotel presents perfectly, as we've come to expect from Four Seasons properties. Expect uber-luxe! Huge tapestries, an abundance of floral arrangements (which interestingly are rotated throughout the hotel three times a day), gold gilt, staff everywhere who address you by name. The experience is without a doubt special. But you do pay for it! Our nightly rate was just over $1500AUD. And for this, we received an exquisite room with a sumptuous bed, a bathroom covered in marble, a view of the Eiffel Tower, and a standard continental breakfast. Admittedly, the china upon and in which our croissants and (mediocre) coffees were served were beautiful. But really, you get very little else. Dining, room service, laundry, internet, and just about everything else is pretty much 'robbery'. But you're in Paris, and this is the George V. They charge as much as they do simply because they can. And people will and do pay. If you're the kind of traveller who needs to look at the prices on the dinner menu so that you can budget your meal, this is not the place for you. It is a case of 'if you have to ask, you can't afford it!' Honestly. For those wanting to visit Paris as a 'tourist' with a healthy serving of Parisienne pomp and glamour - stay here. The location is superb for those with a preference for being driven around rather than catching the metro or walking. Avenue de Montaigne (where ALL the fashion boutiques are, and my personal must-do) is just down the road. And if you're after the 'Pretty Woman' experience of waltzing into a hotel lobby, where the bell-boy lightens your load of designer shopping bags, then this is your hotel! Or, if you're wanting to experience 'la vie Parisenne' where you'll walk the streets, buy your own groceries at street food markets, pop into a cafe for your morning breakfast, (as my husband and I prefer to do,) perhaps opt for a more discrete hotel or book a holiday apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Comedy of errors”
Reviews.Author: TraLonW
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 18.15 to take a pre dinner drink and were seated in the outdoor court yard. At 18.40 the waitress came with a drinks menu. At 18.50 we ordered and it promply started to rain so we were led into the Bar. A bar person came over with the drinks menu so we explained we had ordered in the courtyard and were assured our drinks were on their way. During the next 25 minutes two further bar persons came over with the drinks menu, so we gave the same previous response. By 19.15 still no sign of the drinks so we left as had a dinner to attend at 19.30. Very poor service

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for - sublime service, exquisite environs at premium price”
Reviews.Author: gadabouting
Reviews.Content: we held our wedding reception at the George V in May. we and our family and friends (small reception, under 50 guests including children) were blown away by the world-class service at every step of the way. we have stayed at the George V in the past, but planning a wedding reception obviously raises the bar at any venue. we were delighted to confirm that at the George V you are indeed interacting with true professionals who have the ability to problem-solve, act independently and do it all with infinite patience and a smile. all this made for a simply magical weekend - intimate, warm and memorable to a tee. please note, as in any event of this nature, there are inevitable last-minute changes and issues - so what you are looking for is not the mythical perfect wedding where everything goes as planned, but a team where the unexpected is handled with perfect aplomb and adroitness. all that said, the four seasons knows that it is world-class and is priced accordingly. but if true value is getting what you pay for, then the George V delivers on all counts

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sisIreland
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not live up to our expectations, we had constant delays in getting tables for breakfast and for dinner and the service from the staff was diffident at best. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Chicagolikes2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in late May. It was our second visit -- this time, we brought our two young children. Although this hotel probably does not leap to most people's minds as a great place for a family vacation with young kids, we were pleasantly surprised at the level of service they provided. For example, we used their car service to/from CDG. Highly recommend this as they provided car seats for the children and an escort to help with customs/luggage. Much appreciated after a long flight with cranky toddlers. Our suite had an ajoining room for the nanny and children. They thought of every detail-- from a changing table, to toys, to tiny bath robes. The housekeeping staff went out of their way to help us with anything we needed. They even helped us order pizza when the nanny got tired of "french food". Yes, it is expensive (and the doormen seemed baffled by our double stroller). However, it is a beautiful property with excellent service. Our favorite place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pantonm
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Four seasons Hotel with my husband and can say that it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The foyer was breathtaking with the floral display. Service was exceptional, nothing was too much. We forgot to bring our toothbrushes and toothpaste, one call to housekeeping 5 minutes later we had what we needed. An elegant high class hotel with exceptional service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons - George V”
Reviews.Author: Jnean
Reviews.Content: I went to the Prettiest Hotel I've ever seen two nights in a row, had the foie gras, salmon, goat cheese canapes at the bar. Went back the following night for more and had dinner --- Sole Meuniere and potatoes were excellent , the flowers throughout the hotel lobby were amazing -- staff was really nice --service was impeccable of course

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Etienne_paris
Reviews.Content: What an amazingly beautiful hotel just steps away from the Champs-Elysees. For our anniversary; my husband booked us a weekend Paris where we stayed in the four seasons. This was just a perfect stay in a place of luxury. The rooms were fantastic, clean and big. The property is nicely decorated with flowers everywhere. There is a beautiful hanging garden courtyard. Staff is very friendly, arranging tickets for you, whenever you ask. For sure you must try to spa and pool, which looks like you step back in time. Ceilings and walls are decorated wiht frescos. The lockers are very private wiht shower area. The breakfast is amazing. Only negative is that fact thats it is very big, but that is something you know when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: misdirected_baggage
Reviews.Content: Booked via AMEX Platinum and was upgraded to a spacious suite with tangential views of the George V Boulevard. Soundproofing was excellent and I never heard any street noise. As expected, staff was superb. We splurged on a dinner at George V and it was exceptional (book well in advance, however). Breakfast and dinner staff were exceptionally friendly, remembered names and preferences from day-to-day. Needed a haircut and color to fit between other appointments and the staff responded perfectly. The concierge called his colleague at another hotel to help us determine whether a particular venue was worth visiting. The location is great for shopping and touring, although traffic can be a bit tough to negotiate around rush hour. More expensive than many alternatives, but well worth the premium.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons George V Paris. The best hotel in the World.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerToorak
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from 4 wonderful days in Paris. I stayed at the fabulous Four Sasons George V. I travel extensively throughout the world and whenever it is possible I always stay at a Four Seasons Hotel. It is, without doubt, the best chain of hotels in the world and the" Jewel in the Crown " is the Four Seasons George V in Paris. The foyer with it's amazing floral display, the lounge where one can sit and sip champagne, the bar and the dining room together with the rooms are just beyond description however what makes this hotel stand out, together with the other hotels in the group, is the staff. They are friendly, attentive and they seem to anticipate your every wish. Frankly I do not know how they do it, not to mention that they remember your name and address you, by your name,every time you go out of or into the hotel. Remarkable ! All that I can suggest is that next time that you are going to Paris you must stay at the Four Seasons George V Hotel or for that matter anywhere that you travel in the world stay at a Four Seasons Hotel or resort. It is an experience that you will not forget .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Qnstrvlr
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! Wonderfully maintained, located a few blocks from the champs d'elyse. The rooms are comfortable had wonderful details (chandeliers, moulding, juliet balconies). Also, our room had spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower. We had a chance to eat at the restaurant and both the food and service were spectacular. Despite the fact that we don't speak French, my husband and I found that almost everyone at the hotel spoke either English or Spanish and we were able to effectively communicate with everyone. Recommend this for a romantic escape with the one you love.

Reviews.Title: “We received much, much more than expected!”
Reviews.Author: jimsueSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I read several reviews, and then decided on the George V for our anniversary trip to Paris. We were looking for a traditional Parisian setting, with over the top elegance and luxury. We also expected a high level of service, and a room meeting the international standard for the Four Seasons name. We received much, much more!!! We are back home and still discuss the employees, the restaurants and the classical beauty of the hotel. The decor was fresh, and we did not find one thing in need of maintenance. Floral arrangements were magnificent and abundant - especially welcome during several rainy spring days. Service in the dining room was perfect, but not stuffy or uncomfortable. So far, we can't find a description for the unique and special intangible qualities that make this hotel an unbelievable experience. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore George V”
Reviews.Author: VenusXX
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is breathtaking and amazing perfectly maintained. you would not ever feel its 10 yrs old. every thing is shining. the team is so professional and they smile all the time. What I really like that they have the Ipod Stereo, I can't live without my music, and it is always very hard to travel with your own speakers. whenever I travel I badly miss my music. I was just thinking about it on the way, And here I am I step in the room and I find it :o) I was so HAPPY :o) I was listening to my music all my stay :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: sayaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my husband for a romantic valentines away from the kids. We really enjoyed our stay there, the rooms are spacious and beautiful, the bedding amazingly comfortable (higher standards than other 4 seasons) and the service is really good, which is not always obvious in Paris... Amazing breakfast. We would definitely stay there again. The only downside as far as I am concerned is the size of the hotel. It really is very big and makes it somehow quite impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zzzebra
Reviews.Content: The service is superb and the room was beautiful. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “top class”
Reviews.Author: Mycafebar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Suite for 4 night as part of our honeymoon trip. I cannot think of any down side of this hotel but lots of good points: - fantastic services and very friendly and helpful staffs, everything are well thought and provided . - classy deco, amazing flower arrangements everywhere in the hotel (very Parsian !) I love it !! The furnitures are just so gorgeous . - the best amenities in the room including so many different kinds of the BEST snacks, chocolate and drinks in the mini-bar -very nice classy room overlooking the beautiful garden -nice shops inside the hotel -nice soft music around the hotel providing a soft mood and vibe WELL DONE what an experience . !

Reviews.Title: “Most prestigious address and unique decor, but not the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: OLV_P
Reviews.Content: GEORGE V is more than just a luxury hotel, it is a institution, which is also the most pure reflection of French sophistication and good taste. Because of its unique location and architecture, the GEORGE V cannot be compared with the other luxury hotels in the French capital. Staying at the GEORGE V is an invaluable experience ! The royal standard of service which all guests benefit from, puts the GEORGE V in a league of its own. The beautiful antiques throughout the hotel, the most spectacular flower arrangements and its top cuisine are just some of the key features of this palace hotel in the heart of Paris. Unfortunately, fame and reputation have given the Four Seasons George V an air of sufficiency, even arrogance, assuming an unbeatable international leadership. More than 10 years since it reopened as a Four Seasons, the hotel hasn't been renovated. Many would argue that the hotel does not need such major renovations in a relatively short period of a luxury palace hotel type. However, in today's luxury standards, it is unacceptable that the George V hasn't changed many essentials. Towels look and feel used, most probably in use for more than two years. The bed linen is so old, the labels have become white, not showing any information (brand, quality, year etc) and also some bed linen have slightly different colours. As for the bathroom, it is unacceptable for such as hotel to use artificial cosmetics, heavily fragranced and containing only artificial ingredients. The snobbish factor of a brand such as BVLGARI no longer suffices and discerning travellers are already enjoying pure organic products at competing hotel chains. As in all other major capitals of the world, it has taken Four Seasons to be ''woken up'' by openings of Mandarin Oriental, which have taken almost immediately the leading position in each city. Mandarin Oriental opens in Paris late 2010 and it is likely to claim its leading position in Paris within a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, but not our favorite Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: seattletraveller2007
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything that's actually bad about this Four Seasons. It's up to scratch in all the ways you expect Four Seasons to be - opulent lobby with nice contemporary artwork, very nice public spaces, great restaurant and bars. It just lacks a little personality compared to other places. It fancies itself as the "Grand Dame" of Paris "palace" hotels, but arguably Crillon / Ritz / Bristol are more "characterful". The service here was also just a bit "off" - a little disinterested, more than anything. Could be it's resting on its laurels a little. There's just a hint of eurotrash about some of the guests, which unfortunately some of the staff seemed to pander to, and which gives a hotel a very different vibe to a comparable property in, say, NYC. However, I'd give special praise to the Cinq restaurant. Fantastic service, just the right balance of unobtrusive and engaged, and very different to the stuffiness you get somewhere like Le Grand Vefour. Try the spectacular tasting menu with paired wines for a gastronomic treat (but be ready to drop $1000+). Place is a bit overpriced even by Paris standards. Location is great if you want to be around Champs Elysee, but the area is a bit of a tourist trap. Overall, I think next trip we'll go back to the Park Hyatt off Place Vendome, where we had a truly memorable stay in a beautiful, discreet and hidden gem. The showiness and glitz of the Four Seasons Georges Cinq will appeal to some, but it's kind of a weird mix of stuffy old europe and hedge-fund new money for my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “most expensive four seasons ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: scoi00
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative that can be said about this FS. It's the same standard then the other FS in Milano, Provence, mexico city , Boston, Los Angeles, NY ... etc... etc.. But is it really worth to pay that much (and so much significally more then in other FS) just because of a friendly staff ? There is not even an interesting view. and .. have you ever payed 74 euros for a simple continental breakfast for two in your life ? Rooms are big, furniture is nice , bathtub was radically smaller then in other FS. At this price you would at least expect a B&O TV and a decent sound system and not a pretty standard JVC with it's remote control and some other DVD player with yet another remote control and a Bose docking station that does not work with iphones but seems just with old Ipods. That after charging 800 euros for a room you have to pay anther 20+ euros for internet access can only be considered "cheap"..... (at least something)... Great service .. definitely .. but too high price for it.

Reviews.Title: ““EXCELLENT HOTEL – WONDERFUL LOCATION””
Reviews.Author: MairiGR
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for seven nights, the reception staff were excellent, check in was quick and smooth, the room was a good size with nice views of the harbour, the bathroom was a good size, one huge double bed, a safe and mini bar. The hotel does have a bar/restaurant and wifi internet access. The hotel is centrally located and close to shops, bars and restaurants. Lots of shopping in surrounding area. Excellent hotel with wonderful staff in great location. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection...”
Reviews.Author: diomede16
Reviews.Content: As usual, Four Seasons doesn't let you down and this place is no exception. Five days of blissful pleasure and excellent food & wine!

Reviews.Title: “The Finest Hotel I've Ever Set Foot In”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGuy23
Reviews.Content: This is the finest hotel I've ever sit foot in, on all fronts: room size and furniture; service; cleanliness; location; lobby; spa; and more. For sure, $1000 a night is terribly costly and just not an option for many. And we stayed there reluctantly. We've stayed in Paris for $200 a night (Prince du Conde) and loved it. But we found the $500 a night options awful and overpriced. So, when compared to the rest, I'm not sure this isn't a bargain, albeit an expensive one. At the least, walk into the lobby and inquire of a room. It may be a splurge worth even just one night. Truly, a magnificent hotel; what all hotels should aspire to be, at some level.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Ultimate Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: AlGanda
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell; The Good : - Luxuries - Clean - Excellent food - TV had wide variety - barely any other hotels in Paris are in the same league as this one The Bad: - tooooo Pricey - We arrived to hotel around 3pm (check in time). Room was provided to us at 5pm!

Reviews.Title: “one night in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Hollydcaley
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the four seasons in Paris and this is the only reason I would want to return to Paris. The staff is amazing, friendly, when all other Parisians were not, and their attention to detail surpassed our every expectation. I would encourage anyone staying in Paris to spend at least one night here if at all possible. LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly shocking service......”
Reviews.Author: whittir
Reviews.Content: I took my family to the George V for an extended weekend for my sisters 40th birthday. I am fortunate enough to have stayed in a number of Four Seasons Hotels particularly in Asia. My experiences have always been extremely positive and would recommend the hotels in HK, Bali and Mauritius particulalry. My experiences however at Goerge V were significantly different, many items were small issues but all left a feeling of extremly poor service and a complete lack of regard for the guest. The items contributing to this were as follows: We had asked for an early check-in but this was not available which was fine so we all went for some lunch and came back at the suggested check in time later in the afternoon. We had three rooms booked two of which were now ready for use. The remaining room was not ready for another 3 hours. There was a cursory apology but nothing more. When we finally got to the last room the luggage was delivered but had been damaged between reception and the room. The room although non-smoking smelt strongly of smoke. The ladies were booked in for a spa. The marble floor in the Spa was wet and my mother slipped and fell badly. The hotel nurse was called, she called a dcotor who duly arrived. The doctor felt my mother needed to go to hospital so teh hotel staff pointed her and my father (both in their 70's) to the cab rank saying teh hotel could not allow thier cars to assist. Having waited for 10-15mins for a cab my mother got to hospital. Clearly this did put a dampner on the trip and it took some three months for my mother to fully recover. The rest of the weekend was by comparison uneventful. When it came to our departure and I was paying the bill I noticed that I had been charged for both my Mothers Spa treatments and teh call out charges for the doctor. When I pointed this out the lady admitted that the Spa charges were an error but insisted a doctor had been called and I needed to pay. I pointed out that it was that the floor of the Spa was wet and she should check with teh manager. She did this and he agreed I should not be charged. What was planned to be a celebration af my sisters 40th was well and truly ruined by the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but wouldn't stay there again on a future trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFDC
Reviews.Content: (I'm updating TripAdvisor with long overdue reviews of all the place we've been, hope they are helpful). My husband and I stayed at the FS George V about a year. It's undoubtedly a great hotel, but I wouldn't rush back on our next trip. PROs - the service is very good, hotel is beautiful - some rooms have views of Eiffel Tower, ours didn't CONs - location. We found it hard to get cabs and would have much preferred to be closer to the Tuileries, Place Vendome, etc Next time I think I'll try the Park Hyatt or some other boutique property.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money and room felt like an upmarket Marriott”
Reviews.Author: trollydollySydney
Reviews.Content: Lovely location , however, for 820 euros this was really bad value. The room was nice, but you could have been anywhere in the world- it felt like a chain hotel in the worst sense. The room was tiny!Normally Four Seasons have mind blowing service and although they were nice it was not amazing. We had just been to Claridge's in London which was fantasic and half the price. It wasn't bad , but it wasn't great and not worth the money. A coke was 10 euros! There was no free wireless- all in all very average.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: dome025
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i've ever stayed in Location, lobby, room, bar, restaurant, everything is perfect the staff is superb the best one is an italian bar manager (or restaurant manager) i do not know... that helped us in giving information on the area and being able to find us a table at the bar in 2 minutes, even if we did not have reserved. He helped us like he was serving queen elizabeth...but whitout let us feeling embarassed....lovely guy! anyway, if you go you will have the best in paris

Reviews.Title: “Perfection - A wonderful birthday destination”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Chris
Reviews.Content: George V is by far the best hotel in Paris. Beautiful rooms with lovely amenities. Polite service and spectacular location. This is the place to stay and our new Paris favourite. We have stayed in some of Paris' best known ones too. My husband had told them it was my birthday and there was a magnificent chocolate cake and champagne in the room. We had a view of the eiffel tower! The gym and pool were wonderful and I wish that I had had time to make an appointment in the spa, because it looked amazing. The room was quiet! They have obviously done wonders with their refurbishments, keeping the grand style of a French palace, but the modern amenities one expects in luxury hotels. Again, we have stayed in various luxury hotels in Paris and had real problems sleeping due to noise in hallways and adjoining rooms - this is not a problem at the Geirge V!

Reviews.Title: “Oh, the Four Seasons!!”
Reviews.Author: FromNYCtoTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons does it again! The hotel is impeccable. Just divine. The George V is traditional Paris and the Four Seasons delivers in every way. The gorgeous courtyard... the amazing lobby... the elegant and fabulous bar. Excellent location. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding at George V”
Reviews.Author: md1860
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at George V, Salon Louis XIII on November 12th, 2009. This hotel well deserves its reputation as being the number one Hotel of Paris (may be the world) in terms of its luxury and features. Therefore, I will not say more about the Hotel, I am writing this review about the service we got before and during our ceremony. Please note that we live in Canada and we decided to have a destination wedding. At the beginning we didn’t have a clear idea about where we should have our wedding. We first thought of a Caribbean destination and hired a travel agency to organize it for us. We soon realized that although all the hotels provide wedding packages, none of the Hotel guaranteed us privacy (for the ceremony at the beach or gazebo) and special arrangement (at one of their restaurant) since they have to take care of other customers at the same time with their limited capacity. Then, we decided to have it in Paris and we contacted many hotels and restaurants about our inquiry. We received replies from maybe 10% of the venues we contacted, and only one phone call, which was from George V. Romy Zerah, Senior Assistant Catering Manager of George V called us shortly after our sending in our query. She wanted to have a better feeling of our dream wedding and how she could help us make it happen. At the beginning I thought that we would not able to organize our ceremony at this Hotel due to our limited budget. However, after a few phone calls and e-mails; Romy offered us a customized plan which suited all our needs and budget. Romy also took initiative to contact our wedding planner to make sure that the Officiant and Harpist were provided with adequate setting to perform comfortably. On November 10th, we met Pauline Ehrhart, Conference Manager, at the Hotel and she reconfirmed all the details while giving us a tour of the Hotel and the Salon. On the wedding day, Pauline also welcomed us in front of the Hotel and she stayed with us until we left the hotel to make sure that everything went according to plan. As for the ceremony, it was held in the Salon Louis XIII. This room was perfect for us in terms of size as we were a total of 23 people. It had a very impressive interior design and it was beautifully decorated for our event. The room setting was theatrical (two rows with one aisle) for the ceremony; and then later replaced with one long impressive dining table to enjoy champagne and wedding cake. In addition, we noticed so many small but complementary details that added to our event. All the staff involved (from the moment we arrived until we left the hotel) was also exceptionally professional, helpful and friendly. Therefore, I recommend this hotel for its very high standard in providing quality customer service along with its beauty, to everybody especially those who would like to organize their special event in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing Hotel for a Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bdsa
Reviews.Content: My husband took me away to Paris for a suprise weekend for our anniversary. I had mentioned years before that if we could ever stay in the Georges V I'd love it as I read that they are one of the best in the world for service. So it was a fantastic surprise that we were staying there. We had a corner suite which was very chic, very French. In the evening we had dinner in their 2 star restaurant. Elegant, chic, delicious food, impeccable service, quite an experience. I loved it. They take great pride in what they do and it really shows. It is such a treat to stay in a place like this, even if it is a once in a lifetime experience. We're still under 40 and also love younger hipper hotels, but for the experience of old time style and elegance, this is wonderful (though very very expensive).

Reviews.Title: “very nice not best in the world but very nice”
Reviews.Author: guy999
Reviews.Content: I recently went to paris for 10 days and spent the entire time at the george v. It has everything you would expect for this class of property. A concierge showed me to my room and gave me the layout. Everything was great, view etc, but for 15,000 us for 10 days you would probably expect that. Pros: -great location -great food, the breakfast is awesome, however you need to arrive early if you want to eat breakfast in le cinq, that only happened 3 times in our 10 days. The other areas are sufficient but not quite at the level of le cinq. -great spa and pool- a pool in paris, and it is amazing. I wish I had gone down to the spa earlier in my trip because i could have spent the entire time in that pool. -great concierge in terms of reccomendations and reservations. Never had any problems getting in anywhere, however it was the end of november in a global recession so I'm not sure that we would have had trouble getting into places. -the view from our room is probably the best i've ever stayed in my life. cons: -have to get up early to get into le cinq -costs are pretty crazy, especially with the us dollar being so weak costs are just crazy -i felt more warmth from the front office at four seasons geneva, maybe it's a smaller hotel but I did enjoy that. They were always nice and very professional but it felt more corporate professional type feel and I liked the more intimate feel in geneva, especially they greeted me by name etc. -i did go out of my way to say that i'm going to be there for a long time so i would have thought that over time that would change, but pretty much you can stay 2 nights and 10 nights and the level of service isn't going to change and the level of friendliness of the staff isn't going to change. This could be by design, I'm sure many people would enjoy that. Would I stay there again? I don't know. I really enjoyed the view and the food and all, but the cost is so excessive I think I would probably look around and then decide. That being said you will never get a better view that this one.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: rtschye
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel in a great part of Paris! The staff was extremely friendly from the moment we arrived until the last second of checking out. We found the room duplex suite to spacious and luxurious. The views of the Eiffel Tower were spectacular. The concierge does an amazing job of helping out with tours, and restaurants. The bartenders in the bar were extremely friendly and outgoing. I wish they were more outgoing when it came to offering up the car service but other than that it was the perfect weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: anton1966
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a very nice location but it is very, very expensive. The public areas are very clean and beautiful although in terms of decor it lacks a little charm. In fact (owned by a Saudi Prince) it looks like an Arabian Palace trying to be a Parisian hotel. The the room was very nice, if not slightly formed. Linen very good and the bathroom was excellent although standard for most FS I've stayed in. This hotel is very much the head of the luxury set in Paris although maybe I think the Plaza Atenee is better.

Reviews.Title: “George V, Paris, a memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: JuliPurrz
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderful hotel. Plush, chic and very classy. The services rendered was superb. Food, location and service staffs are top notch. Be prepared to be pampered and pay big bucks for the ultimate indulge.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Heaven”
Reviews.Author: ABCnyc
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Paris is simply heaven on earth - it is a stunning, luxurious, grand hotel with impeccable customer service. We went for my 40th birthday and the hotel did not disappoint. Upon arrival, there was a bottle of champagne, a small chocolate cake and a handwritten note from the manager welcoming us. Yes, we paid dearly for this hotel, but we experienced what has to be the industry's gold standard. Professional, friendly, warm staff always looking to go above and beyond for guests. A large, comfortable bed with down comforter and crisp clean sheets. A huge, spotless marble bathroom with tub, shower, 2 sinks and Bulgari toiletries. Soundproof windows and dark drapes so you can get a solid night's sleep. What I loved the most was the customer service and the plush, opulent feel of the hotel. The location off Champs Elysees was convenient to the Metro, but it felt a bit like a business neighborhood. (I would have preferred it to be on the Left Bank or a more interesting neighborhood.) If you can afford this splurge for a special occasion, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Conceirge”
Reviews.Author: Petekoolkid
Reviews.Content: The Hotel George V Paris is one of those legendary hotels you read about in novels and magazines so as I had not been to Paris for 30 years and it was my birthday, why not treat my wife and self, even though it did blow my holiday budget for the next year. It did not disappoint. I agree with all the comments of the previous reviewers. For us mere mortals, it is a once in a life time experience, 3 days to remember. Before I booked, I read on Trip Advisor, that the Concierge could get you tickets for almost anything. And they did. An excellent seat at the Moulin Rouge, jump the queues at the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre and unbelievably, a reservation at Jules Verne Restaurant in the Eiffel Tower for my birthday, where there is a three month wait for a table. And they also arranged a tour around Paris in an old open top Citroen 2CV. Splendid. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: 021810a
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights during late October 2009. Beautiful hotel, very luxurious with wonderful staff and service. Chic and stylish floral arrangements throughout the property. 24 hour business centre. Treated like royalty for the duration of our stay. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “i have high expectations but it manages to exceed them”
Reviews.Author: rubyyao
Reviews.Content: okay this hotel is expensive but i must say it is worth it. it is one of the most beautiful four seasons i've been in, quite up there with four seasons firenze and the one in budapest. i've heard a lot of great things about the four seasons george v and it manages to still take my breath away as soon as i walked in. the bar and the corridor leading to le cinq is simply gorgeous. service is superb needless to say. definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: spaldingnh
Reviews.Content: Resided here over Christmas and New Years. I can honestly report that this Hotel lacks any real hospitality. The Lobby is small and there is a lot of tourist lingering about this property. I wish the linens were frette and the staff were better trained. It just seemed to me that there main objective is to try to extract as much money as they can from you but lack real class and sophistication. Next trip to Paris we will be staying at Le Meurice Hotel, Paris instead. Location is good and that is the only positive aspect of this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: LondonWaterBaby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Paris for a "mini-moon" after our wedding. The location is perfect just off the Champs Elysees and the Avenue George V hence excellent for shopping and sightseeing. The porters were excellent, reception immediately realised we were recently married and referred to me as "Mrs" which was a smooth touch. The hotel provided complimentary bottle of champagne and some chocolates to welcome us. The room was excellent in quality and the amenities first class. There was an I-Pod docking station, tv, DVD etc. The bathroom was large, unusual for Paris, with a large bath, walk-in shower room and 'his' and 'hers' sinks. We enjoyed our daily breakfast in the Cinq restaurant and also once in our room. Either were included with our room and there was plenty of choice. The swimming pool was shallow, however, served its purpose if, as I, you wanted to swim lengths. The fitness room was excellent and the machinery was all up-to-date. We found the changing rooms and spa equally excellent. The bar, although small, is very cosy. I would say this was a perfect winter bar with its roaring fire and dark wood interiors. We enjoyed afternoon tea and a few drinks before dinner. The petite fours are fabulous! The concierge was exceptional. They obtained tickets for the Eiffel Tower and re-confirmed my restaurant reservations. I cannot fault a thing at this prestigious hotel. They even let us have the hotel car (complimentary) when we asked for a taxi to Guy Savoy. Will definitely be visiting again!!

Reviews.Title: “By George”
Reviews.Author: simmo228
Reviews.Content: Second visit to the George in as many months, a very special place. Staff I beleive the best in the world.
