Truly make your stay wonderful, we took our grandaughter of 15 months and had dinner in Cinq, A silver plater was bought to our table and presented to our grandaughter the lid gently raised and a teddy presented. Priceless. We will never forget the kindness shown. Wonderful little gifts. Other reviews have described rooms position etc, and very accurately. previous review advised about Cinq quality. lovely wonderful staff, meal 1st visit left a little to be desired, 2nd vist excellant and mitch star worthy. Exspensive but such a lovely place, with truly wonderful staff. Try it !

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel EVER.”
Reviews.Author: OSU2001
Reviews.Content: The George V is the best hotel at which I have ever stayed. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were spectacular...just the right amount of class and style, but very comfortable. If you have the opertunity to stay here I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps The Finest Luxury Hotels of the World? Very Well Could Be”
Reviews.Author: nyoptstrdr177
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a Premier Room for 5 nights while visiting Paris and were instantly upgraded to the Executive Suite upon arrival. Of course, politely asking and being well dressed certainly helps, as does paying a full astronomical $1400 per night. This was one of those "splurges." The hotel is magnificent- beautiful tapestry and original artwork abound. The ambiance is first class. The gardens and courtyards are pristine and well maintained. The room was excellent. I can not say it was very large considering the price but well designed in high quality materials. Excellent bedding and mattress. The room was a bit on the dark side when we arrived but overall the color palette was charming and suited to the Louis XVII style. The doors opened to the view of the marble courtyard. The bath was all marble with a large soaking tub and separate shower. Very clean. All of the towels, sopas and robes were Bvlgari LVHV. Never experienced this level of quality and attention to detail. The staff were top notch. Friendly, helpful and never looking for anything in return. I have a long list of little things that made this stay so special but I don't have the time. Simply- expect the best of everything from shoe shine to concierge. The location of this hotel could not be improved upon. Literally, a few hundred feet from the Champs Elysees and within a "good" stones throw of the Eiffel tower. Central location makes walking to everything ideal, when the weather cooperates which is not often in Paris. We did not eat at "Cinq" on a recommendation of a close friend who said it was not up to par with the hotel. Fair enough- there are hundreds of great small places to eat right outside. The spa which my wife enjoyed, was again, first class. The pool, located in the spa was clean and always empty. No musty pool odors, rather that of candles. Overall, we enjoyed this visit and plan to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nkpdaddy
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this place more highly. Our room was great. Restaurant recommendations were great. Location couldn't have been better. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely go back. Hotel Manager - who is Italian but also speaks fluent English and French - gets especially high marks.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel, service and room”
Reviews.Author: maitha24
Reviews.Content: George V has its charm. the lobby, staff, services and food is all unique. The flowers are beautifully arranged in the hotel. The hotel itself has a special scent ( i dont know how they do that). the service is top notch. I lost my mobile charger, and the concierge charged my mobile battery in 15 mins for free.. and everyday housekeepers clean the room perfectly and fold our clothes. if you are hungry, DO NOT miss the george V beef burger :P its the best in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: njsim
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in a 5* hotel and it did not disappoint. I travelled with my father who in turn was being trated by his bosses along with 5 other colleagues and partners so I didn't have to worry about the expense issue! As soon as I walked in it was breathtaking. Beautiful lobby with gorgeous flower arrangements. Lots of staff at reception who quickly have you checked in and whisked up to your room. Beautiful room overlooking the courtyard. Most comfortable bed I think I've ever slept on! Bathroom amazing. I didn't eat in the hotel apart from breakfast and snacks in the bar. Breakfast was disappointing on the first morning - our eggs arrived stone cold - sent them back and received fresh ones which were lukewarm. Opted for cold breakfast the following morning and was much better. Snacks in bar perfect! Also had a fabulous cocktail. Overall in the lobby/ bar, the atmosphere was really lovely with musicians and staff all around making sure you were ok but not overbearing. The only complaint in the bar - too small. Our group could not get a seat on the secong evening as many tables were empty but reserved and they would not allow us to sit even though we were leaving in 20 mins. Also used the spa - absolute bliss!! Had a most wonderful massage and then used the sauna/steam room for as long as I wanted. Very relaxing and they provide complimentary fruit juices and fruit. By far the most decadent hotel I have ever stayed at! Definitely a dream hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: LezGoLezGo
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Paris Charles de Gaulle airport and on disembarking was met before Immigration by the Hotels extremely efficient, courteous 'meet and greet' lady who took my passport and whisked me through immigration and once outside handed me over to the Hotel BMW car and driver. This really was quite impressive and the driver smoothly whisked us through Paris, and on arrival at the hotel I was shown to my room. Whilst it was made up, clearly it had not been properly cleaned out as there was a half finished bottle of champagne in the mini bar and used glasses on the table. On complaining to the Manager this was quickly remedied, and though he promised to let me know the outcome of his investigation into the matter the next day, he never did. That said the room was well appointed with a huge bathroom, separate walk in wardrobe and lobby. It also had a small sitting area and desk. The hotel itself is Architecturally impressive and the view of the Eifel tower from the room at night is really spectacular. At morning breakfast staff were incredibly attentive to detail without being obtrusive and all seemed to speak perfect English. Interestingly the staff also coped well with Japanese guests and seemed to be able to converse with them in Japanese and offer breakfast menu advice. The flower displays are awesome. I am not really a person who takes much notice of floral displays but these caught even my eye.The arrangements in the dining room were stunning and masterpieces in their own right. All in all a good experience, once the initial room irritation was overcome. The building is beautiful, and the staff universally seem to do their utmost to make your stay pleasant and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Am I still dreaming or did I just stay at "Cinq"!”
Reviews.Author: MonteChicago
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I was very skeptical in spending this much money to stay at a hotel. We are not by any stretch multi-millionaires and definitely we like to vacation. However, my wife said its her dream hotel in the world and it was her birthday and our anniversary. So, my review is me walking in with the mindset "C'mon impress me for 1000 bucks a night". Damn I was in a dreamland from the moment I stepped to the front desk. At check in they welcomed us with "Happy Celebration Week" and you felt you were the VIP guest staying with them that week. After checking in a manager stopped us to give us her business card and told us to let her know if we need anything to call her directly. Very nice touch. We did have to wait about 30 minutes for our room so they invited us for some drinks in the bar area. I need to breakdown all the categories to get through this review. Room: We had a Superior Room and it was beautiful. I don't usually care for the "old/vintage" look, but this was amazing. Extremely comfortable with a view of the courtyard which is full of orchids, flowers, and statues. The bathroom was huge with a separate shower, tub, and beautiful marble everywhere. They use Bulgari (Vert) high end products and extremely thick towels and robes. They did have a flat screen, which some of the expensive European Rooms usually don't have. They did leave us a bottle of Champagne and Chocolate for our "Celebration Week". I of course checked and it was a 120 Euro bottle from Room Service ! That Bed was specatucular and was well appointed. We did ask for an extra blanket which was a whole show in itself (more to come in review) Hotel/Lobby: I was sick of hearing about these flower arrangements, but was totally blown away. It was better then any wedding we could ever attend. Its not just in the lobby as shown on the website, it is thousands of orchids arranged all over the hotel including in your room. The flowers are changed every week and I sw them pouring Evian in the vases (not sure if that was for show or really Evian). The bar and lobby area for drinks is perfection. After 3pm they have a piano player, violinists (certian days) and a 3 piece band other times. You never felt you were at a hotel, but rather a wedding for a high-end family the whole time you stay there. Spa: Small, but well appointed. Locker Rooms have the usual Sauna/Hammam, and nic shower areas. Nothing too spectacular, but for a Urban Spa they had it nicely appointed. Please check out the business center - I thought I accidentally walked into the wrong room it was so beautiful and internet and printing is free there. Also, grab some Evian bottles theres as they are complimentary. I actually had to keep a list of fine details that kept coming and made this the Worlds best Hotel and Service. 1) I put my shoes out for shining (as many hotels do). However, I got them back wrapped in gold foil and paper with shoe horns in them. Are you serious? Amazing detail... 2) DVD List is awesome and complimentary 3) We ran into a manager in the hallway and told her our spa said manicure not pedicure. She whipped out a phone from her back pocket and called immediately in front of us. She said "anything else". I was challenging them and she showed me up... 4) We went to Avenues Restaurant down the street and they took us over in the S550 Mercedes for free. Its only 6 blocks, but it was a very nice touch. I recommend that place by the way. 5) At the spa they had a chocolate plate with "happy anniversary" on for us when we finished. Nice touch along with the Champagne/Chocolate we got when we checked in. 6) They also have us a "Happy Anniversary" Cake as well. Now to my only complaint about the hotel: We never ate at Cinq, but we did eat in the lobby area and bar. The food is barely above average (and actually worse than every place we went to in Paris). Hamburger for 50 Euros I expect it to be amazing and it was terrible. Other reviewers mentioned this, but I'm telling you go eat out and save 80% of the cost. Come back and have drinks and dessert in the hotel and listen to the music. We did have room service breakfast every day that was very good (but you can't screw up waffles and omelets...) Location: It is 2 blocks from Champs Elysees and in the heart of the most beatiful shops, cafes, and casual restaurants. You can find everything within a 5 minute walk. I can't imagine a better location. Its very hard to tell anyone to spend this kind of money on a hotel, but you won't be disappointed. Eat a 5 Euro Panini on the street and stay here. Save all your money to stay here you won't be disappointed. Other Paris hotels are expensive, so why not splurge a little more for the best. Make sure gentlemen bring a suit jacket you will need it most of the time in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best city hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLoverLondon
Reviews.Content: Second stay here and kindly upgraded to a suite. The staff are the best anywhere and although it is expensive it is worth every penny. Some notes: Luggage in room before us; Doorman happy to play with our small dog; Bulgari bath products; etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Telepathic service”
Reviews.Author: FulhamMan
Reviews.Content: Everything has probably been said about the amazing nature of this hotel, but I thought I would add two anecdotes about the level of service offered at the superb George V when we visted for Christmas in 2007. The first was at check-in. While I dealt with all the paperwork, my children were treated to a couple of gifts form the toy basket to keep them occupied. A nice touch, I thought. My wife was meanwhile approached by one of the staff and engaged in pleasant conversation... Staff Member: "Are you looking forward to Christmas at the George V?" My Wife: "Oh yes - although we aren't sure how we will tell the kids that Father Christmas got into the bedroom with their presents as it probably won't have a fireplace." Staff Member (immediately): " Oh madame. That is no problem at all. We can arrange for a lovely small meeting room, near your suite, that has a fireplace. We can set it up for your stockings and presents!" My Wife: Shocked and silent amazement... The second anecdote comes from breakfast on the first morning of our stay. Our kids were quite small, five and four. After 15 minutes of breakfast, they had eaten their fill and started to get fidgety, as per usual, quite subtly and without causing any bother. But, from nowhere, two waiters swooped with portable DVD players and headphones, armed with copies of "Shrek" and "Finding Nemo". The kids were suddenly content for another forty mninutes, leaving two happy parents toluxuriate with the newspapers, more cafe au laits and more delicous patisseries. Unmatched...

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap”
Reviews.Author: interterra
Reviews.Content: The George V is everything it's hyped up to be. Location is great, service is great, food is great. The rooms are large, the french toasts are the best I ever had. The concierge was able to book me in all the best restaurants and fight with Air France when my flight was mixed up. What else can I asked for? If it was half the price I'd go twice as often.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply stunning hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luigi2008
Reviews.Content: Quite simply this hotel is by far the best we have ever been to, and absolutely stunning. Not just in the sheer quality of the decor, the beauty and grandeur of the lobby and coutryard, the amazing facilities throughout, but head and shoulders above any other hotel was the service, which was just sensational. We were treated like royalty when we arrived, and this is how every guest is received no matter how long you are staying for. The concierge were fantastic in booking anywhere we needed, we were given a very thorough tour of the spa when we just popped our heads around to have a look, and the room service was an amzing experience, as your food arrives with your own table complete with bread rolls etc, and set out as if you were dining in the restauarant. This hotel really has thought about every tiny detail in making your experience such a magical one that you will never forget. We were on the final night of our honeymoon, and the hotel went out of it's way to make it the most special stay, with a treat of champagne and petit fours in our room, and upgrading us to a duplex suite, which was so unxexpected but unbelievably generous and spectacular. Nothing was too much trouble and we could forget about everything, as we sat in the beautiful pool in the spa, relaxed in the special relaxation room, and munched on fresh fruit and juices constantly topped up by the pool. One of the staff even brought us out evian bottles and a cold refreshing towel as we sat in the hot tub - so thoughtful! The hotel is perfectly situated, 2 minutes from Chance d'lysee and with so many fine restaurants and shops nearby to explore, te location could not be better. The eiffel tower is but a 15 minute walk down to the right of the hotel, and there are excellent views from across the Seine at the bottom of the road down from the hotel. Paris is a beautifully romantic city, but to make your stay that extra bit special I would reccomend the hotel unreservedly. This really is the only place to stay in Paris, and any hotel will find it hard to live up to George V in the future. We can't wait to come back for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Astonishly wonderful but...”
Reviews.Author: aidan60657
Reviews.Content: First, I know what I'm talking about. I've stayed at the very best hotels around the world, including Peninsula Hong Kong, Raffles Singapore, Peninsula Chicago, Le Touessrok in Mauritius, Delano in Miami, Four Seasons in Istanbul, Four Season in London, Sanderson London, St Martins Lane in London, Ritz Arts Hotel in Barcelona, etc etc etc. The George V is by far the best I've ever visited. And that's really saying something. I'm in my early 30s and find that many of the high-end hotels are stuffy and unwelcoming. Not so with the George V which somehow strikes the PERFECT balance between formality and comfort. It has an amazing combination of contemporary floral displays (WOW!) and classical French styling. We were lucky to stay in a large suite, complete with an extremely large wrap-around terrace with outstanding views of the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coeur. Perhaps the only drawback was the food, which was perfectly edible but not €38-for-a-caesar-salad good. I'm not a huge fan of French food so found myself eating a lot at the hotel since I knew, no matter what, it would be up to standard. And it was. It's just that everything else is so much BETTER THAN EXPECTED that the food didn't quite make the grade. Where the George V really shines, however, is the service. Quite simply, it was always perfect. All of the staff always remembered my name. In my opinion, great service is apparently damn-near impossible to deliver. You have to balance between being omnipresent without overbearing, personal without being nosey or too chatty. But yet EVERYONE at the George V did it. Not just occasionally, but EVERY TIME. (Especially Stephanie in the courtyard restaurant!) I can't say enough about this place. I've always loved Paris but this hotel took it to a whole different level. One of the previous reviewers said that the George V can give meaning to life. it's a bold statement but I couldn't agree more strongly. There were times that I was almost moved to tears because it felt like I had finally arrived at the place I'd always suspected existed, but could never find. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Live and spend like a King or Queen”
Reviews.Author: xolo90
Reviews.Content: As a special treat, I took my wife and children to Paris for spring break 2009. I wanted the best so we booked a one bedroom deluxe suite and junior suite for the kids. I wasn't quite really for the experience, it was awesome, if you overlook the amount of money we spent. We were met at the curb and all the processing of checking in was handled in the suite. The hotel was wonderfully furnished with fresh flowers everywhere. The rooms was decorated upscale french and was tastefully executed to the smallest detail. The chamber maids offered to unpack our belongings to help us get settled, which we declined, nice touch however. The children's room was decent, despite the need for a service call to repair the TV. We ate in the hotel for breakfasts, not sure how the hotel justifies 60 Euro sandwich, but I saw the prices, why should I complain? The Spa was excellent, one should call in advance of arriving as it might be difficult to find the time slot for services you desire. I would say, pick this hotel if you wish to have a special time. Given the prices, unless money is no object, this is a once in a lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: UPtraveller1
Reviews.Content: Greatest hotel I have stayed at yet. Conceirge was great. Car service fantastic. Simply no comparison. Good location. Babysitting service was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelsny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the George V after staying at One Aldwych in London and we actually feel that the George V has to improve its amenities and service given its reputation. We stayed in a standard courtyard facing room and found the room to be fairly spacious, decorated in a toned down country french decor, with a comfortable king bed with nice linens. The flat screen t.v. was located in an armoire--awkward since the t.v. didn't really fit, and the doors of the armoire hide the thermostat control. There is a business desk with wifi, but it's not complementary! Given the price of this hotel such amenities, such as bottled water, fresh fruit, etc., should be provided freely. 7-10 euro for small bottles of Evian is ridiculous--just cross the Champs Elysse and go to the Monoprix where you can get a 2L bottle for less than 3 euro. A candy/chocolate plate upon check-in was never refilled the rest of our stay--in fact the uneaten pieces were not removed by housekeeping! The bathroom was large, comfortable, with separate marble shower and tub, and Bulgari products, which are very nice. The front desk staff were professional but not very friendly--maybe just the French way. Overall, we feel that George V, while highly rated, may not be worth the price, which is very high.

Reviews.Title: “WOW ONE OF THE VERY BEST WE HAVE STAYED AT!”
Reviews.Author: fabfinds
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively all over and I must say this shot straight to the top of our list. The hotel is magnificent in every way, very very formal, amazing service......the spa, the rooms, the restaurants, the public spaces all were jaw dropping beautiful. Spotless and super well maintained...the lobby sets the tone for everything else. Of course this all comes at a cost, we had a 1 bdrm suite, which was fabulous but very expensive. Breakfast for 2 with a basket of croissants, coffee and a small yogurt came to approx $150. We werent' totally in love wtih the food, we had lunch upon arrival and we both were disappointed somewhat, however the stunning surroundings made up for mediocre food. Breakfast, stay with fruit, breads and yogurt, the first day we ordered omelettes, and they werent' what we get in the US and to us they just weren't very edible. Just giving a heads up. Le Cinq however proved to be fantastic, superb french food in a fabulous formal dining room, my son however was not so thrilled as most kids balk at french food. The breakfast and lunch is served in a "gallery"of sorts, off the lobby, its not a self contained "restaurant", but you can east in the gallery and the bar. They bring a small stool for your purse and you sit in these huge oversized stuffed bergere chairs at a low table, not a conventional dining arrangment but its quite luxurious nonetheless. The flowers all around the lobby and public spaces are fabulous and are changed, I believe daily. The rooms are decorated in gold/yellow hues and the beds were very comfy. The rooms had a few chandeliers and beautiful views.....the ONLY thing I didnt' care for was the bathroom lighting, I think it could use some improvement. There were a few celebs there (not my thing) but a big deal to many (like my son) lots of royalty, especially middle eastern..and the front entrance is like a non stop showing of fancy cars, again not my thing but my son loved the parade of expensive sports cars. The spa is awesome and beautifully done. Overall this is most definitely a hotel we will go back to, and hopefully sooner than later. It is top notch all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: SiriusVienna
Reviews.Content: If not the best hotel in the world at least one of the best in Europe. All requests are possible, staff is always helpful and professional, and the location one of the best for high - end shopping. We did not get a table in the restaurant and the consierge was very helpful with finding us an alternative just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sparklerhino
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the George V as a surprise for my husband's birthday. I had high expectations and it did not disappoint. The hotel was beautiful, centrally located, the room large, bulgari toiletries (Mmmm), and we experienced impeccable service from the point of check in onwards, including room service and within the restaurant. The staff were charming, particularly within the restaurant where we had both breakfast and michelin starred dinner. Furthermore the staff went out of their way to ensure that my husband's birthday was recognised. I have absolutely no negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Georges V - gets better!”
Reviews.Author: gascony
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and always loved it. My one criticism has been the concierge but this time no problems (although i did do everything by email before i arrived!). the hotel is perfectly maintained, there are plenty of staff and there is (at least visibly) no attempt at cost cutting! having had a dreadful stay recently at a ritz carlton hotel i was really happy to be back in the luxury of a four seasons.....example, we checked in at midday - room already ready despite a 2pm check-in. as a regular i was shown straight to my room (i should point at that i get to stay at a vastly discounted price and still got outstanding treatment) for check in. rooms here vary greatly some are stunning and some just lovely - a bit of pot luck. i used a safety pin from the sewing kit and a hand towel.....by the time we came back to get ready for dinner both had been replaced (vs the ritz carlton which provided used bath robes, half used toiletries and didn't replace even the bath towel!). the room had chocs and water left for us and the usual array of bulgari toiletries were all present. my only critiscm is the prices in the bar - some of them really can't be warranted but i guess you have to pay for the beauty and the service some how! i will continue to stay here whenever in paris - a true luxury hotel that has service down to a fine art.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service from waiters”
Reviews.Author: JohnIrelandIreland
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a very impressive hotel and one of the most aesthetically pleasing I have stayed in. Its lobby represents a great introduction to the place and the rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well fitted. Some of the staff are well trained and very helpful (the business centre lady was very helpful in particular). However I would have some observations on service that were not consistent with the extraordinary price: - We asked to check in a few hours early if possible in order to do some sight seeing around Paris. We received what seemed a generic email in return stating the check-in time of the rooms and requesting us to check in the night before if we wished to have early check in. We were well aware of the check in times - that is why we requested the relatively small favour of an early check in.I thought the generic response was fairly unhelpful - We waited approx 20 minutes to get a seat for a drink in the bar. Again the staff were courteous but still.. - For some reason the waiter took 10 minutes to come to our table in the bar and that was just to give us drinks menus. It took a further 10 minutes for him to return to take our order and a further 10 to receive our druinks. by the time they arrived we needed to leave - For breakfast we were seated at a tiny round table in the bar that was not suited for 2 people asnd was too cramped for 2 for breakfast. We didn't receive any milk with our breakfast and despite trying to get waiter's attention eventually had to go to the bar to request milk for the bar instead - The coffee was cold and we had to request another pot - Check-out took an age - they send you behind to some back room where you queue to get your enormous bill which is a little disssatisfying Just in summary - yes its a fine hotel in a great location and with great rooms. But if you charge this amount per night you need to get the service right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFfam
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the George V in Paris. The room was huge with a nice bathroom. There were kids amenities for children. Service was excellent. We ate many meals at the hotel, and they were all good. After a day of sightseeing in Paris, it was wonderful to go for a swim in the pool and soak in the jacuzzi, which were usually empty when we went. The flowers in the lobby were magnificent. We could easily walk to the Eiffel Tower and easy to get to other sights. The very best hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: JonnyHei
Reviews.Content: My wife dreamed of staying at George V after seeing "French Kiss," a word of warning, this isn't the same hotel!! It's a gorgeous property, well situated off the Champs de Elysess in a quiet neighborhood of apartments and boutiques. The lobby while tiny, was filled with orchids and other flowers. Our room was situated on the 3rd floor and well kept. It even had a chandelier, a first! The furniture is classical French, comfortable but not our style preference. The bathroom was expansive, with double sinks and ample space to store toiletries. We had room service one night and despite the 5* expense, was delightful. The hotel bar is nice for a quiet drink and snack after dinner. George V is walking distance to all the major sights and the flagship LV store. You must try Bechu, an award winning bakery for baguettes and the Chinese restaurant down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in all the classic Paris hotels and this is the best”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in all of the classic Paris hotels (Ritz, Meurice, Bristol, Plaza Anthenee and Crillon) and think this is unquestionably the best...I would go so far as to say that it is the best urban hotel in the world (along with the Peninsula in Hong Kong)...The hotel is located in the 8th district on Avenue George V in the middle of the Golden Triangle..As soon as you walk in you are transported into a different world...The hotel has the most lovely flower arrangement that I have ever seen in the front lobby and throughout the common area...The common areas are ornately yet tastefully decorated...The rooms are spacious and traditionally furnished with all of the modern amenities...The hotel has a great spa and fitness area...The restaurant, Le Cinq, is one of the best in Paris...The service is unparalleled...I have been in small resorts where the staff learn your name but have never experienced the same thing in a large urban hotel with a lot of turnover...The George V managed to pull it off...The concierge staff is helpful and knowledgable and can help with almost any request..I heard that this is where the Four Seasons sends people to learn the art of fine service and I totally believe it....I could not imagine a better place...It is definitely not cheap but either are the other hotels in the same class...I like the location of the Ritz and the Crillon (located on impressive squares) but there is no other place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great choice”
Reviews.Author: britinnyc30
Reviews.Content: World class. This hotel is always up to speed with excellent service, beautiful location and lovely rooms. I have stayed here a few times and aside when they were renovating I have never had an issue. Love the courtyard cafe and the foliage haphazardly draped around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best! Totally stunning........”
Reviews.Author: MDGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel totally deserves its reputation as one of the best in the world. It's difficult to know where to start with the compliments but from check-in until you leave, you are treated like royalty. The hotel obviously looks beautiful with stunning floral displays everywhere you look, and a perfume which must be filtered through the air conditioning system. Our room overlooked an internal courtyard facing Avenue George V and it had every luxury you could wish for. We booked the Romantic Package which included flowers and champagne on arrival, and breakfast in either our room or Le Cinq. Staying for 2 nights we indulged in both and I couldn't choose which one was more enjoyable. No lukewarm room service here! One of the days was also my birthday and on returning from a day's sightseeing, a bottle of champagne and delicious gateau were waiting in our room - what a treat! An evening drink in the bar is also an absolute must! The decor and service are superb and it's an obvious hotspot for models, celebrities and the like. That's not to say mere mortals feel out of place; every guest appears to be treated as a VIP. Be sure to also visit the spa if you can. After checking out we had some time to kill so spent a couple of solitary hours in the spa reading papers, taking a dip in the pool, and visiting to the steam room - total bliss. If you're looking for a real treat that will exceed your expectations then this is it. It is expensive, but the amazing thing is you actually leave thinking it was good value for money. That must tell you something.......

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: SamaJones
Reviews.Content: My husband took me away to Paris and the George V for my 30th Birthday and what a treat it was! Everything about this hotel screams luxury but unlike some smart hotels where the 'younger' traveller can feel like they shouldn't be there without their parents, the George was completely welcoming. From the doormen who were as courteous and helpful to us climbing out of a rather battered Citroën taxi as they were to the German couple climbing out the Bentley before us, to the receptionist who took us up to our room himself. As my husband had mentioned the stay was for my birthday when he booked online, there was a bottle of champagne and a beautiful Parisian cake. The room was sumptuous and extremely comfortable without being stiff. All mod cons including a fabulous flat screen TV, DVD player and Bose sound dock. The bed was second only to our piece of heaven at home (and we spent a lot of time in it!). The bathroom was beautifully appointed with 2 basins, a short but wide bath and a separate double shower with Bulgari products. My husband had booked us in for the spa package which included the American breakfast (one of which we had in our room also included) and two 1 hour spa treatments a day. The spa was beautiful, with a mid sized pool and large Jacuzzi, the steam room and saunas were in the changing rooms. There seemed to be many beauticians though they just seemed to appear from nowhere! Being an avid spa-ist I can reliably say they were extremely good (though so they should be at the price!) They use only natural products to which they have converted me to. All in all, the break was a birthday to remember and I would love to go back some day; the hotel should be very proud of the service they give and how they look after their guests, it was sublime!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: JGLKI
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris on a number of occasions for short breaks and usually stay at mid-range hotels, however we decided to splash out this time and stayed at the George V. We have been fortunate to stay at numerous world famous 5-start hotels in Europe, Africa, North America and throughout Asia and I have to say that the George V is in a league of its own. The whole package including accommodation, service and food are excellent. The staff make you feel special from the moment you approach the front door. Of all the grandeur of the place it is still the attentive staff that take it to the next level and make it that bit extra special. I would agree with previous reports that staying in this hotel can deter you from wanting to explore the magnificent city of Paris as we just wanted to stay in the hotel all the time and spoil ourselves. The problem now is that Paris will never be the same again if we stay elsewhere! Expensive place but we certainly thought it was worth it and will cherish the memories for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and celebs too!”
Reviews.Author: Hesmo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic quality. We stayed just before Christmas 2007 and loved the whole experience. Of the three nights we were there the plan was to eat at The Cinq one night only, but the food was so good and the service fantastic so we went there every night. Oh and while we were there so was Will Smith!

Reviews.Title: “This George is V out of V”
Reviews.Author: DELHIGURU
Reviews.Content: I was on a 2 day trip to Paris and decided to stay at the George V. I can categorically say this is the best luxurious hotel in Paris, beating its competitors like Crillion hands down. The rooms are great, the service was even better and attention to detail was very good. A case in point was housekeeping. In which hotel would you find tht after you have ome back to your room, the cleaninglady had hung all your jackets in the closet neatly so that there was no "mess" in the room. If you can afford it or are in the mood to splurge for a day or two, then certainly this is the place to stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: ChiefWeasel
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews before we went for our 4 night stay to celebrate our wedding anniversary and the hotel certainly lived up to our expectations. Our outstanding memory will be of the staff - from the young man who brought us breakfast in bed to the head concierge they were unfailingly delightful - helpful, knowledgeable and anticipating our every wish. We were particularly grateful as my wife was unwell for two days with a touch of la grippe - so we missed our long anticipated dinner in Le Cinq and our planned visit to the spa! We did however enjoy afternoon tea in the gallery and lunch in the bar. Our room was delightful - excellent bathroom, very comfortable beds and overflowing mini-bar. Yes, the prices are eye-watering, especially at the moment, but Conde Nast rates it one of the best hotels in the world and I would not disagree. When we left we filled in the hotel questinnaire and rated everything as excellent, then mentioned that they might expand the range of fresh fruit at breakfast. We received an email the next day from the director of the hotel, thanking us for our comments and promising to do just that. That illustrates the level of service you can expect. Save up your pennies, then go and experience some luxury.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best in Paris....and the World”
Reviews.Author: mktozd1
Reviews.Content: When you think of superlatives for hotels, George V defines them from the perspective of food, service, facilities and location. From the moment you arrive, you will know that you made the right choice. Everything that you eat during your visit in the best in class. Even the cheapest room is very nicely done. Some of our favorites included: * The restaurant in the courtyard * High tea in the afternoon * Complimentary shoe shine service * Marble in the bathroom * THE most comfortable beds in the world * The french fries are the best in the world as is almost everything. While it is a lot of money, you will never regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap at twice the price.”
Reviews.Author: jgm2
Reviews.Content: The George V is so good that you can't even be bothered to leave the hotel to visit Paris. Which is just outside the door. Need a dinner reservation at another difficult to access restaurant? Have a word with the concierge. Skip the queues for the Louvre? Get pre-bought tickets from the concierge... I'm a bit 'careful' with money. I'll park a mile away to save a couple of quid on parking. I bought an electric clippers and cut my own hair. My wardrobe consists of company T-shirts and jeans. But occasionally I have brought to my attention items that appear expensive but are actually terrific value. Bargains in fact. So, for example, the Mercedes SL55 with AMG tuning. Costs the fat end of 100K. Absolute bargain. Fantastic. Is it it ten times better than a car costing 10k? No. It's a hundred times better. Same with George V. We've stayed there a few times and it just gets better. How is that possible? Costs a fortune. But still an absolute bargain. Gone kid friendly so kids get tours of back-stage ie kitchens, house-keeping etc. Tag along. Bring your camera. Kids even get pastry lesson with pastry chef. Gratis. Two Michelin star restaurant and they find time to knock out Madeleines with the kids. My wife's favourite hotel in the whole world.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ca212
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the greatest hotel in the world. I've traveled to 6 continents and stayed at over 75 5star hotels and this is in the top 3. I went for my honeymoon and everything was perfect. I still dream about the chocolate croissants.

Reviews.Title: “George V is amazing, with awesome comfort and service and location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a surprise weekend trip to Paris with my boyfriend. One of the many wonderful surprises he had in store for me on this perfect weekend was booking the George V, as I have always wanted to stay here. It was an amazing experience! The room is very spacious by Paris standards, with a full entryway hallway, a huge bathroom with separate shower, tub, and a separate mini-room for the toilet. Our room had a king size bed and also a private balcony that looked out onto the marble courtyard. Service was great. I had forgotten to pack hair product, so I called and asked the concierge if they could send some up, and there was a knock at the door with hair gel in under 5 minutes! Of course they charged us 40 euros for that little bottle of hair gel, but we accepted it was all going to be expensive (well, for my bf anyway who paid for the whole thing!). The location is amazing as it is right in the "Golden Triangle" which has some of the best shopping in Paris (LV, Gaultier, Hermes, etc. were all literally outside our door), as well as the Champs-Elysees being just down the street. It also only took about 15 minutes to walk to the Eiffel tower, and the subway station was a five minute walk, on a line that took you directly to the Marais, and it was also easy to get to St. Germain, and really anywhere. They had a complimentary service where you could leave your shoes in a bag on the doorknob and they would shine and clean your shoes and return to you before 7:00 am the next morning, each shoe crisply individually wrapped. Even details like discovering there's actually ice in the ice bucket (instead of having to go find some) were great. It was a wonderful stay, in the best city in the world, and I will always have extremely fond memories of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, but for the price I'd better have”
Reviews.Author: timtamDublin
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel but for the price my boyfriend could have bought me a car. Nice treat for my 30th Birthday. Rooms were excellent but service was a little cold but its France. Paris is the home of love but in the films sitting in a restaurant alone looks romantic, not so much in real life.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive, but hey - it's Paris - enjoy it!”
Reviews.Author: busybee9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights for our 10 year wedding anniversary in a deluxe room (865 euro per night). We had a very generous sized room with king bed, walk in wardrobe and a spacious bathroom. There was also a very comfortable armchair and a writing desk setting. Champagne and sweets were in our room on arrival, which was fantastic after a 30 hour journey. The room overlooked a courtyard (not the marble courtyard) and we could see the top portion of the Eiffel tower, which sparkled at night on the hour from 9pm. Hotel staff was courteous, always smiling and enthusiastic. We booked a hotel transfer from the airport (285 euro) which included an airport escot who met us on exit from the aeroplane and accompanied us through customs via the priority lane. That was nice but we travelled business class and were given passes through the priority lanes anyway. Also, landing at 6am meant that customs was practically empty and we would have got through quickly with or without the escot. The airport escot may be of better value if your plane lands during peak times of the day. I didn't know whether there would have been long queues for taxis at the airport either. A black BMW was waiting for us. You can weigh up the pros and cons for the airport transfer. Our taxi fare from the hotel to airport was 50 euro. We didn't have any breakfasts at the hotel (upwards of 40 euro per person) but each morning we had breakfast on one of the cafes on Champs. Would highly recommend the Drugstore brassary at the top (just before the arch). Great (!!!) coffee and continental breakfast sets for 8-16 euro. We did have coffee at the hotel while waiting for our room. Cost 12 euro each and were weak American style (brown flavoured hot water). Le Cinq restaurant was quite an experience. The waiters were wonderful and attentive. The food was nice and delicately presented. The price was far more than what I have ever imagined a dinner for two could be, but I think it is great to have experienced it. The location is great for a romantic getaway. It is 5 minutes walk from the arch and a leisurely stroll from the Eiffel tower. We had dinner at Cafe de l'homme with a full view of the Eiffel tower, which was recommended to us by the hotel concierge. It was such an incredible sight that the thought still brings tears to my eyes. Make sure you book 8:30pm or later so you can see the sparkling Eiffel tower. Metro is right at the junction of rue George V and Champs. Once you are on the metro, you can go everywhere, but beware pick-pockets. The hotel was recently renovated (year 2000 I think). There was a book in our room on the history of the hotel, which was well worth a read. All the furniture in our room was new but in the traditional French style. It would be a disappointment for people who are looking for the authentic olden days French hotel. The clean, new, reproduction furniture suited us just fine. Having stayed at 400 euro Paris hotels little larger than a shoebox, we thought our room was quite good value. Some of the other reviewers in Premier rooms for significantly more seem to be somewhat disappointed, so maybe deluxe is the way to go? (unless you are more in the budget bracket for a suite) We also used the pool and gym in the evenings after sightseeing. The jacuzzi did wonders for my aching feet. Overall, we had a wonderful time in Paris. No hesitation in staying there again unless somewhere better appears on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention and extravagant”
Reviews.Author: calisunkid
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying you should expect very high prices for a five star hotel in Paris. If you can get by the very high price then definitely stay here. The attention to detail is very sharp and the staff is some of the best I have ever encountered. Nothing is out of reach and they will take care of most anything for you. Once again I tend to avoid 5 star hotel restaurants because there are much cheaper places in Paris that are simply amazing. If you really want to a fine dining experience and money is no object, book well in advance at the La Tour d'Argent. You will be treated to views that will bring tears to your eyes why you enjoy some of the most excellent food on earth. Not to take away from the hotel though, it is always a pleasure to stay there. Never have I had a bad experience. The French can sometimes seem curt to Americans but not here, you are greeted like an old friend with genuine kindness. The suite was very nice with a walk in closet and a very relaxing bath that seems to melt away your stress. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Virs
Reviews.Content: Ive travelled quite a bit in 5* hotels around the world - George V is in my opinion one of the best out there. First time I ever set foot there was on business, I arrived at 10pm on Thursday night, went straight to my room. At 7am on the following morning, in the elevator on my down to breakfast, the hotel staff greeted me by my name. I was speachless! The decor is superb, apparently they spend €100,000 per week on flowers alone... And it shows. Staff is attentive and knowledgable, quality is faultless. The bar serves great cocktails, they have special martini glasses where the cone-shapped glass sits in ice to keep the drink fresh. Truly one of the best hotels in the world in my opinion. Shows what the French can do when they put their minds to it...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jrc910
Reviews.Content: Positives: Clearly, the Four Seasons George V is among the finest hotels in the world. The hotel is in a wonderful location near the Champs-Elysees, and clearly caters to English-speaking travelers. The decor is extremely elegant -- beautiful flower arrangements, extravagant furniture, and lovely architectural details are abundant. Staff members were polite and very smiley. When we complained of drilling noise during the day, the repairs were quickly halted for the remainder of our stay. Negatives: We stayed in a "premier" room, which was roomy and nice but not exceptional for the price. Despite the gorgeous decor of the lobbies, the hotel was rather stuffy and outrageously expensive to the point of being ridiculous (two scrambled eggs were 24 euros, a cup of coffee 9 euros). There were some issues with the temperature of the water not getting hot enough and really low water pressure in the shower on a couple of occasions. The concierge service was ok but not fantastic. Bottom line: If don't mind spending exorbitant amounts of money and like very fancy surroundings, definitely stay at this hotel. Unless you are staying in a suite on one of the top floors, make sure to reserve a room overlooking the courtyard, which is lovely, because the views from the other rooms are not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but not best in the world for me”
Reviews.Author: kingsroadgal
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with great service, so I do think it deserves a five star rating. I had read so many great reviews of the hotel, that maybe I was setting myself up for disappointment!! I was looking for the ultimate Paris hotel experience, but I'm not sure if I got it. I would definitely stay here again, but my next time in Paris, I might very well try something else. One of the high points of the hotel is its staff. They were generally really helpful and attempted to please. An example of this was the front desk manager. We had booked the top class of double room - the Premier (I think) at about $1500 per night. I was somewhat disappointed as this room was not even located in the hotel, but in adjoining building, connected to the hotel by a long hallway. I didn't feel that the room had a lot of character to it. It was perfectly nice, but just not really special. I had stayed in the George V prior to it becoming a Four Seasons, and the room we had then had amazing decor, so the Four Seasons corportate look is a bit of a let-down. The front desk manager worked with us over several days to find a better room. Eventually we moved to a superior suite, which was an improvement, and located in the main hotel...although I still felt the decor was a bit lacking, and the suite only had one window for three rooms. Still, I appreciated the effort involved by the front desk manager, and he was a very nice guy. We had similar pleasing experiences with the concierge and the luggage porters. The gym is very nice and very well-equipped in quite a small space. There are two or three elliptical machines, three or four treadmills, and a rowing machine, as well as lots of weight machines and free weights. There are nicely chilled waters and cold scented towels which were very refreshing -- I loved the frangrance of the towels. The pool is nice, but very small, although in Paris, it is a surprise to have a pool at all. The location of the hotel is great, but I do agree with one of the other reviews that the Champs Elysees location is not my favorite. It has improved, I think over the years, and we ate at a number of the restaurants on the boulevard. We especially loved Laduree for breakfast, and Leon, for a great Belgian mussel dinner experience. With the euro exchange rate being what it was during our visit, I did feel that the hotel breakfast was quite highly priced and not worth it. I have stayed at a number of Four Seasons hotels, and I would rank the ones in Istanbul and Tokyo above this one, even though the Paris hotel is very good. Istanbul just had a lot more character -- for instance, canapes were delivered to our room in Istanbul every afternoon. It was wonderful, and the general decor of the rooms was better in my opinion. In Tokyo , the number of amenities in the room was unbelievable -- think combs, brushes, face blotting papers, pajamas, and elastic bands for your hair, and again, I thought the modern decor was memorable. Both the Istanbul and Tokyo properties have such a special flair about them. Apart from Four Seasons hotels, I would also rank a number of properties in Asia over this one....for instance, Raffles in Singapore, the Oriental in Bangkok, and even the Peninsula in Hong Kong deliver a better experience. The George V is great as well, but just failed to deliver that extra touch which really lives in the memory.

Reviews.Title: “A truly first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendyhouse11
Reviews.Content: Incredibly beautiful floral displays everywhere, lovely, friendly, smart, helpful staff, a wonderful scent of Bulgari in the air, gorgeous jacuzzi in the spa, complimentary champagne and birthday cakes in our rooms .... I could go on and on. I actually wanted to cry when we left, I have stayed in several five star hotels around the world, but this topped everything (OK, Claridges was amazing too). All I can say is that the bed has to be slept in to be believed. The level of service is outstanding - we had dinner in Le Cinq (the seaweed butter they serve with the bread is one of the most delicious things I have ever tasted) and as I left the table, I asked one of the waiters to point me in the direction of the ladies' room. Rather than tell me, he actually led me there and then opened the door for me to go in. Another time, as I was coming out of a lift with a bag, a member of the hotel staff came up immediately to carry it for me. Our table at dinner was covered with rose petals as it was our birthday. The waiter brought a little footstool for my handbag. Tiny details but the staff make you feel so special and looked after. We overheard the concierge telling a guest that they were a little too early for their room but he gave them a map of Paris, and then asked for their mobile no. so he could ring them immediately it was ready for them. We sat outside in the courtyard with our friends and a member of staff came out to see us; we were laughing and wondered if he was coming to tell us to keep the noise down but he said he was concerned that it had just started to rain and he didn't want us to slip on the shiny courtyard floor! Ridiculously, madly expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world, without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueenEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night visit to the Georges V to celebrate a special wedding anniversary. This hotel is amazing - down to the last detail, you really do get what you pay for. We booked the hotel's car service from the airport and were met by friendly uniformed staff off the plane and escorted to our car. the driver telephoned through so the concierge and receptionist were waiting for us on arrival at the hotel and all were at pains wo wish us a happy anniversary! We arrived very early (10.30 am)but our room was almost ready. We had a lovely breakfast in La Gallerie and were shown up to our room. They had upgraded us from a Premier Room to the French Suite (I don't know quite how we managed this but it was incredible...I was speechless). The suite had it's own kitchen and private bar, dining area, living area, guest bathroom, large king bedroon, large walk in closet and huge bathroom. There was a view of the marble courtyard and a balcony overlooking it. They have their staff engagement down to a fine art at the Four Seasons...the staff are really empowered to look after you and question anything they're not happy with (our waiter in the bar sent back my husband's dish as he wasn't happy with the amount of salad on it and then came to explain and apologise that our food would be another few minutes...amazing). If you leave a magazine or book open in your room the maid will place a marker in it and close it over...lots of little things which show the staff really think about your enjoyment and your experience. Go now....don't worry about the price...and enjoy it...it's the best in the world. Oh, and try the violet martinis in the bar...delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the George V for 3 nights in July 2008, it is by all standards spectacular, it has an excellent location just off the Champs Elysee. Upon arrival the service level is second to none, very professional and attentive, the lobby is beautiful, incredible arrangement of flowers. We were personally escorted to our room by the manager on duty, the rooms were spacious (especially considering the size of normal Parisian Hotels), clean and well appointed. The drapes completely blocked out the light (great!), iPod docking station, the beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was a very good size with nice amenities. The hotel provided us with a bottle of Champagne and dessert for my wife's birthday. The staff are extremely professional, they are very customer focused (honestly some of the best that we have encountered anywhere). As we were traveling all day we went to the spa to relax, the staff were very pleasant, all the amenities that you could ask for were present. The only negative for the entire stay was the hot tub which was more lukewarm. The concierge was very helpful and efficient - thoroughly professional. We had lunch at Le Cinq and again service was excellent, attentive yet not stuffy, friendly and engaging. Food was superb, beautiful surroundings, loved the wine list (incredible offerings) however it was so expensive (especially with the dollar - $155.00 for breast of chicken... not kidding). Nice touch of taking our photo (their camera) and had a memento five minutes later in a George V card. Expensive but worth it, overall, wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing (but expensive!)”
Reviews.Author: KeithLafayette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June 2008 (was also here same time in 2007). It is an amazing hotel, no doubt about that. The public spaces are stunning and the flowers throughout have to be seen to be believed. The staff caters to your every whim. I only ate breakfast and lunch in the hotel and they were excellent. The rooms are very nice, especially the suite with terrace we were ungraded to our last two nights (see photos). All of this fabulousity comes at steep price, however. If you are prepared to pay to enjoy one of the world's finest hotels, by all means do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CPGM
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and are going again this year as it possibly the best hotel we have stayed in. The location is perfect, the staff are fantastic. Concierge are excellent at finding good restaurants and arranging transport to get to them. Le Cinq is also fabulous and I cant wait to eat there again. It is expensive but you get what you pay for in all areas everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it - Pampered and Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Atozz1
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at this hotel. Yes, it is pricey but you pay for what you get! Service was fantastic, everything I needed was quickly provided. I stayed with my 8 year old for 5 nights - as a single mom travelling with my child, I felt very safe and pampered. We booked with whatahotel - an online hotel booking site which advertises special savings with their "virtuoso partners". This ended up providing us an unbelievable experience -- we were upgraded from a superior room to a HUGE suite!! 2500 euros a night was the posted rack rate in the room. It was amazing! We both burst into giggles when we walked in and saw how huge and elegent the room was! Seperate living room, 1/2 bath, bedroom with walk in closet and huge full bath! I know we can't be gaurenteed upgrades with that quality all the time -- but hey if it only happens once and this is it -- it was so worth it!! We also received free breakfast each morning and a $50 food credit. My daughter liked the kids perks -- her own robe, slippers, disney channel in english, kids room service options, indoor pool, hot-tub - not gigantic but for the city it was good. The other nice thing is coming in from the states early a.m., our room wasn't ready but we were able to go to the spa/pool area where they provided us robes and swimsuits (throw away kind of fabric). Paris is (of course) a beautiful city -- this hotel is in an upscale area walking distance to the effel tower and metro (which is super easy to use and better during high traffic times). I enjoyed my experience and this was the best place to stay with my daughter alone. On my next visit I might try another hotel in one of the quaint areas like St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jax2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons in a deluxe room, very spacious and comfortable everything you could ask for.Also the spa was very good too.Had a meal at Le Cinq very expensive but beautiful. The location of the hotel was excellent too. Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING service and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: YumYum2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a king deluxe room for 3 nights at the end of June (though I wrote a comment to the hotel saying July by accident!). From the MOMENT we stepped into the most beautiful lobby I've ever seen- candles and delphiniums and hydrangeas all in deep purple- until the moment we checked out (waiting for Bruce Springsteen to get out of our way!), it was just a magnificent experience. The room is SPOTLESS- no mold like at the Ritz bathroom in London- great amenities, lots of shelves, a safe, comfy pillows and a big tub. The staff was always smiling, always helpful, and ALWAYS available. The concierge would do anything to help us. Even the doormen are friendly. Housekeeping staff was VERY quiet- you could sleep as late as you want- no kids running in the halls, and no adults talking loudly to wake you up. So different than the Bellagio in Vegas or other 5 star rated hotels. We were SO sad to leave. They made a little dessert for us and gave us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary- and it was incredible! I have to say this is the finest hotel I have ever stayed in. I fear that recommending it so highly will mean I won't get a reservation next time I want to go!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for those wanting luxury”
Reviews.Author: gtahir
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons George V is conveniently located at the heart of Paris (very close to Champs Ellysee). The hotel is famous for its unique and original floral arrangements, evident from the first time you enter into the main lobby. The atmosphere of this hotel exudes charm, warmth and luxury. The service and facilities of this hotel will not disappoint. The room is very spacious, as is the bathroom, with full amenities such as LCD TV, Wi-Fi connection (at 22 Euro per day), toiletries from Bulgari brand, bidet and sandals. Now, I have heard a few people commented on the thin walls of the Four Season Hotels, and found it to be quite true. When I was in Japan, I could hear a couple next door doing their business in the middle of the night, and this time I could also hear a lot of footsteps on top of my room and doors banging next door. That's the only complain that I have I suppose, afterall, nothing is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service!”
Reviews.Author: mj79Tx
Reviews.Content: I was very surpised at the hospitality the George V staff showed. I had problems with my travel agent and was worried that I would have troubles checking in, but I was proved wrong by the extremely nice staff at the hotel. Everyone was helpful and friendly! I stayed away from the restaurant seeing that a soda was about $20 US. So all I can comment on is the stay itself, not the restaurant. It was comfortable, the rooms were nice and spacious and housekeeping was fantastic. I had the laundry service and my clothes were returned in a few hours. The spa is very nice and the concierge deserves a gold star! They are all fantastic at the concierge desk. The prices of EVERYTHING at the hotel are outrageous, but it is Paris, you have to expect it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lives up to lofty expectations”
Reviews.Author: buccsmf1
Reviews.Content: After hearing so much praise about the four seasons paris I certainly went in with very high expectations. And if you don't mind the price, it lives up to every one of them. The service is among the best in the world. Every single encounter with a staff member was pleasant and refreshing. From the concierge to the doorman to the maids, everyone was extremely polite and cheery. Upon arrival we found out that we had been upgraded one room category to a bigger room. The room itself wasn't all that big but the bathroom was huge. Big tub, amazing shower, and lots of room in general. Our room was on the 6th floor and we could see the top third of the eiffel tower from our balcony. Overall, we were very happy with the room. My only problem with the four seasons paris..... of course, it's the price. Anything done through the hotel is astronomically expensive. Rooms START at around $1100 per night..... One way transfer from the airport book through the hotel was around $500..... We had some shampoo explode on 4 t-shirts and 3 pairs of shorts on the airplane, laundry bill was over $200...... ONE COKE from the mini-bar was $15....... I don't mind paying a lot of money for a luxury hotel but towards the end of the stay the huge mark-ups on everything tend to wear on you, so be prepared. ps. there is a very small OLD elevator that the concierge pointed out to us as a "romantic elevator for two" that I recommend you STAY AWAY from. We used it a few times because it was closer to our room than the main elevators but it stopped between floors once and opened the doors... for a few seconds me and my fiancee were scared to death. It sat there with the doors open for about 10 seconds before they finally closed. We sat there in the elevator for a another 15 seconds or so and just as I was about to hit the emergency call button the elevator took us to the top floor and opened the doors. We QUICKLY stepped out and walked back down the stairs to our floor.

Reviews.Title: “Geroge V Paris......Perfection”
Reviews.Author: NLMLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many amazing hotels around the world my breath was taken away by the sheer opulance and luxury of the George V, Paris. We stayed for 3 nights in May in a premier room (623) which was heavenly. A beautiful large sleeping and living room area, sumptuous bathroom and a wonderful walk in closet. Luxurious and more than comfortable. I had a 50 min massage in the Spa which was perfect. We ate out most evening, one great restaurant recommendation to try is Chez Janou - a traditional French provencal bistro - fantastic. One small comment was that breakfast service was sometimes chaotic however this fades into the background given the perfection of everything else. The George V was VERY expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “How can you keep me down on the farm...?”
Reviews.Author: madamoiselleN
Reviews.Content: We had seen the hotel photos of the walls lined with tapestries and I expected naff, over-the-top, Louis Quinze-type decor but the hotel was luscious, elegant and traditional but unstuffy. The staff were professional, friendly and attentive. Of course, this should be standard in a hotel of this reputation but you never can tell. The room was spacious and elegant and very quiet. The king-size bed was supremely comfortable. The bathroom was a marble-lined pleasure dome with spendid Bulgari toiletries. I think it is the custom in these reviews to say " if I had one complaint..." well mine would be that one morning at breakfast the waiter was a tad slow in bringing the customary stool for my handbag to rest on and I almost had to put it on the carpet instead!!! I love Paris and I love Four Season George V!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Suite at the George V”
Reviews.Author: Braneman
Reviews.Content: For that special occasion, the Honeymoon Suite at the George V has no peer (Room 824). In order to reserve, one has to contact the property directly, or let the agents at the Four Seasons 800 number inquire regarding availability. Your experience starts at the airport, where you are whisked to your transportation. In room check-in continues the pampering. The view from the room's balcony is the view seen on the Four Seasons page: the Eiffel tower and other remarkable Paris destinations. The service is as impeccable as stated in other reviews. The concierge staff is able to get reservations, on short notice, for even the most exclusive restaurants. They can easily arrange a private car tour of the city, which we found invaluable. Such luxury comes at a price, but it is an experience that leaves one feeling that the value received is worth the expenditure. We have enjoyed the hotel during Christmas, and the holiday spirit and the beauty of the hotel/city is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this....”
Reviews.Author: mcconthebus
Reviews.Content: You don't need me to repeat what has been said so well by everyone else. So I will tell you one story about the concierge desk and you will understand. I called for a reservation at a great restaurant (left to the discretion of the concierge) for me, my wife and mother, and she set this up for me. She called to say that everything was arranged and when to be in the lobby. Then, 10 minutes later, she called again and said that she had changed the reservation to a different restaurant because "she was not entirely pleased with where we would be sitting, nor with the view we would have had!!!" I can't remember the restaurant's name, but it was splendid. We sat in the window, watched the Eiffel Tower glimmer in the night sky, and had a wonderful meal. Show me any other hotel that would care this much; I think it doesn't exist. The rest of the facilities and service were just like that. This place will make you cry with joy. I'm serious. As said by another reviewer, everyone should stay here at least once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way- but expensive”
Reviews.Author: CATravelingfool
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel near everything. Very expensive. No joke, a cosmopolitan cocktail was $38 (24 Euros) a piece. It was hand shaken in unison if you ordered two, two waiters would come out and shake them in tandem! A $80 drink show. Shaken is nice, but most $10-15 cosmos are! Our bar bills after a few drinks was always over $200. Breakfast for two was at least $130 (80-90 Euro)I know the dollar is weak, but this felt ridiculous. Bottom line: The hotel is beautiful. Location is ideal. Short walk to metro, Eiffel Tower, Arc D' Triumph, shopping, Louvre. The flowers are gorgeous. Rooms lovely although I like double sinks and our bathroom did not have them. The beds were very comfortable. The staff is extremely professional and kind. Very attentive Concierge. They all speak English, although we attempted to speak French to be polite. Our room had what they considered to be a nice view- I considered it to be merely, OK, as it was only a view of the other side of the hotel. Although very pricey to stay and eat there I still would recommend it if money isn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Grand”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielleonholiday
Reviews.Content: The Goege V is a classic. I was there in business and the problem was that not many things worked very well or as they were supposed. But the location and the style of the place still make it worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful - luxury - dreamy”
Reviews.Author: cabinfevertoronto
Reviews.Content: Wow. I absolutely understand why this is one of the top rated hotels in the world, if not THE top. True to Four Seasons form, this hotel delivers. The Good: -really, everything! -good location -spacious closet, room, bathroom, huge by european standards -full size Bulgari toiletries -sitting area, desk, bed, dresser, all in period decor -friendly, polite staff -wonderful, clean spa/fitness centre -room service breakfast was punctual -lovely turndown service -huge windows leading to terrace The Not-so-good: -many guests so common areas (lobby, spa, etc) very busy

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Perfection”
Reviews.Author: cbuie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay at Georges V. C'est magnifique! The hotel was immaculately clean, the service was impeccable, the concierges very knowledgeable and friendly, and a great location near the metro, too. Had the pleasure of staying in 2 different rooms because we extended our stay-a deluxe and superior room. Both were huge, which is highly unusual for Paris. Everything about this hotel is just top-notch. An absolutely wonderful, decadent hotel to stay in if you want to treat your self. My husband and I consider ourselves pretty persnickety and are quite the germaphobes where cleanliness is involved, and I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I can't find a single flaw. Despite our "persnickety-ness", my husband and I are pretty casual people-jeans and tennis shoes types when we're sightseeing, and we never once felt out of place in this hotel. We were a little concerned that the Four Seasons in Paris would be so over-the-top that we'd feel out of place, but everyone is so friendly. I highly recommend this hotel. I don't think I can ever stay at another hotel in Paris now that I've been spoiled by Georges V (and I've stayed at the Ritz Paris). Just dreaming of a return trip now!

Reviews.Title: “A Religious Experience”
Reviews.Author: bmoc1955
Reviews.Content: Yes, the other reviews are correct about the pricing. However, a stay at the George V definitely makes the "bucket list". The service is without paralell. The attention to detail by the staff is amazing. The physical property itself is not overwhelming vis a vis other Four Season's hotels. It is the staff that sends this facility over the top. The location is ideal in terms of proximity to sites, shopping and dining. This hotel is also great for celeb sitings, if that is your cup of tea. The spa is elegant, but small. Food is excellent, but you pay for every morsel. Tip: as the hotel is generally full, you need to work early and often with the concierge on your bookings.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Christmas In Paris”
Reviews.Author: PerfectDevice
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I planned an amazing trip to Paris last christmas and thanks to the absolutely lovely and luxurious Four Seasons, it was one of the most memorable trips i've ever taken. This hotel is the epitome of elegance. A true no-expense-spared experience.Cost a bundle but in my oppinion, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: clawit
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite with balcony over looking the eiffel tower - and the hotel had also put 1/2 bottle of champagne and cake in the room for us - as we were celebrating a special occasion. The staff were so efficient and everything about the stay was perfect - one downside is that we were only staying for 1 night. I'll definitely be going back, just need to save some more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding / Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: SWT22
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Four Seasons George V Paris is truly an exceptional experience. The premises are impeccable, flowers in the lobby are an artwork. Rooms are decorated in a traditional manner (this is not a "design" hotel), but with exquisite taste. The location could not be better, in the heart of Paris. The best part of the experience is the extremely personalized service: all of the staff seems to know your name, and is very knowledgeable about museums, other places of interest, restaurants and theatres. For an urban hotel, the spa is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bills2pay
Reviews.Content: My high expectations were surpassed in our 3-night stay. The hotel's rooms and amenities were all top-notch, as they should be. The spa and pool were especially nice and blissfully uncrowded. But it was the level of service, professionalism, and even friendliness was even better than expected. Our family of 3 was treated royally, even though we're not royalty. The Georges V deserves its reputation as one of the world's best hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons George V: the best.”
Reviews.Author: Peynet78
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons George V: the best. My husband made me a gift for my birthday: a short holiday at the Four Seasons George V. It has been a great experience. All has been perfect. When we arrived there was a wonderful cake and a bottle of champagne in our room. On top of the cake a decoration saying “happy birthday”. A welcome card announced a good time in George V. Our room was a superior one (n° 307) at third floor, with a nice view overlooking the Marble Courtyard. Our room was beautiful, immaculate, quiet, spacious. It was tastefully decorated in Louis XVth design, but had all modern comforts and amenities, for example there was a big LCD TV in front the bed, a CD/DVD player, linked to a Bose stereo system and even an iPod stereo system (Bose again) on the bedside table. A large marble bathroom, and Bulgari bath amenities. The George V is a wonderful hotel: every corner, every place, every situation is perfect. The lobby, as everyone described, is amazing with marvellous floral arrangements. The Galerie bar and restaurant, where we got a tea time and a dinner with live music playing (fantastic experience, strongly recommended) is splendid. I suggest to spend some time into the SPA. It is beautiful with relax area, a good swimming pool with a Jacuzzi tub. The staff pampers you with a lot attentions. They bring you mineral water, and cool washcloth for refreshing your face. Free tea, infusion, and fruit available. But the best has been my birthday dinner at Le Cinq restaurant (2 stars Michelin guide). They booked for us the best table of the restaurant. They have been able to surprise me and to make this day really a special day. Just to give an example, in the middle of the meal a person of the staff asked us to take a picture.
