Few minutes later they gave to me a nice greetings card with our picture printed inside as a souvenir. I found this fantastic. All the hotel staff work very hard to remember your name and make you feel special. One recommendation: choose the bed and breakfast package; even if there is no buffet, the food is good with nice presentation and you can choose between different breakfasts: French, Continental, American, Japanese, without addition. Only two marginal remarks. First: we stayed in George V in March and in that moment there were works going on for a partial restoring, overshadowing the beauty of the Marble Courtyard (garden of the hotel, were in summer is possible to eat). But the nice interiors and the staff’s attentions brings you to forget about this inconvenient. Second: in the second day when we came back at 4 p.m. the room was not yet made. We had to wait up to 5 p.m. at the bar. We reported the problem but nothing happened. Final comment: the price is very high, but to be honest its worth every penny of it. The George V for us have been beyond all expectations. Maybe the best service we have experimented up to now.

Reviews.Title: “It dosent get much better”
Reviews.Author: deanstevens
Reviews.Content: Wow this really was something special It has location , style , class , luxury andanything else you could possibly wt from a hotel all rolled into one The bedrooms and public areas are spotless and well decorated The main thing is the staff they are potentially the best trained staff in europe if not the world This place is a must

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons George V”
Reviews.Author: budgee
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my mom and take her to Paris before Christmas to do some shopping, having fun, and get in the holiday-mood. I heard George V is the number one hotel in the world so I expected number one service - and we did not get a bit of it. I must tell you, I was really disappointed about it. Location is good, flower decorations just amazing, rooms grandious (a bit funny though, there are lots of prisms and drops missing from the chrystal chandeliers - i guess memorablia for previous guests...), but thats all. Upon arrival our taxi could not take us to the entrance as drive-way was full with cars. We got out on the street, pulled out luggage from trunk while 4 personell was watching us at the entrance - no one helped us, even not, when going towards the entrance!! One just let us in, did not ask if we need help... After check-in, the guy came out from behind the desk, took the luggage from my mom and asked me if i dont mind bringing my luggage myself... What a service... :( We usually got out of the room around 9 am and got back around 4-5 pm. One day when we entered the room after 4pm we just realized a made is just working in our room - there was no sign outside! As we were very tired, I asked her just to do the beds and leave us, she did not understand it in English, had to call Housekeeping to ask them to translate what I need. Even after that she did not do it, just simply started to vacuum clean - whilst we were already in the room and asked her to leave! There were no appoligies later, nothing at all, it was like nothing happened. I tried to use the swimming pool one evening, but I had to leave after 15 min or so as it was full with kids (at least 6), jumping in the water, and being so loud like hell, nobody from staff asked them or the parents to stop this. Concierge was also strange, gave us just wrong information and was not helpful at all. The only place where I got the special Four Seasons touch was the tiny gift shop, the boy was really nice, helpful, fun, offered assistance way beyond his duties.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: CedricΠerre
Reviews.Content: Living close to Paris we go to the George V quite often to have a drink or dinner there, but we never had the opportunity to stay at the hotel. We decided it was time to try the complete experience! ;-) We had a reservation made by Amex 2 days in advance with a special rate including breakfast, a 100€ voucher for the spa, and a 4pm late check-out. We stayed in deluxe room #618. The room itself was better than I expected: it was bright, decorated in cream and light blue colors, all equipments and furniture in mint condition. I feared it would be a little stuffy as we usually prefer to stay in hotels with a more contemporary style but it was really perfect. The bathroom was also very nice, with a deep bathtub and separate large shower. Everything has already been said about the service, which is all the way as perfect as you can expect. It is quite unbelievable to see how attentive the staff is, they succeed in anticipating your every needs. Regarding the breakfast, there is no buffet in the main restaurants (Gallerie / le Cinq). You have to make a selection à la carte. Then my recommendation would be to have breakfast in your room. There is no added value in going downstairs and waiting for a table. The only bad points are: - the lack of a scale in the bathroom, - the price of the internet connection (22€ for 24 hours access).

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Defenitely the BEST hotel of the world!!!! MUCH BETTER THAN THE RITZ!”
Reviews.Author: rata_200
Reviews.Content: I could descibe this hotel with just 3 words......refined, luxury and service. Best service I've had in my life! From the moment you enter the lobby you are amazed by the floral arrangements. The rooms are amazing! The bathrooms are huge and elegant. The SPA is awesome..... In fact I would classify everything in the hotel as excelent. I had a doubt about staying here or staying at The Ritz...... staying here was the best decision I've ever made. This is much better than The Ritz, I have stayed at The Ritz before and there is no comparison between both hotels. From the lobby to the rooms and the SPA the George V is better by miles. Don't doubt it, STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO STAY AT THE BEST HOTEL OF THE WORLD (and I often stay at hotels as Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Aman, etc....) Any doubt you have please contact me I will be more than happy to advise.

Reviews.Title: “Little short of perfection”
Reviews.Author: Londoner5870
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's expensive. But it's genuinely very hard to find anything wrong with the George V - and its strengths are immense. It's a beautiful environment for a holiday, and it makes the stresses and strains of daily life vanish for a while. It was my birthday the weekend of arrival and I was greeted with a wonderful cake and a bottle of champagne in my room. The room itself was immaculately maintained; quiet; spacious; and with the fabulous beds that make a night's sleep perfect. There are enough towels in the bathroom for a family of 10, and the housekeeping is flawless. As an extra since I was last there - they also now have flat-screen TVs and DVD players with great sound systems in the rooms. I agree that breakfasts are expensive and the service can be a touch on the overwhelming side --- I never before had a footstool on which to place my newspaper --- but the quality is high. Most of all, the attitude of the hotel staff is brilliant: French style combined with Four Seasons charm, and none of it feels artificial or forced. The ultimate recommendation is that on the two occasions I've been to the George V I arrived feeling a bit frazzled and world-weary. The hotel sorted that out and I left relaxed. Poorer, it's true, but I'd say it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “George V - Paris - WE ALL LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: ISOBELA
Reviews.Content: GEORGE V - PARIS We arrived early christmas morning, after being met by hotel meet and great service at airport. We were then introduced to our driver, who whisked us away in a black mercedes to this wonderfull hotel. We arrived at hotel 11am, i was told the room would not be ready till 3pm, not a problem we booked lunch at la gallarie for 2pm then went for a walk. Lunch was lovely, then we were shown to our room. I had booked an executive room for myself, husband and son, however the duty manager said we had been upgraded to a 1 bedsuite, with amazing views. The suite was lovely, 2 bathrooms, living room etc..... hugh balcony!! The staff at this hotel are fantastic, they can't do enough for you. We stayed at the ritz last year and George V is every bit as good, we couldn't fault anything. Yes, its expensive, but so is every other 5 star hotel in Paris. We did 3 shows, moulin rouge, Lido and the crazy horse, all brilliant. This hotel is in a great location, you can walk to all the major landmarks of Paris, plus the biggest Louis Vitton shop is at the top of the avenue!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off...”
Reviews.Author: JaseUK1
Reviews.Content: It's a great place but so overpriced. I wasn't paying but it's obscene they can justify these rates. There are many better places to stay in Paris for 80% less than what you would pay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favourite Places”
Reviews.Author: travelfashionista
Reviews.Content: What a delight! Of course, its rare to find any faults with a Four Seasons property (my other favourite hotel in the entire world is the FS in Hong Kong). But there is something about Paris...and the George V is really the tops. I have stayed in a suite at the Ritz Carlton in Paris, the Intercontinental and other big hotels, many of which are stuffy, tired and over-decorated. The George V combines the old world elegance one expects of a grand Parisian hotel, but without the kitsch cliche's; here you will not find swathes of red velvet and generous gold trim on every surface, nor the trendy dramatic lounge décor typical of the frères Costes. Instead, grand rooms with fresh powder blue and elegant trim, high ceilings, impeccable bathrooms, plush towels, Bulgari bath accessories and a wonderfully well stocked minibar. Indeed, as at most FS properties, it smells like Bulgari everywhere. Staff are polite, extremely accomodating. Food is expensive but fresh and delicious. I went to a reception downstairs which was well-catered, no obnoxious piano music. Lovely, tasteful and perfect all around. And, of course, the location is superb; minutes from all the best shopping Paris has to offer. I LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc51
Reviews.Content: The George V is by any standards a really fine hotel but the not necessarily the best in the world! Personally I think the Maurice is the best in Paris but any observations can only be made by personal experiences and these are going to vary as much as the human race does. Any one who can say they hate this hotel has clearly had a bad experience, probably with a member of staff which always influences your idea of any place.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at George V”
Reviews.Author: Mac7471
Reviews.Content: This is clearly a world-class hotel with prices to match. I spent Christmas here with my mother (we chose Paris as she lives in France and I live in the UK) and overall it was a lovely experience. We booked the Six Senses Package for 3 nights which turned out to be very good value (Superior room, daily breakfast, 3 course dinner at La Galerie each evening and a one-hour daily spa treatment each). It was no more expensive to stay there over Christmas than at any other time of year it seemed which was refreshing given the cost of top UK hotels during the festive period. The room was beautiful and spacious. Only one vanity unit in the bathroom but a separate bath and shower so plenty of space there too. Bulgari toiletries and pretty much every amenity that you can think of (except a coffee maker which you rarely seem to get in top hotels these days). Good entertainment system but very limited choice of DVDs and our dealings with the Business Center on this front were a bit hit and miss. Housekeeping was a different story - it operated like clockwork and the room was turned around very quickly each day and was always fully serviced when we returned from breakfast. Breakfast in Le Cinq was wonderful, the spa was lovely (good therapists, complimentary herbal teas, coffee and fruit, although arrive in your robe as the locker room is small), and the staff at the hotel work very hard to remember your name and make you feel special. Dinner at La Galerie was ok, but I wouldn't have eaten there more than once if dinner hadn't been included in our package (the food was very pricey for what it was - approx. 275Euros for a 3 course meal for 2 people without wine - and it's less of a restaurant, more of a corridor lounge, with very low uncomfortable chairs). It was also cold in La Galerie every evening due to the draughts coming through the courtyard doors. Having said that, they had live music every night (different types so we never got bored) and it had a nice atmosphere. We also had afternoon tea in La Galerie one afternoon and that was suprisingly reasonable. The hotel was decorated beautifully for Christmas and overall it was a lovely stay. The staff and the decor make it feel special rather than the facilities or the dining in my opinion. However, I stayed at the Peninsula in Hong Kong earlier in the year and enjoyed that more. We had one issue on checkout. To begin with I was presented with a bill for the package plus all of the included items as additional charges. I asked for these to be removed and the mistake was quickly rectified, although I was informed that dinner in La Galerie was only included up to the value of 80 Euros per person. I told the cashier that this was not reflected on the website, the booking confirmation, or on pre-arrival correspondence and that we had even checked in person with reception on our arrival and had not been informed of the limit then either. The cashier insisted on charging me for dinner each evening over and above the 80 Euros per person and I decided not to argue. However, my mother had a different view and took this up with reception before our departure. They discovered that the French version of the website and package clearly states the 80 Euro limit, but the English version does not. This is something to be aware of if you are booked on the Six Senses package. Reception agreed to request a refund to my card but could not do it there and then for some reason. However, the additional amount was refunded to my card and a credit receipt sent to my home address within a few days of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself.... you deserve it!”
Reviews.Author: Gingersheep
Reviews.Content: Loved the George V. I had heard fantastic reviews and believe me this hotel didn't fail to deliver. The rooms were beautifully decorated, service amazing and contrary to other reviews, I felt that the service and attention paid to the staff was second to none. I stayed in The Plaza Athenee last year and have to say the George V was much, much better. We stayed in a deluxe room with breakfast included and eating in Le Cinq each morning was an added bonus. I really would recommend this hotel for a romantic break or celebration. Treat yourself or the one you love!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: londonbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the George V for our wedding anniversary in mid December. Its a class act which probably accounts for the clientele- Bruce Springsteen and Will Smith were at the hotel when were there. We had a large suite, which was priced at around $3000 per night but frankly I'll pay that for special occasions without batting an eyelid as long as everything is spot on. Which it is. Great location, just off a decent part of the Champs D'E'llysee and the area itself is spot on. You are 10 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe, 20 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, 20 minutes to the Louvre and the Place de la Concorde and so on. The only schlep is to the 6th Arr if you want that left bank fix you have a cab ride or a longer walk. But walking Paris is the only was to do it anyhow. We had a free bottle of champagne on arrival, I had a load of concierge stuff to sort out which was done efficiently and without any fuss whatsoever, the bar is great--though small and the room service breakfast was perfect, if again, over expensive for what it was. I have stayed at the Bristol in a massive suite and the Georges V knocks it into a cocked hat as far as I am concerned. Despite the daft prices.

Reviews.Title: “None Better!”
Reviews.Author: drgene
Reviews.Content: I could not disagree more strongly with the person from Australia who wrote the preceeding review. Since its reopening as a Four Seasons property, this hotel has been the gold standard for all luxury hotels in Paris. The rooms are extraordinary by any standard. If the service is at times uneven, I can honestly say that this is the exception. From the moment one enters the hotel, one is made to feel welcomed and valued as a guest. Le Cinq is one of Paris' finest restaurants. I have never known the staff to be bored; rather, they are typically attentive to every detail. There are many types of room from which one can choose, and while no luxury hotel in Paris is inexpensive, this one truly delivers great value for what is on offer- top of the line luxury and service. It also has the best conceirge desk in town. The Premier rooms are among the best in Paris, and for a true splurge, book one of the Duplex Suites. I have stayed in every hotel that typically appears in the world's Top Ten, and to my mind there is none better than The Four Seasons George V.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: DippytheDog
Reviews.Content: Lack of Appeal Le Cinq was boring the staff boring rooms small they should be 50M square and everything should have marble

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Nachria
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the top hotels in the world: the Peninsula Hong Kong, the Oriental, the Four Seasons Hotel New York, Peninsula Bangkok, Amanwana. These are just a few. I have stayed at many of the top hotels in Paris. I have also stayed at half of the Four Seasons properties around the world. I usually do not write reviews on tripadvisor, but after reading the latest review which is so outrageously wrong, I felt that I needed to write my review. In my opinion, the Four Seasons George V is the world's best hotel and the world's best Four Seasons hotel. ROOMS: I stayed in a large expansive Deluxe room that overlooked the Marble Courtyard. The room was tastefully decorated as if it was the residence of a French nobleman. It was tastefully decorated in Louis XVth design, but had all of the wonderful amenities of a Four Seasons hotel: sound proof rooms, high ceilings, very soft beds, a large expansive marble bathroom, and Bulgari bath amenities. SERVICE: Service is what truly sets apart this hotel from others in the world. The service puts the George V in a category of its own. The service from the staff was effortless and impeccable. The perfect balance between formality and familiarity. The service was truly genuine. They made you feel that you were a valued and important guest to them, and that a perfect stay was something that they wanted you to have. The people are truly amazing. Every single department was consistent and excellent. The concierge is excellent. With a staff of 50 concierges, my requests were answered at all hours. DINING: Le Cinq is truly a magnificent restaurant. Le Galerie is a wonderful place to have breakfast. I plan on returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel that proves that flattery will get you anywhere”
Reviews.Author: coffeebar
Reviews.Content: looking at all those rave reviews and at the fact that this is tripadvisor's #1 hotel in all of europe, i know my review is not going to be one of the most popular. nevertheless, i felt the need to express my true feeling about this property. Dont get me wrong. i LOVE luxery hotels and god knows i am willing to pay for luxery. having said that, 4S GEORGE V trully delivers, but somehow, belive it or not, i cheked out a bit depressed. now why would someone that just stayed in the most beautiful property, given the most exellent service and slept in the most beautiful room on a fantastic bed have mixed feelings about anything in this world? well, to have feelings is a human thing, and this is the one thing this 4S lacks of: humaneness. this is NOT a class act. This is more like a well designed and extreemly well orchestrated ripp off. they know that what you really want , what you secretly dream of is to be treated like royalty so they give it to you, but they do it in a very cynical way. they do not give service - they kiss your [--]. they do it in a flattering way which so many reviewers bought into so easily. they make you forget you are paying 780 EUR per night for their least expensive room and they smile and sweet talk you all the way to spending 150 EUR(!) for a regular 50 min aromatherapy massage. i have payed similar anounts of money at properties like london's "sanderson" and "dorchester" hotels, Rome's "hotel de russi", paris' own "ritz" and "plaza athenee" and never felt the cynicism. the hotel GEORGE V in paris is the complete setting for wanna-bes to feel special. i will prefer a deluxe room in the full-of-its--self HOTEL COSTES then stay here again. the COSTES has atitude, but is authentic paris , not a "put on a face" like GEORGE V. its like disneyland for grown-ups, letting the "ordenery people" to live a dream once in a lifetime. problem is, the more experienced travellers will feel that micky mouse is laughing at them under his mask.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishKaren
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say that hasn't been already said, this hotel is a true gem and surely has to be if not the best but one of the best hotels in the world??? We arranged for the hotel to pick us up from the airport, this was the first treat, the minute we stepped off the plane it was luxury all the way, there was a represenative from the hotel there who whisked us through immigration and collected our bags for us, wow! Upon arrival I can't even remember getting out of the car it was all done so efficiently!! The first impression of the looby is pure oppulence, it was truly magnificent, beacause the Xmas season had started it was decorated with trees, candles and baubles everywhere, it was beautiful. We arrived early so our room wasn't ready so we had lunch at La Gallerie, a fantastic restaurant where you are treated like a queen, wonderful food and relaxing surroundings. The upto our room, we received an upgrade as we booked through Amex and it was our anniversary so were given the honeymoon suite. I have never in my life been speechless when I have entered a hotel room before, it was truly a beautiful room with views overlooking the Eiffel tower, the room was decorated with rose petals and scented candles as my husband had called ahead, it was everywhere, in the bedroom, living room and the bathroom. Decor classic French style in soothing creams and yellows, it felt like an apartment rather than a room. A fantastic bathroom with seperate shower plus an extra toliet, the bedroom was fab, a huge bed which was so comfortable. The first day we actually just stayed in and enjoyed the room and the views it was so fantastic!!! We had dinner at Le Cinq on the Sunday, it was a truly memorable dining experience, the food was wonderful, the ambience so relaxing and the staff could not have done enough for you. It's a night I will never forget. We had late drinks in the bar and that was also excellent. We had room service twice for breakfast and the food was delicious. I also had my hair done in the salon and again it was great. There is not one bad thing I can say about this place, it looks amazing, the staff are fantastic, they really are a credit to the hotel, there is nothing they will not do for you. The food is mouthwatering, you are in a great spot. It is so expensive but as long as you leave that thought at the door you will enjoy every moment of your stay, you are truly treated like an honoured guest. Go and enjoy the experience of a lifetime, I cannot wait to got back!

Reviews.Title: “Hoped for the best, and they impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Ian335i
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Four Seasons George V was to be my treat to myself this year, and it ended up being even better than I had imagined! The service there is unparalleled, and everyone there gets spectacular treatment. The hotel rooms are huge, by any standards, the bathrooms are huge as well as amazingly opulent. The Bvalgari shampoos and soaps are amazing, a must try even if you never stay at the George V. I stayed at the George V for 4 days, and I was about to cry when I checked out early one morning. FYI Paris doesn't wake up before 8am! I had the opportunity to try got their regular restaurant, Le Gallerie, as well as Le Cinq, their highly touted world renouned restaurant. Actually I didn't care for the menu too much at Le Cinq, but there's literally 5 people waiting on you hand and food, and after the generous amounts of champange you forget about the food. My dinner in the Gallerie was excellent and the service was astounding as well. Room service was awesome and the food arrived very hot, too hot to immediately eat. They don't mess around at the George V. Room service comes twice a day, and they look for things they can do, they don't just clean, they make sure everything is absolutely perfect, and with a great attitude at the same time. Parking (underground) was 40E a day, which isn't that bad. Phone calls back to the USA were quite expensive, but hey, the whole place is expensive, nevertheless you feel like you've gotten more than your money's worth when you're checking out.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in the WORLD!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JJCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I thought I died and went to heaven when I stepped into Georges V. We stayed here for our wedding anniversary, and I was nearly brought to tears when I walked into our room and saw the chandelier above the bed with chilled champagne waiting for us. Our room faced out onto a beautiful little street, and the location of the hotel itself is steps away from the metro, and Champs Elysees. The hotel pool and gym were top notch - so incredibly clean. They brought me chilled towels and bottled water while I was there. The concerige could not have been more wonderful. We were in Paris during the Rugby World Cup, and although the France-Ireland game was sold out, the concierge managed to get tickets in the 2nd row of a stadium filled with 80,000 excited fans. The concierge also helped us secure reservations at certain restaurants where we were told it was completely full. If you want to truly dine like royalty, and don't mind spending quite a bit of money on dinner, try Alain Ducasse (not in the hotel). Georges V offered us the hotel's private car, which took us to dinner on our first night there. The hotel also coordinated a car and driver for us so we could take in all the sites of Paris at night. We also had a delicious breakfast in the gorgeous Le Cinq restaurant. Even just hanging out in the hotel lounge was delightful. We had a very chic high tea there, as well as several late night snacks/drinks. I can't say enough wonderful things about this truly amazing hotel in the most gorgeous city on earth!

Reviews.Title: “Superlative”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_Nola
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days at this wonderful (and extremely expensive) hotel in Paris. From the moment the doorman opened the taxi door everything was first-rate and enjoyable. The lobby is as beautiful as ever. Staff is courteous and solicitous to the point that is actually seems like kindness and genuine affection on their part (I am not that naive though). Every inch of the facility is spotless and fresh. Bed is extrememly comfortable. Linens very luxurious. Le Bar is relaxed and relaxing, but some may be bothered by the cigarette and cigar smoke. Kids are treated very nicely by the staff. We had breakfast each day at the restaurant le Cinq and it was delicious and fun. The concierges were very friendly and happy to help. The business center is first-rate and you are not charged to use their computer and the internet unlike at many hotels. There were hordes of fans and paparazzi outside on several occasions waiting for Celine Dion, Gwyneth Paltrow, and other celebities. BY the way, we booked through American Express Platinum Fine Hotels and Resorts and were given a slight discount for the room rate AND a dopuble upgrade to a Superior Suite, as well as 4 p.m. checkout. I have scored upgrades about 40% of the time with thsi program and it really enhanced our time in Paris. Might be worth considering if you travel much and like upscale hotels.

Reviews.Title: “"THE BEST" Hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Redjohn14
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness where do you start ! This hotel from top to bottom is perfect. When we arrived at the property we received the already experienced unbeatable FOUR SEASON service. The entrance lobby is full to the brim with fresh flower arrangements and marble flooring. Staff are superb nothing too big or too small to deal with. The room was an executive room with a small living area. Spacious and clean are obvious to note, however the feel of the room and decor really does compliment the city you are staying in. YES this hotel is a little pricey but as the saying goes "you get what you pays for", We dined at the restaurant within the hotel "Le Cinq" which is a 3* Michellin and the price in fairness does reflect that. Food quality EXCELLENT caviar and cress soup, dublin bay prawns, veal off the bone & freshly made chocolate to mention a few. Ladies you know you have arrived when you get a foot stool for your handbag. Humour aside this hotel including the fantastic bar that joins the dining hall is THE VERY best. It is situated in a central position just of the Champs and puts you in the middle of the action. Cost apart this hotel does it all and a lot more. Enjoy, I am sure you will.

Reviews.Title: “Thank-you 4 Seasons Paris-Your the best !”
Reviews.Author: alveglia
Reviews.Content: WE WERE in europe for 4 weeks and spent out last week at 4 seasons in paris. and we are so happy we did .whaT a way to end a vacation. it was our 30 th wedding annivarsary.. i book a one bedroom suite and was so happy we were up graded to the emipire suite. IT has great views of the tower. room service, laundry everything was great. when we arrived we i drove & pulled in front no where to park the bell man runs out says welcome to 4 seasons. we are out of car escorted to lobby in seconds . and they parked car and had our 5 large bags in room by the the time we walked up stairs. the hotel is beautiful..and i thank the four season paris for helping make our 30 th wedding a great time !

Reviews.Title: “Dare I say "Perfect"?”
Reviews.Author: centrecourt
Reviews.Content: I've been to GV on four seperate occasions. Each time I vist, they increasingly treat me like a king -- meeting me at my taxi/car whereupon four or five people greet me by name, escorting me to my (always upgraded room) via private elevator. It's heaven. And, if you are not wealthy, you should visit the cafe anyway. Have an expensive coffee and pastry and soak in the sublime atmosphere. For all the wealth that flows here, you will NOT feel out of place or of a lesser class. Every guest is treated with near-honor. Sure, there are hiccups from time to time, but just speak up -- they will apologize and go beyond in making things right. Among the finest hotels in Paris -- and the world.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: 5stargirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the George V was for ten days, which included one suite for my husband and myself and a superior room for our eldest son. The fact is that if you book into this hotel you are paying a fortune. So once you are over that, what are the reasons for being here..... The service is amazing - from the concierge, to the boy who swings the front door, the bar attendants, or the breakfast hostesses - they all know your name. the business centre is fantastic (and we used it a lot), the housekeeping is impecable, the bar is tons of fun at night (you can book a table - be on time - it is very popular and the staff do their best).... i would tell you the best room for the price (our 21year old son had the most amazing room - better than our suite.,..)....but I am saving the room number for our next trip...... All in all, and we do expect the best, the Greorge V is THE BEST.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel, But.....”
Reviews.Author: cgf
Reviews.Content: The George V is a spectacular hotel. The lobby is filled with amazing floral displays; the rooms are lovely, spacious and kept immaculately clean; and the staff is very friendly. All in all, our 4 nights at this hotel were wonderful. There were, however, some strange inconsistencies with the service which, although not horrible, did detract from an otherwise fabulous experience. For example, when I booked our reservation for 2 rooms, I asked for rooms which were either connecting or close to eachother. Upon check-in, I was told that only one room was ready and that we should check back later for our other room. An hour later, we received a message from the front desk advising that there was a second room ready three floors below or we could wait for a room on our floor. We elected to wait. I requested to see the other room, which was lovely, but not that close to our other room. Although at 3:00 p.m. were were told that the second room would be ready shortly, it took until close to 6:00 p.m. (with a number of calls by me) before we actually received the key to the second room. Even when the key was brought, no one seemed concerned by or apologetic for the delay. Also, I had requested information from the concierge regarding a restaurant (Laserre). I was told that the information would be sent to my room, but I never received anything from the concierge. Three out of four mornings our breakfast (which was included as part of the American Express Fine Hotels Program) at Le Cinq was fantastic. The last morning, it seemed like someone lost our order, as the three of us all received our meals at different times and we waited an exceptionally long time for my husband to finally receive a waffle. Despite these odd glitches, I still found the overall experience to be excellent and I would definitely return to this hotel. Yes, it is expensive, but the view of the Eiffel Tower that we had from our room was priceless. I also give high praise to the spa- I had wonderful facial- another American Express Fine Hotel amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaSchain
Reviews.Content: This is, no doubt, one of the best hotels in the world! One of my favorite things was the flowers in the lobby. Unbenounst to me, they are designed by a native of Utah. Just amazing! My room couldn't have been more huge and beautiful, and of course, the usual impeccable Four Seasons service. Everything was perfect. The only downfall? It was so nice, I didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: heva_t05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the four seasons twice now i would reccomend it to everyone. I came with my auntie and uncle and cousin so of a night i stayed in minding my cousin and my auntie and uncle went out. I orderd room service which was quick and fantastic food. Of a morning we went into the resurant down stairs for breakfast which was the perfect egg you could ever get haha. The Staff at four seasons were the nicest politest people nothing was to much trouble for them. If you left your shoes outside your bedroom door at night they would take them away and clean them for you it was fabulous. The bedrooms were out of this world I think we had the suite with the living room in it it was so relaxing shampoo and soaps were fabulous. I would really recomend this hotel. Its is worth the money you pay. Heather

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 99lopeza
Reviews.Content: I have been in wonderfull hotels for work in all over Europe and this is the best hotel I have ever tayed in . This is not only due to the quality of the assets (room, bed, Toilet, room size) but to the quality of the people. They seemed in love with their work and this is something extremely difficult to find. They did us an upgrade and they treated us like kings/queen. I definitively will come again. The price is very high but to be honest its worth every penny of it.

Reviews.Title: “Too wonderful for words!!”
Reviews.Author: Cupcake333
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking hotel!! We were there for eight days w/ our three daughters in July...Memories we will never forget! Every aspect of George V is superb!! My youngest daughter is born on Bastille Day...during a private guest celebration they brought in a birthday cake and had a special surprise celebration for her! So lovely it is impossible to mention everything!! Rooms, Lobby , Staff, Service and so children friendly! Thank you George V !!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: gellura
Reviews.Content: Truly magnificent hotel in the heart of Paris. Expensive but worth every dollar. Luxury at its best in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: AimsHinton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the most wonderful and romantic three night stay at the Georges V. I had booked it as a surprise for our tenth anniversary. It was the start of our two week vacation in Europe and Britain, and I have to say that it was completely perfect. Yes, it is very expensive, however the exceptional service, incredible food, attention to detail, and beautiful rooms make it so worth it! They completely spoiled us, and made us feel as if we were royalty. Our anniversary dinner was so special in the Le Cinq restaurant. They suprised us with so many special little touches like champagne and flowers in the room and the most to-die-for dessert after an incredible dinner!!! All in all, after all the places we stayed on our holiday, this one reigned supreme! I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a beautiful place to stay with someone they love....

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: onmyway
Reviews.Content: Once Again the Fours Season's is the best.!!!! We stayed in Paris for 6 nights, 4 at the George V. The staff was very accommodating. Having heard that Paris can be difficult for those that don't speak French, I book ed the George V specifically for the concierge service. While we were visiting at a very busy time we never felt the service suffered. Upon arrival our room wasn't ready but we were offered the option of an upgraded room without a view that would be ready sooner or a wait for the better view. Traveling with a weary child we opted for the upgrade. While waiting for our room, we had breakfast in the terrace room. When I informed the waiter of family food allergies, the Host offered to write a note in French for me that I could give to the wait staff at any Paris restaurant. How thoughtful!!! We consulted the Concierge about directions and attractions and they were always helpful and on target. When we were going to walk to the D'Orsey the concierge advised a cab since it was closing soon. We were given the option of a car to Versailles, but the Concierge suggested the short walk to the RER train at Port Alma would be less expensive and very easy. It was. I highly recommend the Museum Pass. It is available at the gift shop. The pass allows you to use a separate entrance and avoid the crowds at most attractions. While I had read on this site that we would have to wait in line for ticket for our child anyway so the pass wasn't a time saver, I only found this to be the case Les Invalides. And there wasn't a line anyway. The staff at the Four Seasons handled our dinner reservations and we were treated very well at the restaurants. I really appreciated this after inquiring at a subsequent Paris hotel about a restaurant and the staff opened the back door and pointed. Later it turned out it was closed. Stay at the Four Season!!! Fini across the street has a 5 euro breakfast including croissant, coffee and juice. They also have take out food and drinks. This will curb your mini bar expense. A Budweiser is 12 euros in the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: transatlanticfoodie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in one of the best locations. Central to everything. You definitely feel luxurious walking into the lobby. The flower arrangements are unbelieveable and the service superior. The spa was lovely. Truly an oasis to escape from the world after a long day of shopping or touring. Expensive but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest Hotels in the World”
Reviews.Author: Challenger007
Reviews.Content: This was the one and only Hotel I wanted to stay in when planning a trip to Paris, and it exceeded all my expectations. The Four Seasons Paris is in a word '' beautiful ". The Four Seasons is well located, and every detail impresses. The world famous floral displays will astound even the most jaded, there is a gorgeous modern/ formal center garden, magnificent dining room, lovely bedrooms/ bathrooms, and generous closets! All of the staff we encountered were excellent and every space immaculately maintained. The dining room is a surreal Dinner setting and as you arrive to your table a staff member magically blankets the table top with fresh rose petals, tucks in cymbidium orchid blossoms, and candles. During my stay, there was a large VIP event in Paris and despite the high number of recognizable actors and sports celebrities swirling about, every Guest received the same VIP treatment. This is an extremely comfortable property despite the formality of the decor' and excellent in every way.

Reviews.Title: “I thought Id died and arrived in heaven”
Reviews.Author: travelloveraus
Reviews.Content: This is it this is what Paris is George V is the ultimate Parisian Hotel We were met at the door of the airplane by a gent holding a card with our name, whisked passed the queue thru the "diplomats/staff aisle" then our luggage was located and taken to our van / transfer. Our driver took us to George V and gave us a mini tour on the way. Upon arrival we were met by the doorman as if coming to our own home, very warm and welcoming. Reception check in was efficient and very courteous. We were personally taken up to our 2 rooms and the young German lady explained everything to us - made us feel like well as if everyone really appreciated us staying at George V. The rooms were gorgeous. On the 6th floor side view onto George V Avenue. The housekeeping kept the rooms immaculate, replenishing the toileteries Bulgari !!! and just continuing the absolute blissfull state from beginning until end. We had breakfast each morning (included in our stay) and felt nothing but pampered by EVERYONE on staff. The food was faultless, delicious, well presented and served by staff who served as if they were actually enjoying their job. The flower arrangements were the most beautiful and creative display of art comparable to none other.....the mood in the hotel was one of quiet luxury and peaceful well co ordinated staff who just wanted to do their best and were always on their best most personable behaviour for ALL guests staying. If you ever have the opportunity of going to Paris - my only tip would be to stay at George V and get a taste of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “a truly amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: lindabr
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at Georges V to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. When we walked in to the lobby it took my breath away - it was so beautiful. We had afternoon tea in the Gallery with champagne, and then went to our room. Wow! Everything was stunning, the bathroom, the fluffy robes and slippers, the huge plasma TV, books by famous authors who stayed there, magazines, fabulous toiletries, the list goes on! The location is perfect for taking a stroll down to the Seine, or shopping. Breakfast in the dining room is also highly recommended, as well as a nightcap in the beautiful bar. I cant think of anywhere better in the world to celebrate a special anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Rating is deserved”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Paris I decided to stay at one of the best hotels in the world! George V deserves all the rave reviews. The customer service is spectacular. I felt welcome right from the start as a solo woman traveler. The concierge was always helpful, and every question I had was answered pleasantly. I arranged a pick-up at the airport by the hotel, which was perfect. I didn't want to have to worry about arriving at a new city with jet-lag. The staff was waiting for me after I passed through customs. On arrival at the hotel at 9:00am my room was not quite ready so they offered for me to wait in the spa. Say YES, the relaxation room at the spa is spectacular. Little beds with fluffy duvets and curtains, where I could have stayed the whole day if necessary. My room was ready just 30 minutes later. My room, 605, was huge, and the bathroom was probably the size of most hotel rooms in Paris, approximately 10 x 15 ft. The bedroom had French doors overlooking an alley off Avenue George V, with a balcony. The Bulgari toiletries are wonderful. The location is perfect with a quick walk either to the Seine or Champs-Elysees. Tips: Take a bathing suit. The spa pool and facilities are included in your stay. Enjoy! The George V massage (extra $) is fantastic. Buy a metro full day pass and the Museum Pass. Make a daily outline of the things you want to see in Paris. I ran out of time so I am looking forward to my return in 2008. My visit of 3 nights was not long enough. The hotel is everything you read about and more. Life is short........Treat yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Europe”
Reviews.Author: symantix
Reviews.Content: I travel only a few times a year, so when I go somewhere, I want it to be as special as possible. After reading reviews here and finding that the George V is part of the AMEX Platinum program, we booked a deluxe King for 800 Euros. This happened to be our honeymoon, so I really wanted it to be extra special. As such, I wrote a letter in advance of our arrival. My AMEX rep also made a note in the reservation. Upon our arrival at CDG, we were met at the plane doors by a George V representative, and personally escorted through passport control & customs. We didn't have to wait in any lines or even stop to be inspected. We were then whisked away in a Mercedes van and arrived at the George V in about 45 minutes. I was very disappointed to learn they did not honor our guaranteed upgrade (something about full occupancy due to the French Open). Nonetheless, we were personally greeted by the new hotel director and escorted up to our room, which had a partial view of the Eiffel Tower. There were champagne and chocolates waiting for us, but no rose petal covered bed, candles, or other fancy tricks done by other top hotels for honeymooners. This too was slightly disappointing. The toiletries were BVLGARI brand, but seemed relatively cheap. I much prefer the Aveda or Kiehls products used by other hotels. We ate breakfast at Le Cinq every day (US$50 per person), and had a few drinks at Le Bar (US$33 each). Both experiences were ridiculously expensive, but worth the special treat. We were on our honeymoon, afterall. The spa was lovely, and the indoor pool featured wall murals depicting Versailles. The concierge could read us instantly, and made exceptional dinner recommendations for us. Make no mistake, this hotel will cost you an enormous amount of money. However, it is as close to perfection as you can get on a continent known for small rooms and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best, possibly better?”
Reviews.Author: Vuittonsofstyle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at George V several times since it reopened under Four Seasons around 7 years ago, but wondered how everything would work now that GM, Didier le Calvez has left for Shangri-La (Is he crazy?!!). Swiss GM Christopher Norton has taken over, someone we met at Four Seasons Singapore, and what a difference he makes. Staff seemed much happier on this trip and smiled a lot more. Service was more relaxed yet was at the same time more professional - a clever balance. Le Cinq, the hotels' exceptional fine dining restaurant, lost one Michelin star this year (down from 3 to 2), but I think this is because of the turmoil caused by Didier le Calvez leaving. There were rumors at the time that the chef would follow. Luckily, he did not and the food remains as good as ever. Staff confided that lots of new ideas were going to be implemented - things that my husband and I have suggested for ages. Sounds like they are listening now. All in all, George V feels lighter and friendlier and we liked it better. It is the best hotel in a city anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SamFinch
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel. The staff are all won over to the idea of joy in service. On top of that there is the really wonderful 3* Michelin restaurant with its outstanding wine list. You have to be mad not to love this hotel - if you can afford it, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wake1967
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been fortunate to stay at many wonderful hotels around the world, and it's hard to imagine one any better. The service, friendliness, and amenities are impeccable. I would heartily recommend you stay here if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “V stars for the George V”
Reviews.Author: Annielovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Thousands of critics and hotel snobs cannot be wrong--this is hotel heaven. Spending a girls' weekend in Paris in the spring at the George V is a truly magical experience. We arrived in the morning (overnight flight from New York) and were warmly greeted by the staff. We were informed that our room was not quite ready, but that the bellman would be delighted to bring our bags to the gorgeous spa so that we could take showers, have a light bite to eat, enjoy the quiet room, have a swim, sauna or steam, and just generally relax and recharge. Ahh.... We enjoyed some spa time, showered and headed out for a lovely lunch in St. Germain. Upon our return to the hotel--where the unbelievable lobby flowers from the morning had been freshened up by even more unreal arrangements--we learned that our room was ready and naturally our bags were already in our room. Ahh... Our room was on the fifth floor with a gorgeous view of the gardens and Avenue George V. It was spacious and comfortable with an enormous bathroom. The closets were large with lots of hangers and there was plenty of drawer space--little details that many hotels seem to be forgetting about these days. The decor reminded us of a little girl's dream Princess Room. Lovely, warm yellows and soft creams. The room was ornate but not overdone. A crystal chandelier glistened in the sun-filled space. The beds were the perfect combination of firm and soft, warm and cool. And the towels and robes were exactly what you expect when you go to a Four Seasons. The usual Bulgari treats were plentiful. Our chambermaid was exceptionally thoughtful. She arranged my shoes in the closet, and thoughtfully closed and arranged all of my bath products I'd carelessly left unsealed. We had breakfast in our room as the sun shone in and the breeze blew by. The best croissants, juice and jellies I have ever tasted. And the coffee was divine. I began to wonder...were they drugging me with laughing gas through the vents? We did not eat in the restaurant, but enjoyed drinks in the bar. Though small and crowded one evening (wedding revelers took up a good part of the bar), the space is ruby red and rather imposing but warm and welcoming with a lovely staff and a truly memorable Sancerre. The concierge service, as at every Four Seasons I've visited, was phenomenal. The staff--truly exceptional in every way. It's an expensive spot no matter how you slice it, but the slice is heavenly. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Onslow
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here for our honeymoon and it is without doubt one of the best hotels in the world. We travel a lot and had high expectations based on recommendations but everything was as good as we hoped. The staff were so gracious but respectful unlike so many other top hotels in Paris and the food in Le Cinq absolutely fabulous. We ended up dining twice and it was worth every penny. The spa was exquisite and well worth a visit for a pamper. The room was beautiful and what we expected from a Four Seasons. We even ended up with an Eifel Tower view which made it very special. All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at this magnificent hotel for 3 nights in April 2007. It's certainly one of the nicest hotels I have ever seen. The physical environment is impressive. Gorgeous lobby in marble and luxury finishings. The flowers in the hotel lobby and restaurants alone must cost them thousands per day. The room was large by Paris standards, with a walk-in closet, large, lovely bathroom, and the bedroom was decorated beautifully with the most tasteful, lovely decor imaginable. We were in a back courtyard with trees, so the view was not special, but it was also very quiet. The location is superb. Near the Champs-Elysees and great shopping. Convenient to 2 Metro stations. They were always able to get us taxis, which is sometimes a problem in Paris. The service is over-the-top, typical for a Four Seasons. We only had breakfast in the restaurant, although they are supposed to be one of the best dining experiences in Paris. Thank goodness we had a special deal which included breakfast because otherwise it was 35 Euros per person for a continental breakfast! We did not have time to check out the spa/exercise facilities, although I'm sure they were great. The concierges handled all our requests very competently. They seemd to be busy 24/7 with their high maintenance guests. The guests themselves were quite the well-heeled sort, well-dressed, good-looking, wealthy types, etc. That may or may not suit you. And that brings me to my last point. If money is no object, why would you not stay at this hotel? However, if you either care about your wallet, or feel that it's important to get ultimate value for your dollar (or euro), you may ask yourself whether it's really necessary to spend this kind of money for a hotel room in Paris. Most tourists who come here are probably busy vsiting museums, sites, shopping, and doing all the things that Paris has to offer. So, like New York, how much time are you actually spending in the hotel anyway? Furthermore, there are really a lot of other choices in Paris Hotels where you can have a very nice experience for half the cost. So, ultimately, although this was a once in a lifetime experience, I would stay somewhere else next time I am in Paris. Not to detract from what was a very special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly luxurious, unsurpassed service, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: SimoneP
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short trip to Paris, which as usual was wonderful. I stayed at the super-luxurious Four Seasons George V Hotel. This place simply oozes luxury - our basic (if you can call it basic!) twin room was extremely comfortable and spacious, with a huge marble bathroom, a small lounge area and a mini bar which was more like an entire store! The hotel lounge is sumptuous - take afternoon tea with cakes from the trolley, the cakes look like jewels and taste of heaven - and the atmosphere is very relaxed and friendly. The bar is fantastic - quite masculine but very cosy and comfortable. The restaurant is extremely beautiful - very formal but not stuffy; the food was super-rich and beautifully cooked and presented - it's not to my taste but if you like the Michelin 3-star style you'll love it, although maybe not the prices: some main courses were 250 euros each. I know you wouldn't usually think about flower displays when considering which hotel to stay in but at the George V they're an art form. They ship in 15000 blooms a week and have a team of florists refreshing vases on an hourly basis - nothing's done half-heartedly at the George V. The best thing about the hotel though is the staff - they are welcoming, friendly and unstuffy, but the service is superb and they are not over-familiar or intrusive; for me they made the hotel. I'm not loaded and this was a special treat, but despite the hotel being stuffed to the gills with the uber-rich, I never felt uncomfortable or out of place. If I had one critiscm it's that this fabulous hotel is very, very popular with the very rich and corporates so it was very busy - a couple of times we couldn't get a seat in the lounge or bar - of course the staff soon sorted that out for us. If money's no object then go to the George V; if it's for a special occasion and you don't mind splashing out then go there; if you like to get value for money then go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - disappointed”
Reviews.Author: seattletohongkong
Reviews.Content: The splurge of our 2-week European trip was 4 nights at the Georges V in Paris in September 2006. Certainly it is beautiful, the service was impressive, but unless there is a view, you could be in any city, which I found very disappointing. For a thousand dollars a night, (not a discounted rate) the hotel could not find a room to switch us to with a view. Our room was the only room down a long hallway (#310, I believe) that looked out onto an alley-like street with neon signs right in our view. I didn't want to show my extreme disappointment to my husband but I would not go again unless a view was specifically mentioned as reserved. I was hoping for a view similar to their advertising. Perhaps $1,000 rooms are entry-level at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Tiggertigger
Reviews.Content: Oh gosh - where to start. This is a magnificent hotel - absolutely gorgeous and the service is amazing. Everything is on a very grand scale. Dine in the restaurant as often as you can afford, enjoy a drink at Le Bar. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect treat for myself after weeks roughing it in Africa!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenagar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in some of the most fabulous hotels in the world, Peninsula & Four Seasons, Beverly Hills; Copacobana Palace, Rio de Janeiro; Westcliff, Jo'burg; etc...the Geoge V Four Seasons Paris trumps them all! I arrived at CDG airport from volunteering in Africa to a lovely welcome the moment I stepped off the plane. I was escorted to a customs officer and proceeded through before the other passengers. My transfer was in an elegant MB and the check in was speedy and efficient despite arriving several hours before check in time. Room was gorgeous and food and service were the absolute best I have ever had the privilege of experiencing. I was addressed by name by nearly every staff member. My stay was absolutely flawless ,as I expected from a hotel of this reputation. The George V hotel is certainly very special and I appreciated the amazing service and ambience even more after being without proper running water, electricity, service, and acceptable food for 3 weeks. My senses were able to come alive again in this magical place and everything from the wine and the food at Le Cinq to the spa treatments were the best I experienced in my life. Will definitely be returning as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: MCSCLondon
Reviews.Content: We were overwhelmed from the second we arrived to the second we had to leave – incredible service and luxury. The Spa was a haven and our room stunning. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What else ?”
Reviews.Author: T.O.Muflin
Reviews.Content: Only one word to sum up my experience at the "Georges" : "WOW"! Everything, from the check-in to the check-out, was just perfect. I won't spend lines describing all the fantastic amenities of that property (that would take hours). I'll just stress out the quality of the staff (Catherine : you're the best housekeeper ever !). I booked on a crapy website ( osny-hotels.com ) avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “My Concierge at the George V - I love this guy!”
Reviews.Author: rahpont9
Reviews.Content: I'm not a very wealthy guy, but I'll always manage to save enough for a return trip to Paris and a few nights at the George V. My last trip there I stupidly picked up the wrong suitcase at the airport and only realized this when I unpacked in my room at the George V. I called the front desk and they immediately sent up a hotel manager (Thomas) who called the airport right there from my room. Thanks to Thomas and the concierge named Christophe my suitcase was in my room by noon the next day. I didn't tip them before hand, but rather when I left. They are what makes this hotel so great. I don't know what I would do to make this hotel any more special than it already is. It's expensive for sure, but it's also not always easy to get a room. The staff there is simply first rate. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: JJBayArea
Reviews.Content: This hotel regularly shows up on 'Top 10 hotels in the World' lists, so we booked it last year. Wow, what fantastic, opulent, over-the-top experience! Our elegant deluxe room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, whose sparkling light show at night was spectacular. The hotel's food was wonderful, and breakfast in the beautiful conservatory, with views out large windows into the beautiful garden, was a treat. Service was great, all requests graciously handled in English. And the location on a beautiful street a couple of blocks off the Champs was ideal. This is my favorite hotel in the world!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations met!!”
Reviews.Author: rebru2003
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel! We had booked directly with the hotel and they had asked if it was for a special occasion. I told them it was for our anniversary. On arrival at the hotel we were swiftly checked in and taken to our room. On entering we realised we had been upgraded to the hugest suite I have ever seen in my life. Beautiful double aspect living/dining room with a table to seat 10. Amazing bedroom and bathroom. Guest toilet and kitchen. We had booked a superior room so this was a huge upgrade. Personal note from the manager and a bottle of champagne was another lovely touch. We hadnt wanted to eat in the hotel restaurant as we wanted something less formal. The concierge recommended a restuarant for us, made the booking and arranged a complimentary car to take us there. Next morning had a tasty breakfast. Good choice of food and excellent staff The hotel is very grand and quite formal which I dont always like but the george V does it very well and we did not feel uncomfortable at any time. Could go on and on praising it but will just end to say that I will be very hard pushed to find somewhere where I will get treated as well as we did. Four seasons at its best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: krcmdnyc
Reviews.Content: I spent my 40th birthday at the George V between Christmas and New Year's, and it is so magnificent. Everything, from the service to the rooms to the restaurant to the spa to the amenities, is absolutely first rate. There are other grand hotels in Paris, some with even greater provenance, but they all basically need a 30 million dollar renovation. The George V has had this renovation, and it gleams. The staff is so polite, friendly, and helpful. I really felt at home. I would recommend asking for a well situated room(eg facing out to the street as opposed to another building's courtyard) over a larger room or suite. Being able to look out onto the Avenue George V is, in my opinion, so much more beautiful than more square feet and someone's ugly backyard as a view. Lastly, go for dinner at their restaurant, Cinq. It was the most expensive dinner of my life, but well worth it! Overall, my greatest compliments to this perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: smileyw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our Christmas at the Four Seasons Hotel George V. We had an absolutely fabulous time. We also enjoyed a couple’s massage offered by the hotel which was outstanding. The staff members were professional and extremely courteous. Next trip to Paris… we will definitely make reservations at the Four Season George V!

Reviews.Title: “Oh so sorry to say its not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mesh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at Four Seasons George V, Paris. We were lucky to be upgraded again to a beautiful suite. All was perfect until the last evening. Started with room attendant smashing a glass by the mini-bar, accidents do happen. Took 1/2 hour for housekeeping to arrive to clear up glass, not unduly a problem for us. Ordered room service, two meat dishes of the day, as per previous evening. Had checked the content of the dishes earlier in the day and confirmed with room service when ordered. As usual the meal arrived exactly on time but this time completely the wrong order! Room attendant phoned room service to get order changed to our original request. Room service called to apologise and double check order. Order arrived 40 mins later, 1hr 10 mins now since first ordering meal, correct meat everything else wrong! Asked for bread to be brought as well and when this was delivered the attendant dropped it on the floor. He spent some time on hands and knees looking for a missing bread roll, which by this time had become quite comical! All this shattered our illusions about the service from this beautiful hotel. Try the ice-bar if you are visiting, we had a wonderful time there. Do check your bill as mentioned in other posts,we were charged for parking two cars for one of our nights stay! The wrong room rate had also been quoted. Would we go back? yes definitely!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lindilou
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris on the 12th. I stayed at George V two nights. I enjoyed every minute of my stay. The hotel is located in the 8th arrondisement (district) on Avenue George V. It is about a block from the Champs Elysees. My room was a little smaller than I anticipated, but it came with all the accoutrements of a room at a luxury hotel, including a full-size umbrella. That really came in handy since it rained both nights of my stay. There are Bulgari toiletries in the bathroom, a large terry cloth bathrobe and terry cloth slippers. The bed is something else!! It's like sleeping on a cloud. There is a down mattress pad on the bed, and you just sink in it. The pillows are fluffy and comfortable. There is this wonderful smell in the room due to a sachet in the closet. The first night at the hotel you can leave your shoes outside your room and they will shine them, complimentary, and leave them for you before you leave the next morning. They wrap them in tissue paper. It's such a nice touch. I arrived early and had to wait a few minutes for my room to be ready. I was seated in the dining/lobby area. I was about to put my purse on the floor when a young lady brought over a stool and put my purse on it. I was given complimentary tea and biscuits and a Herald Tribune while I waited. I was allowed to check in early at no extra charge.There is turn down service each night. There were truffles and a bottle of Evian water in my room when I arrived. I ate breakfast there one morning. It was almost 50 euros. I only had crepes, ham, and American coffee. That was a bit too expensive for me. There is an Hediard store next door. Louis Vuitton is a few steps away. There are too many restaurants and shops nearby to mention. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind paying for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “What's the buzz about?”
Reviews.Author: berenjenas
Reviews.Content: Ok. So it is true. The service is wonderful but hey with those prices, it'd better be. This hotel is expensive as heck... and for those prices I was expecting a very modern room or a really old and romantic Parisian-style room but that is very much limited to the lobby and the wonderful restaurant et ç'est fini. The decor is a golden faux wall paper and the inside of the closet shows it is time for a makeover. If you want to dry your hair, good luck, you will need to keep your finger pressed on the power button and the cable is so short you basically have to turn around to dry all your scalp. But with all that said if you like to burn money just to say you stayed there.. well.. then you will have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: Toshimiumiu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Four Seasons hotels but nothing prepared me for this exquisite hotel. Having arranged to be met at the airport, we were greeted as we stepped off the airplane. Whisked to the front of the customs line and driven to the hotel by a knowledgeable and friendly driver. With our arrival we were treated as visiting family members. What did we need, was there anything to be done for us? The incredible service never let up from the dining room to the service workers. I read that some do not appreciate the renovation of the hotel. Not having seen it before, I cannot imagine how it could be better, The public spaces, the walls, the gardens, the flowers, the dining room, all are wonderful. This hotel is worth every euro it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: RBruse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in October of this year. The service was fantastic. For a large Hotel I was always called by name and the Ass. Manager even ordered one of the house cars to take me to dinner. All the reviews are right. This is one of the best Hotels I have ever stayed in. And by the way, this must be the place to stay as while I was there M. Jordan checked in.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Brum74
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the George V you know you have reached a world class hotel. The doormen are welcoming, the check-in desk is amazingly friendly and all other members of staff smile and greet you as you walk around the hotel. The rooms are stunning. The Spa is the perfect place to relax. The hotel restaurant is the best I have ever had the pleasure of eating at. Le Bar is just the most amazing, understated place in which to sip late night cocktails. The concierge desk is amazing. These people have such clout, they will get you into the most exclusive places Paris has to offer – without queuing! And when at external venues they treat you like royalty because they want to keep the George V concierge happy. We stayed here for 3 days and I was did not want to leave. It is not cheap but it is worth every penny. Better to stay here for 3 nights than 5 or 6 nights in a bland, okay 5* hotel. I have stayed at 5* hotels all over the world and this is the best. I cannot say any more than that, just try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TJS118
Reviews.Content: Celebrated a belated honeymoon week in Paris.....spent the last two days in George V. It was a wonderful way to conclude our trip. To our delight we were upgraded to a mini-suite, beautiful room and bath (soaked in the deep tub both nights after a day full of sightseeing!) Service was impecable from the reception desk, spa, room service. While it is pricey, it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the special occasion!”
Reviews.Author: J.P.Hernes
Reviews.Content: We have made a tradition of celebrating the grand old age of 10 - ten - with a trip alone with dad, to a place to be chosen by the birthday kid. Pål had decided on Paris a long time ago, and dad had decided on the George V. Both were perfect choices! Even though the George is luxurious, they were non-snobbish and very nice to my son. They even upgraded us from a double room to a suite. Very nice! Pål also got a custom made T-shirt that he kept on during the whole stay... George V was perfect with a10 year old, swimming pool, and a short trip from all the sights - and the Champs Elysee just around the corner. After a long day walking around Paris, climbing the Eiffel tower on foot, seeing the Mona Lisa etc. Pål (and father) just loved staying in our room and watching the world cup on the telly. Getting milk-shakes and hamburgers from room-service made the event perfect. Seeing Robbie Williams who stayed at the George during our stay, was also something for a 10 year old boy! The George V is perfect for the special occasion - a romantic week-end or something similar! Or all the time if you´re rich enough...

Reviews.Title: “George V - Luxury & Comfort!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Joneses
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the George V for 5 nights in one of the Duplex Suites for our 15th wedding anniversary. It was magnificent! The room was beautiful and the service was excellent. We were first greeted by the beautiful flowers in the lobby, and the friendly staff at Reception. When we arrived, our room was not quite ready. We were shown to The Gallerie where we were served drinks (on the house) while we waited for our room to be ready. A player sat at the grand piano playing beautiful classical music while we lounged on comfortable chairs sipping our drinks. Within 15 minutes, we were told that our room was ready. We were shown up to our room which was on the 7th floor. It was by itself down a long hallway, with no neighbors on any side. When we walked in, we were thrilled! There was a hallway leading to the main living room/dining room area. There were two little balconies from which you could see beautiful roofs of Paris apartments. The kitchen was hidden behind two closed doors and contained a nearly full-size refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave and oven. The downstairs also contained a coat closet and a nice size bathroom. A staircase led us up to the bedroom with its extremely comfortable bed, and small sitting room. The sitting room had a view of the Eiffel Tower which was magnificent! The bathroom was all marble and glass with a separate tub that was so deep, you could almost swim in it! Back downstairs, waiting on the glass coffee table was a bottle of champagne and a beautiful pastry/cream dessert that said "Happy Anniversary". It was definitely the most beautiful room we have ever stayed in. During our stay, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They brought us a converter for our electrical equipment, and tableware for the kitchen. No one seemed stuffy, only very friendly. We paid 1800 Euro per night for our suite, and it was worth every penny! We would highly recommend this hotel, and would love to go back some day!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the George V”
Reviews.Author: misticane
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our European honeymoon and our 6 days at the George V in Paris was definitely the highlight. From the moment you check-in you're treated like royalty. This hotel is all about luxury. They had a nice bottle of champagne and a handwritten note for us upon arrival. It's blocks from the Champs Elysee - so we walked everywhere. Our suite had a balcony with a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. It was absolutely romantic. We relied on the concierge for pretty much everything. Where to eat. Where to buy cloths (Alitalia lost our luggage...) How to get to the flea market. So very helpful and kind. Spending the day exploring Paris is tremendous and coming home to the George V at night is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “The George V is #1.”
Reviews.Author: JohnSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons George V from September 7-11, 2006. Without sounding like a broken record, it is worthy of every accolade imaginable. If you want to find the business model for extraordinary customer service, look at the George V. Having attended a behind-the-scenes tour of Disneyworld to study customer service and how a perfect guest experience is created, I would highly recommend the George V as even better. The environment of gorgeous flowers, impeccable manners, and superb cleanliness is second to none. With countless hotel check-ins during 30 years of travel, the Four Seasons George V offers the best service I have seen. It is a rarity to see a Hotel Director out of their office, but at the George V the Director is a "hands on" manager. Jean-Claude Wetzel even checked my bags as I prepared for a late departure. A friend who was in our traveling party required medical assistance and before you could turn around, paramedics from the hotel arrived. A car and driver was provided immediately for an appointment with a quality physician at a Paris hospital. Fortunately, everything turned out well. The hotel's on-site Spa is highly professional, exceptionally clean, and customer friendly. Regarding food, the morning croissants were spectacular! The George V is in a superb location just a couple of blocks from the Champs and a five-minute walk from the Arc de Triumph. In my judgment, George V has earned Trip Advisor's #1 ranking in Paris. My genuine thanks to Mr. Wetzel and his staff! I will return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nomorelux
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of perfectly perfect. And absolute dream!

Reviews.Title: “True Paris Luxury”
Reviews.Author: acgk
Reviews.Content: Met all of our high expectations during our short stay . Impeccable service with one of the nicest rooms I've every stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!”
Reviews.Author: homebody12
Reviews.Content: The finest hotel I have ever stayed in. I have stayed in many Four Seasons and other wonderful places. This place tops them all! Concierge that will do anything. They are happy to see children. We stayed in a fourth floor room looking out of the Ave George V. I was afraid it would be noisy. The windows must be two inches thick. Not a sound. Perfect English and French speaking staff. Charming, fun, relaxed. Everyone has smile like they know you know you have just arrived in the most wonderful slice of heaven in the most exciting city. Expensive but I'm happy to pay it now and again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything its said to be and more.”
Reviews.Author: Cardician
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This hotel earns its reputation. It is absolutely incredible in every way. So much so, that a person like myself who is not use to such fancy posh elegance was even a little uncomfortable there, though not due in any way to the staff. My girlfriend, now fiancee, arrived there to conclude our European vacation. I got us a suite and they had flowers and champagne waiting upon our arrival. It was such a magnificent room and moment that I went ahead and proposed to her there. Might as well take advantage of it. Really, everything about the hotel was great. Breakfast was included in our room price, so we had it delivered every morning. They brought it up and completely laid it out on the table for us. Very fancy and professional. Very nice. One night we ate at the more casual restaurant they have and it was incredible. Very friend staff. Very pricey. We didn't eat at Le Cinq, but if it is better than that, I imagine it must be nice.
