Everything about the rooms are incredible. The showers and bathtubs are insanely nice. The beds are supremely comfortable and the pillows were perfect. Every staff member we encountered were unbelievably friendly and it didn't seem forced or fake at all. Really we probably spent more time in our room than out seeing Paris just to really take advantage of the place. It was absolutely incredible. I really don't have a negative comment to say about the hotel. If you can afford it, you should do it at least once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Tonto itha
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days to celebrate a special birthday. We had high hopes and we weren't disappointed. Fantastic suite with a view of the Eiffel Tower - yes you pay for it but what a view! No coffee making facilities in the room which was a shame but the gym - wow! What a treat! We were given eucalyptus infused towels straight from the fridge to mop our brows as we sweated in the hot tub! The pool was glorious and the guys in the bar gave me a single yellow rose one night. Sweet! The best thing? The use of the George V mercedes! With liveried chauffeur - how Pretty Woman did I feel arriving with my hubby in that car! Everything was first class and then some. Would definitely recommend and would definitely go again. Any time. Fantastic hotel. Great location. Expensive but superb service - if you can stretch the budget for this - do it!

Reviews.Title: “Paris when it hiccaps!”
Reviews.Author: Gradiva
Reviews.Content: Succumbing to rave reviews similar to those one finds here, dining at Le Cinq was much dreamed about and highly anticipated. And indeed, the luxury of the dining room is impressive and grand, although the first grain of doubt, that is good taste yielding to knock-out ostentation, creeps insidiously at the first steps walking to the table. The next astonishment, swallowed silently , came with the welcoming starter arrival - how was it possible in a three-star Parisian establishment to serve proscuitto with absolutely no invention – just plain good old proscuitto on the plate? We were not in Italian trattoria…That was a bit shocking, and ominous - the quality of the restaurant can ALWAYS be judged by this chef's treat before anything else arrives. It is the same in purpose as the first dazzling aria in an opera, made up to hold one’s breath, to astonish, to set up the mood for the remainder of the performance. Le Cinq was a perfect example of the rule, unfortunately. After such a starter, the proudly announced duck, advertised as having been cooked for 24 hours, revealed its best kep secret of being just a chewy sweet overcooked piece of protein, accompanied with Chinese style green beans, suspiciously reminding of the taste of China town in any major American city. Dessert was just as mediocre, and it was funny how pompous everything was described by the staff, with their eyes rolling in ecstasy, only to end up so bland and plain on the plate. Indeed the service was the best ingredient of the dinner, persuasive and even hypnotic - waiters were speaking so solemnly, with awe and reverence about the dishes. And then, after the sobering tastelessness of the first bite it was only too painful to feel the inability to join them in their near-religious worship of this eclectic edible food. One explanation may be that they never try Le Cinq food themselves because it’s so exorbitantly expensive that the management prohibits even the chef to taste a spoon or two? It is sad to see how the desire to be different and extravagant exterminated the bottom-line - serving fine French cuisine to delight all senses. Le Cinq must be so hype and in vogue due to the prestige they managed to create, and perhaps the diners simply don't dare to admit how poor the food is after paying a fortune for an evening of a surrealistic gastronomic discovery. And one last note – the décor and flowers in the clear vases must be Four Seasons signature, as in Cairo or in Boston the decorations are very similar. Which takes the previously assigned admiration for originality somewhat away. Let it always be One Feasting Season in Paris, as in can be discovered in so many other great places, like L’Espadon, to compare truffles to truffles.

Reviews.Title: “It truly is one of the world's best.”
Reviews.Author: gibsor3
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days at the end of a 2 week trip to Provence at the George V. I have, all my life, heard of the legendary hotel and my expectations were high. They were also completely met. If you have the means, this hotel will be a memorable experience from the moment you arrive to the moment they drag you out, kicking and screaming. The bar is expensive (expected), but the service is perfect. My only disappointment was with dinner at Le Cinq. My wife was not up for the tasting menu and I suspect that this was our error. The meal was good, but not memorable (unlike the bill). Ironically, we were to originally book dinners at Le Cinq and at Alain Ducasse at the Plaza Athanee, however Alain Ducasse is closed Saturday and Sunday (curious that a 5 star hotel's only restaurant can be closed like that). The concierge at George V recommended an alternative, Laserre, nearby on Boul Franklin D Roosevelt. It was magnificent.... only 2 star I believe, but a marvelous experience; a ballet of waiters like I have never seen. The food was memorable. I was very pleased with all of the recommendations of the cocierge. One other thing with the cocierge at George V. Ask if you can pick up the 3 or 5 day museum pass at his desk instead of waiting to get one at a participating museum. A 2 minute stop there can save you 2 hours in a line-up at the Musee D'Orsay or the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for discerned gentleman and young, well-heeled alike”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a young entrepreneur that frequents some of the finest hotels in the world, and truly do judge as a critic, George V is a gem. The customer service is unrivalled to any of the other establishments I have stayed at, and the Champs-Élysées location speaks for itself. Sometime I do wonder how they manage to get all the details spot on, but with the Four Seasons price tag that should really be expected. Went here for a Mink Club private party, and the event rooms are also superb. Fully expect to pay top dollar though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: princeton12321
Reviews.Content: Ill spare everyone with all of the details, as theyve been discussed quite a bit in the other reviews. Let me just say that this is not only a fine hotel, it gives meaning to life. Im not usually one for corny sayings like that, but when you stay at this place youll know exactly what im talking about. Anyone can make a fine building, fill it with fine people and furnishing, and charge an armload to stay in it, but FS George V took it further. The attention to detail that they presented regularly, not just once or twice but every interaction, was superb. Little things like remembering my small daughter's name and addressing her as a small adult, knowing what kind of tea I prefered from their extensive menu after the first time we dined in the tea room, and recommending the perfect romantic restaurant in the city and securing impossible reservations last minute. All this, and the staff have ZERO pretentions about them (unlike the Ritz). The whole operation is so classy. I was very skeptical paying over a grand a night for a room, but I left feeling that the FS George V offered an incredibly good value for the money. I felt I recieved my money's worth and then some. Needless to say, this is my new address when I am visiting Paris for business or pleasure. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in the World by a mile”
Reviews.Author: holstrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at the Four Season George V for my birthday recently. What a treat. this hotel is beyond comparison with any other hotels. Service is impecable, the hotel and its facilities are in perfect condition and its rooms are without doubt the most comfortable i have stayed in ever. We had a suite which was amazing and i was treated to a birthday cake and chamoagne on arrival which was a lovely touch. Constance, the customer services manager, is without a doubt a real asset to the hotel and must be sought after by all of the hotels competitors worldwide. We had Dinner in Le Cinq which was outstanding and the service again impecable. Spa Treatments - dont miss out on this. its a whole experience in itself and is quite literally the most relaxing few hours i have ever spent. Everything from Room Service to laundry to shoe shine is perfection itself This is definately a must do on your list of things to do before you die!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Constance & team rule the world...”
Reviews.Author: jpmay
Reviews.Content: Far and away the best hotel in the world. As a "minor" added bonus, Philippe Legendre's cooking at the Cinq restaurant is quite possibly the best in the world right now, and Enrico Bernardo is almost certainly the best sommelier in the world. The 4 seasons paris makes life worthwhile ..... It's literally difficult to know where to begin describing the hotel, as the design, execution, emotion, spirit, service, detail, skill and LOVE each individually set the standard for all major world hotels. Things may change in a few years, but here and now, the 4 seasons paris is 'it."

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: Elian
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband returned to Paris and to George V for our honeymoon in October 2005. Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for adults but no game room for kids”
Reviews.Author: BostonBP
Reviews.Content: We just got back. It was great. The staff was the best. The food was fantastic. We have an 11 year old and we travel all over the world. No game room and no kids club. The only thing I did not like was no wireless internet in our room and no lcd TV's. We stayed one week. Paris was great. Everything else was 5 star! B.Pratt

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: I took my niece and sister-in-law to Paris for their first visit there and decided to splurge on the George V. It was well worth it, and then some. I arranged for the hotel to pick us up at the airport, and were met at the gate by the hotel representative who whisked us through immigration. Well, well, worth the cost; nothing beats being able to jump to the head of the line when you're still half asleep from the long overnight flight. From check-in until the moment we left, we were treated so, so well. We had a deluxe corner room, which was decorated in pale blue tones and a lovely bath which also had a window. They had a small gift waiting for my niece; it is a great place to take children. The pool is a great way for kids to wind down after a long day of dragging them to the sights. The spa is simply incredible (I had a facial, my sister-in-law had a massage). The staff was so accomodating and not too overbearing. We ate at Le Cinq on our last night, which is one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Great drinks and people watching in both the Gallerie and the bar. Overall, this was one of the most memorable hotel stays I've ever had; truly lovely in every way. I will say that this is not a hotel for everyone. If you prefer a small, intimate, even quirky boutique hotel, do not stay here. This is a grand, classic hotel that caters to those who expect to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “George V (Out of V)”
Reviews.Author: SELECTASPACE
Reviews.Content: We had the most fantastic stay at this grand dame hotel right on Avenue George V in the exclusive shopping area of Paris. From the moment you arrive you are transported into this world of "nothing is too much trouble" - the staff to guest ratio must be about 5 to 1 as you never waited that long to get served, and any request was dealt with efficiently and expediently. And it's not snooty of fussy - not like that horrible Prince De Galles next door...... the decor is old style empire feel with huge tapestries in the public areas and lots of marble, wood paneling and gilt. If you like Schrager etc it may send you a little mad ! Food is exquisite and very expensive and there's lots of interesting flower arrangements in the public areas. Everyone was very friendly and chatty. Weird ! You expect them to be a little snobby, but no, they're nice ! You feel comfortable to be there. Hmmm, must be that Four Seasons thing ! We was upgraded to an unusual shaped room with 2 balconies overlooking the paris rooftops - very romantic. Bathroom was huge with the signature four seasons power shower, huge bath encased in marble. not over the top. just luxurious and functional. Spa probably has the best therapists in any hotel in Europe. Amazing ! nIce pool. Hotel is kid friendly - which is always worrying when you're coming to a hotel like this. And avoid the mini bar which is a rip off, £5 for a small packet of crisps !!! but aren't they always :-) And lastly, one critisicm - it's such a OVER perfect stay, with everyone pandering to your every need, so that you want for nothing....by the time you go back to the real world....it's quite a shock !!!!! Guess we'll have to book again then to get over it ! Well done George V !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As noted in many of the reviews already posted about the Four Seasons George V, there is literally *nothing* to criticize about a stay at the George V. I suggest to all honeymooners to start your honeymoon at the George V for at least two nights. Do your best to get a room that has a view of the Eiffel Tower (off season helps). The tower is spectacular from the George V and will add so much to the romance of the occasion that it is well worth any extra cost that it might entail. I have posted photos from our honeymoon stay taken on September 30 and October 1, 2005. If you want to view more fine photographic images of the Eiffel Tower, the Chagall Ceiling at the Paris Opera, and more, please visit SterlingImages(-).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible-Best City Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: luxurytraveler
Reviews.Content: Anyone who finds flaws with this property needs to be admitted to a psychiatric facility!! This hotel is perfection in all respects. Definitely ranks as one of the top, if not THE top, city hotel in the world. The only caveat is that it’s also probably one of the most expensive, so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SpaceHopperSussex
Reviews.Content: I took my Company to the George V for our annual dinner this year where we also stayed overnight. It was exceptional. From the pre-stay organisation by the Conference staff to the moment of departure, the service was of the very highest standard and totally faultless in every aspect. I cannot see how it could ever be beaten or even rivalled. I cannot speak highly enough of the George V and will definitely return as will many of my staff. Hotels in Central London who claim to be on a par and certainly charge the same as the George V would benefit from a stay there to see how hotels of quality should and can be run.....

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: MJC73
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to celebrate our engagement at the George V in Paris and we could not have chosen a better place to do so. From check-in to check-out it was an amazing experience that strangely leaves you a little hollow afterwards when you realise that the rest of the world isn't as perfect, friendly and efficient. We arranged for an airport pickup that involves being met at the plane door and taken through passport control without having to queue which was not so important for us having only flown from London but if you had flown from further afield I think it would be greatly appreciated. The driver was extremely knowledgeable and provided some wonderful recommendations for some alternative sights to visit(this being the latest in a number of trips to Paris, we were keen to see something else other than the usual sights). On arrival we were kindly upgraded to a deluxe suite on the 7th floor with an enormous terrace, whilst the view itself isnt all that inspiring (other than a distant view of Notre Damme), were it summertime this would be the wonderful place to have a romantic sunset drink. The suite itself was immaculately and tastefully decorated. We had dinner that evening at Le Cinq, the 3 Michellin star restaurant and again were amazed by both the food and the service (they even managed to provide a perfectly fitted jacket, something I find hard to locate myself so this was quite impressive, as I had neglected to pack one). The restaurant itself is an elegant, highly decorated room and a wonderful experience, although were it not for the unfailingly friendly service from the staff the atmosphere could have been overwhelmed by the decor. If you are seeking a buzzing, cooking as theatre type experience this is probably not for you (we were recommended a restaurant called Costes which we wil try on our next trip to Paris) but our meals were perfectly executed and delivered with unfailing care and attention to detail. Check out was very friendly (they remembered to provide congratulations on our engagement) although it has to be said that the bill is not for the feint of heart. All in all the experience was one that we will never forget, the staff are to be highly commended, in the time we were there we experienced only a desire to do whatever it took to ensure that we had exactly what we required without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Trop Nouveau Riche à la Theme Park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once in a while, we stay a week-end at the Four Seasons George V to check things out. Perfect in everyway, not much to add to what is superficially obvious. The décor, although a tad too "interior-designish," works well in combining the original Art Déco and antique furnishings with various newer elements of English Georgean / Queen Anne / Regency, French Empire / Louis XVI / Neoclassical. Among the guest-room furnishing are coffee tables recognized from a well-known European source that one can easily special-order from the States. The overall effect is of a generic upscale beige in the bathrooms, and yellow or blue/gray in the rooms. Gone are the opulent red of the old George V. For the pure material level of comfort and service, North American / Canadian style, it is absolutely the ultimate in Paris. And the "new" George V itself is quite spectacularly beautiful, especially the courtyard. Having said that, however, we must redirect our critique to a more sophisticated level. The service at the Four Seasons George V, while exceptional, is in general too nouveau riche in taste: too friendly, too profusely accommodating, too, too much!!!! Is it THAT necessary always for the restaurant staff to accompany monsieur or madame out of Le Cinq to the toilettes???? Frivolous and embarrasing! But we have to give them credit for doing so with such gusto:"Je vous accompagne!" But other times, it's a different story. We lost a scarf in the bar, and the staff was too troubled to be asked to locate it. But they did try...Mind you, we are native Parisian French speakers. (So that goes to show rudeness is democratic in Paris, not just towards Americans!!!) What we also find disturbing - and sad - is the fact that the George V is now generically referred to as the Four Seasons, with the historic "George V" namesake lost somewhere in translation. What a shame! It was an American who initially created this hotel for the Anglophone clientèle, and named it in honor of George V. It is interesting to note that it is the International customers who always refer to it as the George V, while the American guests always call it the Four Seasons, not always aware of the hotel's significant historic American connection (General Eisenhower established headquarter here at the end of World War II), or the fact that Four Seasons is a Canadian chain. And after staying here for a while, the hotel does seem like another generic expensive venue for some people to play out their fantasy of wealth and power, and the atmosphere quickly ceases to be classy. We highly recommend this hotel for a general opulent stay, but beyond that, there are other hotels with more characters, and more histories. In addition, we much prefer the nuancely aristocratic, the discretely restrained, and the slightly stand-offish but acommodating service of the many other Parisian Hôtel-Palaces.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: annalef
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure staying at this hotel. The service is quite good and you can walk in downtown Paris from the hotel to any major location.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hotels in Paris, if not the best Hotel. It is situated 5 minutes from the Champs Elysées on one of the most expensive avenues in Paris. Many French designer boutiques, such as Chanel, are situated on the same avenue. The only downside? It is one of the most expensive hotels in Paris too.

Reviews.Title: “A Parician legend”
Reviews.Author: CS-London
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris after we have spend three nights at this exceptional hotel. We normally stay at the Ritz Hotel but this time we have desided to stay at the Four Seasons George V. It is not easy to compare the two hotels as they are both prestige and world famous. The Ritz is smaller but it has more original French style rooms as well as, is in a better location and more near to everything. The only problem is that if you like the night life and also to see more people walking about during the night then you defently have to stay at the George V Hotel. Everything about this hotel is perfection; exceptional rooms, friendly staff prestige public areas with gleaming floors, 19th-century furniture and paintings, unique 17th-century Flemish wall tapestries, glittering chandeliers, and spectacular flower arrangements in the public areas by the world famous floral designer Jeff Leatham. During our stay we had a deluxe room on the 7th floor with the Eiffel Tower View. We also had twice dinner at the hotel's elegant dressed in grey and gold restaurant Le Cinq. The food is exceptional and the waiters very, very frendly. To be honest the staff here are more friendly than in the Ritz's Espandon restaurant. We also had two Spa treatments each which we have found to be very good. The swimming pool is smaller than the Ritz's hotel but it is also very very nice and luxurious. Today back in London we can only say that we shall defently go back to the Four Seasons George V Hotel, not only because it is defently the most prestige hotel in Paris but also for its exceptional service and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymonner's - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello all Paris lovers, Let me start by saying that the few not so kind reviews in here, probably are posted by competitors or very ...strange people. We chose this hotel to be our honeymoon hotel and could not have found a better place! They say it's expensive, and sure that's true. But the value you get for your money here is unbeatable, in my opinion. The minute you walk in to the lobby, you are treated like a princess (or a prince for that matter) no matter who you are or what you want. The receptionists actually knew our names and our special requests, and they made us feel like they have been eagerly awaiting us to visit, without being too familiar. We ordered a deluxe room, and we weren't upgraded. Now, I do realize that a lot of people get offended by not getting a free upgrade when on a honeymoon. But with these rooms, you really can't be either disappointed or offended! They are so oversized and perfect - it's ridiculous. The decor is so stunning and perfect and the quality of the interior is amazing. The double door bathroom was more than perfect with a walk-in shower that easily took 3 people :), a bath tub, a large and beautiful sink and a separate toilet area. The products you get are BVLGARI. What a treat! Needless to say, we brought them with us. The bed and pillows were splendid. We slept like babies. The whole hotel is so well thought trough and the mix of super wealthy and famous people mixed with normal people, is lovely. You have stylish people mixed with no taste people with money. People watching is fun! You can wear casual chic or go for an advanced cocktail dress with some serious diamond accessories, and you'd fit right in. Do what ever you feel like. I wore a cocktail dress a couple of nights, when we had a drink in the bar before going out to dinner. I felt down right gorgeous. The bar-area with piano entertainment was one of our favorites, relaxing, great drinks, coffee and excellent service. The concierge-service was absolutely brilliant, use them! They are such professionals. We had one of our dinners at restaurant "Lasserre" and how amazing it was! I recommend you to take the hotel limousine, it cost a little, but oh such luxury. When you arrive to the restaurant, you feel like you are invited to a mystery club that no one else know of. Two sad looking doors opens magically by 4 people, and you are immediately escorted in to a little secret elevator, covered with dark red velvet, floor to roof, and a bell boy. You go up one level, and when the tiny elevator door opens, you step right in to this magical and decadent restaurant. Brilliant! Go there if you can. It has 2 stars in the M-guide. Restaurant Le Cinq was fully booked all nights of our visit, we had chosen not to make reservations in advance. (you never know what you feel for, once there-theory) but we ate breakfast there every morning!. It is so beautiful in the restaurant and so exquisite. When you are seated, they serve you a freshly made tiny Crème Brule as a pre-starter. IT'S OUT OF THIS WORLD. If you get the right waitress or maitre'd, they actually give you a little chair for the news paper to rest on while you eat. Cute! The pool area and SPA is so incredible, we never wanted to leave. They have people that individually escort you around the area so you know where everything is, the first time you visit. Complementary everything, Evian bottles, tea, juices of all sorts, fruits, XXXXL towels and more. The area itself is so relaxing and beautiful! We took a massage one day, and returned to the pool area, for a swim every day. It was so relaxing to sit in our robes, drinking something good and fresh, small talking with each other. We just enjoyed the moment down there. The locker rooms were extravagant. We ran out like kids in a candy store, to tell each other of how the locker rooms were equipped. You get complementary toothbrush and shaving kits, your own Dermalogica facial products, Redken hair products and as many robes and slippers as you could ever need. I think the key to enjoying anything is to turn down the tempo. Since we've been to Paris several times, we just went for strolls along the Seine and visited cute cafes. But if it's your first time, and you are living at George V – you shouldn’t visit more than one sightseeing thing per day, to keep your sanity. The Eiffel Tower is mandatory, and so is Le Louvre. The other things can wait. Enjoy yourselves at the hotel instead. It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: JAS7578
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite here as part of my honeymoon and was not dissapointed. The hotel is very well appointed just a 5 min walk to the champs elysee and louis vuiton. 15 mins to the Eifel tower. The room was superb in its opulence and left nothing to chance. Dressing gowns, slippers and bulgari toiletries adorned the bathroom area. There are 70 tv channels with mostly arab and foreign channels, british vieweing was left to Sky news and BBC World. The room had a VCR but I requested a DVD player,despite it being late the Dvd was installed and working within 15 mins of the request. The staff are very keen to help and i saw nothing but politeness from everyone I came into contact with. I had in room dining for breakfast and 1 evening meal I am glad I did, There was no deterioration in the quality or the service. prior to arrival I has tried to book a table at le Cinq, I was advised that they were fully booked all weekend for evening meal but could reserve lunch. On arrival I asked the same question and they found me a table for the second night. This restaurantt is well worth a visit but will eat into your budget, so not for the feint hearted. On check out I found that a bar bill of 350 euros had been added to my account that was not mine. This was very quickly resolved, however the cashier did advise that mistakes can happen however those less honest sometimes give the wrong details to avoid payment. So always check your bill. The spa is a haven for relaxation and somewhere that you do not want to leave. Many of the guides recommend the "George Fizz" in the bar, i tried it, it was devine. Savour every minute of your stay and committ it to memory you will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay and Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: W00dy20stkw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a nine day trip to Paris that ended with a two night stay at the George V for my wife's birthday. The service and attention we received were incredible - but maybe that's what one should expect from one from one of the world's best hotels. Our only "hiccup" was in checking in. I had reserved a "city view" room which was not yet available. We tried to explain to the registration desk staff that we had been in Paris for a week and did not need access to our room until much later that day. Notwithstanding this, the staff put us into the first available room which had no view at all. But everything else about our stay was beyond all expectations. I had ordered flowers for my wife to be delivered to the room. The arrangement was spectacular - over 3 dozen pink and yellow long-stem roses. That night when we asked the doorman to help us with a taxi, he asked where we were going to dinner. When I said Taillevent he explained that we couldn't go there in a mere cab, and he got us their Mercedes courtesy car to take us to the restaurant. And the next day when we returned to the room we found, completely complementary, a personalized birthday pastry (their signature mille feuille) from the three-star restaurant, La Cinq, downstairs. My wife had a chance to use the Spa and her experience was wonderful. Our experience was that the staff works very hard to make sure each quest is taken care to the utmost. Whether you are rich and can afford the George V every time you are in Paris or are just looking for a once in a life time experience - plan on a stay at the George V.

Reviews.Title: “A bit like home really!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a superb hotel - the staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough to help you. I woul definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Humility”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel in the world, pure humility from check in to check out. Excellent service and value for money that I have ever had, after a lenghtly stay in Paris what more can one ask for to end a vacation in the George V WOW this will be in the memory banks for many many years to come. Thank you to all at this hotel for humble memories

Reviews.Title: “One of the world's great hotels”
Reviews.Author: chduker
Reviews.Content: The George V is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Of course, design is always a matter of tast, however if you are a traveller seeking out flawless and more importantly consistent service, this is the place to stay. I am glad that most of the reviews reflect my opinion however I do understand if some guests are disappointed when they expect to stay at a top hotel. Still, I can't help but suspect that the review below may be coming from a proud manager of this hotel or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New Year Celebration”
Reviews.Author: amandanyc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a whim for my husband and I for New Years, and am so glad I did. Although it was extremely expensive, it was worth every penny. I could live in the spa alone...even the spa's locker room with Bulgari products! Everything about the hotel was perfection...the staff was so friendly, room service exceptional, restaurant wonderful, rooms beautiful. We had been to Paris before so didn't feel the need to always be sight seeing, so being able to relax in this perfect hotel was a pleasure. And New Year's in Paris was fabulous; the people were so great! We are from New York, and the Champs Elysees was so much more free than Times Square: calm, and friendly...and that was with champagne (not allowed outside in NYC on New Year's Eve). It was a teriffic vacation at a gorgeous hotel...you won't be disappointed. The restaurant at the hotel was an experience in itself...we had a full 5 course meal and stayed for hours...it was unbelievable! The room service was great too (I wanted a caramel sundae at 3 a.m. and got the best one I've ever had in my life). We had a couple's massage in the spa too and it was wonderful! Tea in the lounge was of course perfect as well... It seems I am being redundant because EVERYTHING was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Stay here but ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of being guests of another couple who were staying there. We had drinks at the lounge bar, and ate room service in their room. I must say that throughout our experience, every member of staff we met was courteous yet friendly. The service was excellent and the room we saw was large and very well-furnished. Everything at the hotel oozed quality and luxury. When we left in the early hours of the morning, the doorman very competently and quickly helped us find a taxi when there weren't many about. Everybody is entitled to his/her opinion; but when a previous reviewer gives such a brief and negative review, and gives a star rating of 1 or 2 to all aspects of this world class hotel, you can't help but suspect that the review may be coming from a disgruntled employee or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Pure indulgence”
Reviews.Author: Leo70
Reviews.Content: Every inch of the hotel is plush, elegant and in perfect condition. You often find that in such charismatic and historic hotels their lustre has dimmed, wear and tear bleeds some of the grandeur - but not here. The hotel is beautiful. Before we even arrived the service was wonderful. The hotel arranged a single long stemmed rose on the pillow for when we arrived without any fuss at all, and the concierge made all the arrangements for a wonderfully romantic table at a two michelin-starred restaurant for the evening where I proposed to my girlfriend. The service throughout the hotel is impeccable. The room was beautifully furnished, the toiletries top quality and the bed so comfortable it ached to leave it. The hotel spa, although expensive, was dreamily good. My girlfriend and I had a "Couples Massage" in the VIP spa room. This room had a jacuzzi, a steam room and a sauna. For what I thought was a very reasoable price we had the room to ourselves for a full hour after our massage. Everyone wants the day they get engaged to be memorable but I honestly believe that any stay at this hotel will remain a lasting and wonderful memory on its own merit.

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon Surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: MisterChinn
Reviews.Content: My sister gave us one night at the Four Seasons as our wedding gift. She told them it was our honeymoon, and booked us a standard double. When we arrived and told them our name, they said, "yes, yes, we've been expecting you Mister Chinn. We have a little surprise for you." So I'm thinking maybe a bottle of chamapagne (which they did have), but she goes on to say that they had a cancellation just come in, and since it was our honeymoon, they decided to give us a complimentary upgrade... to one of their BEST SUITES!!! Oh man! My wife and I are not used to such accomodations, remember the original room was a gift in the first place. So here we are getting upgraded to one of the their best suites, wearing our torn jeans and flip-flops. But, they still treated us like royalty. I is an amazing place. The suite (which I looked up later, costs over $2500 a night), was bigger than our condo in San Francisco. It was about 1500 square feet, with a dining room, living room, kitchenette, patio, HUGE walk-in closet, and one and a half baths (in a hotel room!!!) Amazing. the huge four posted bed was so comfortable I forgot where I was when I woke up, simply heaven. The service is really what you pay for with the Four Seasons. We bought some dishes we wanted to make sure made it home, and went down to the conceirge to get some newspaper to wrap them in. He suggested instead that he bring up some bubblewrap and tape personally (and this was at 1 in the morning!). They put postage and mailed our postcards for us. I'm sure some of you are used to such service, but this really was a luxury for a public school teacher such as myself. Everything was perfect at the Four Seasons. We don't think we'll ever stay in that suite again, but for one night in Paris, on our honeymoon, it really made us fans of the Four Seasons for life.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsapot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days during a trip to France. The service here is cannot be surpassed. For example, we were there when the Tour de France finished on the Champs Elysees. The hotel rented a terrace 7 floors above the street so we did not have to wait all day by the road. They provided food, champagne and wine for free. Also, if you are arriving by plane have the hotel arrange to pick you up. An agent met us at the door of the plane and rushed us through customs skipping the long lines. It is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: yereverluvinsis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August to celebrate our Anniversary. We arrived on Sunday morning and found out that the Monday was a bank holiday (15th August) so almost everything would be closed for our stay, which was disappointing. We were thrilled, however, when we were shown our room, which had a huge balcony, luxurious furnishings and a spectacular view from the 7th floor over the whole of Paris. Champagne awaited us on ice, along with white orchids and a beautiful mille feuille anniversary rasberry cake. When I booked the 'Romance package' a week or so earlier, I was asked whether I wanted a 'smoking' or non smoking' room. I replied that my husband did indeed enjoy an occasional cigarette, but that smoking rooms were often inferior to non smoking rooms (as we found out to our cost at Claridges in London.) The girl taking the booking replied that she would, on this occasion, upgrade us, which was much appreciated. I don't agree that the friendliness of the staff is either forced or fake; they are handpicked for their social skills as well as their professional excellence and we all prefer to be treated with courtesy and true manners. The dinner in Le Cinq was, without any doubt, a lifetime experience. If you only have one special meal in your life, then let it be here for you will simply run out of superlatives. It has been well documented in other reviews how good the food is, so take heed of this for it is all true. We had the tasting menu at E210 pp which had many courses, but it is nouvelle cuisine so the actual amount of food you eat isn't enormous. Due to the richness of the dishes you do feel full after the meal, and delicious and different breads are offered throughout your dining. If I have to be negative about anything, then it would be the cost......of course we are all in different financial positions, but even for someone fabulously wealthy, their eyes must water when they are taken to the special room where you pay your bill. You will haemorrhage money from the moment you arrive and when you see the prices of the mini bar you will get a good idea what to expect for the duration of your stay. Also, you must tip in Paris - everyone! And if you have just payed over E100 to have your hair done, E5 will not suffice! Book Spa treatments well in advance as it is disappointing if you cannot get in or be seen at the same time as your partner. The same applies for Le Cinq - luckily we got a cancellation. Go to the Four Seasons Georges V with impunity - you will be speechless at the quality, opulence and excellence which is the best in the world; just make sure you take a very large sum of money indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Tres magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at George V with my girlfriend as a birthday treat; a combination of treating both ourselves to diner at the hotel’s 3 star Michelin accredited Le Cinq restaurant as well as having the option to stop in a luxury hotel for the evening. I had booked a romance package directly with the hotel group, which included fresh flowers and champagne in the room as well as vouchers towards the use of the spa treatment facilities. As a businessman I regularly stay days and weeks in hotels where my own company’s budget often restricts how much I can justify spending. Often I stay in 4 star hotels as I need some home comforts as a reward for my hard work and staying away for so long. Occasionally I will stay at 5 star hotels for the added luxury and pampering, however, there should be a correlating improvement in service and facilities, but alas this is rarely true. I have stayed at the nearby Lancaster, which is excellent but the charms and expectations of George V intrigued me, despite the significant price differential. Well, it was a treat so I figured lets enjoy it and find out for ourselves why the George V is revered as the best city hotel in the world. Upon arrival the reception staff greeted us warmly and in fluent English and even those not attending to us acknowledged us with engaging smiles and occasional conversation. An added value to the service was that we were even escorted to our room by one of the staff to explain the room’s layout and entertainment centres. The room we were allocated was absolutely fantastic and today we cannot believe how fortunate we were. We were indeed privileged. I could write for hours on how spectacular the room was but all I can suggest is book this hotel and see for yourselves. The spa was excellent and we enjoyed a long massage in sumptuous surroundings, which relaxed us both before going to dine at Le Cinq. The food, as to be expected at a restaurant of this calibre, was absolutely delicious, however, what made the experience that much more enjoyable and memorable was the involved attention and enthusiasm of the waiters who were quite superb. I suppose at this end of the luxury hotel scale cost is immaterial. True it is expensive relative to lesser hotels, however, there can be no real comparison. The George V must be experienced at least once in a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: westender
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice. Don't expect boutique, it's not!. But you do get a good level of professionalism and security. The General mananger is a bit distant (if you need to contact him ) besides that, you're sure to enjoy your trip. Just be aware that the area can get quite rough at night

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: helr
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Georges V on Friday July 8th. Their attention to detail & their welcome of my daughter was excellent. But, there was something missing. The service was excellent, but not exceptional. I was extremely disappointed to return to my room on Saturday at 2pm, after sightseeing for 5 hours - to find that it was still not made up. I spoke to the manager and had a free meal to compensate, but still it was a real let down. Personally, I much prefer the Ritz. Something more oasis-like about it. For a romantic weekend a deux, the Ritz is the tops - but I have to say that Georges V really did make a fuss of my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ... Period”
Reviews.Author: whostl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the best ... look no further. Rooms, service, location, food, ammenities ... whatever you're looking for ... it's here. The employee / guest ratio is amazing and it's reflected in the service level. From the doorman to the maids, they all speak to you by name. Yes, it's expensive, but well worth it. The Ritz, Plaza Athenee are nice, but the George V is head and shoulders above in service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experiences... Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MumbleBaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights in a Premier room. I absolutely loved it!! The lobby is grand, the staffs were very efficient and friendly and the room couldn't have been more perfect. It is spacious and very very comfortable. We have a walk-in closet and a marbled bathroom. The bed is big and the pillows are fluffy. The breakfast, too, was excellent. The service is impeccable and I would certainly go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: MikeCSantaBarbaraUSA
Reviews.Content: I read a recent Zagat survey which gave the Georges V the best rating in the world. I would wholeheartedly concur. I have stayed at many great hotels, though not all, and it is difficult to imagine how the Georges V could be better. My wife and I thought about it afterwards and there was not one thing we would have changed or had them do differently. It was as perfect as perfect could be. This was our second stay at the hotel and both were total perfection. We have stayed at some of the oriental hotels known for top of the world servce, but none compares, not even the Peninsula in Hong Kong. When you add onto all of this the fact Le Cinq (Michelin rates as best restuarant in Paris) is in the hotel, what more could you ask? Yes, it is damn expensive, but the value is there.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Seasons Hotel George V Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 31 Av George V | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
